Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the family”
Reviews.Author: ItsmeFifi
Reviews.Content: Clean and family oriented hotel. Like that there is a laundry facility. The pool is a bit on the smaller side however. I love the free breakfast they offer in the morning, made to order omelletes, home made cream of wheat and oatmeal, not from the mix, fruit, yougurt, cereal, rolls, bagels, something for everyone. There is an outback restaurant on site. The hotel staff however arent outwardly friendly. Its about 4 blocks from the beach, definately NOT BEACH FRONT.

Reviews.Title: “FAKE "$50 DEPOSIT"...THEY STOLE OUR MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: Lexy b
Reviews.Content: While the grounds of the hotel are nice, the staff was a joke! At check in they told us we have to submit a $50 CASH DEPOSIT, while I was sure I didn't read anything about this on the website we paid it anyway. While checking out to head off to the cruise port the "deposit" was not returned. After several calls to management and head office we were given the run around and told we would receive a check in the mail........5 months later and still waiting. Do yourself a BIG FAVOR and stay at La Concha!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katherine1013
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there in March for one night prior to a cruise. We arrived after midnight and were told we were booked and charged for 2 rooms. A phone call corrected that. We booked and pre-paid for one night, we thought. Upon check out we had a resort fee tacked on. Paid in full means that to me, and add ons are a sneaky way to get more money. We cruise a lot out of Puerto Rico and will try a different hotel next March.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the price....”
Reviews.Author: M82Traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly upon checking in that evening... Not so much at checkout. Free drinks in the lobby at 5:30 and VERY accomidating bartenders! Adequate hotel for a quick layover. M82

Reviews.Title: “Better then Most in the Chain”
Reviews.Author: gscar35
Reviews.Content: A standard Embassy Suites in the catagories of room and overall hotel design. The room was comfortasble and very clean. Where I feel this hotel shines above most in the chain is the staff. I stay in this hotel 2 or 3 times a year for business and my associates stay several other times a year. We find the manager's reception very good. The bar service is usually quick and with a smile. Though it can get rather crowded, they do well to keep the lines moving. The breakfast is very good and there are pleanty of places to sit. Overall a decent place, which is why we return so often.

Reviews.Title: “As always embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: tajkd
Reviews.Content: Always nice to stay here. We were bumped and had to stay a night in the airport jot. The rooms are clean. The happy hour was free. The entertainment was exceptional. Great and enjoyable night here.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok...”
Reviews.Author: RoseWashington
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that this was our first trip to Puerto Rico and we LOVED it here. Loved it so much that we have had a REALLY hard time adjusting to home again and we can't wait to come back soon. As far as the Embassy Suites: Pros:1. The room is a suite. Anyone with small children knows this is important. We could put the kids down for bed or nap and still be in our living room talking and that was great. 2. They serve free breakfast every morning and than we only needed a small lunch or snack before dinner. 3. They have a managers reception at night with snacks, juices, pop, and drinks. We stopped here every night before we left the hotel for dinner. It was a great before dinner appetizer that helped hold all of us over before our later dinner. 4. The beach was beautiful during the week. The Embassy Suites section was nice and it was great to have chairs, towels and umbrellas at the beach. 5. The pool, although crowded, was nice and perfect for the kids to play in for hours while I could read a book. Cons: 1. It's not that clean people. We have traveled to a lot of Embassy Suites and this one is by far the dirtiest one we've stayed at. At first glance the rooms look clean, but then you start looking in the corners, at the carpet, under any furniture, closer at the fixtures in the bathroom and you can tell that these rooms haven't been deep cleaned in a LONG time. Gross 2. One the weekend it was crazy crowded. We had to wait 20 minutes in the breakfast line, and same for managers reception. It was hard to find seats and could barely find anywhere around the pool. That thing that was the worst was the cleanliness at the meals during the busy weekend. For example, the bacon tray had more bacon hanging outside on the counter than in the actual tray. I looked at my husband and said is that supposed to be decoration or something? It was gross and wouldn't pass food codes for sure. I understand that they are busy on the weekends but then that shouldn't surprise them, and they should bring in more staff to handle the bigger crowds. 3. The front desk staff were not great. They were friendly, but always talking to other co-workers and I felt bad interrupting them. I would go down there and ask for towels to be delivered to the room, it never happened. 4. We pre-paid for our trip on the embassy website and it said it covers all taxes and fees. They racked on more than $300 worth of taxes before we checked out. I went to the counter and showed them my receipts and they weren't willing to budge at all. So frustrating when you prepay for things. If they have a "special tax" then they should add that in when you prepay. Overall we again LOVED PR, an amazing island with great culture and even better Puerto Rican food. I highly recommend going to see El Morro fort, the El Yunque rain forest, going to Luquillo beach and check out all the food stands, and our favorite going to Old San Juan and spend the day there. As for the Embassy Suites, I wouldn't be that excited to stay there again. It worked for us mainly because we were traveling with small children but I would not be that excited to stay there again. Honestly I would stay somewhere closer to Old San Juan...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel BUT Beware of Add'l Hotel FEES”
Reviews.Author: puyallupgirl
Reviews.Content: We were there from 4/6 - 4/13. We were looking for a nice hotel that was still family friendly and close to the beach. Also to be honest, the fact that the Embassy Suites offers a full breakfast was a huge draw for us as we were traveling with two children. We looked at other hotels that were comparable in price. At the time the much-glitzier El San Juan was not that much more a night, but we knew that breakfast for four in PR could easily be $40- $50 a day (unless you go to Burger King, and that's not really not our style), therefore we went with Embassy Suites. The location is great, right off the freeway, which worked for us because we did a lot of sightseeing outside of the Isla Verde area. The hotel itself was nice, the pool area was somewhat small but very kid-friendly. The rooms were very spacious and large, they can stand to be updated, but they were fine. The breakfast was great. Since we were there during Easter we went to Easter Brunch at the Hilton Caribe and spent $27 per person on a breakfast buffet that I swear was only slightly better than the breakfast at the Embassy Suites! Lesson learned! The Embassy Suites offers a great Managers Reception every night, which offers free cocktails and light snack foods, and there are soft drinks for the kiddos. The casino was a nice added bonus, I think we played down there one evening and there were a lot of slots and great live music. Drawbacks: Check-in time is LATE and there is no early check-in. I will give them the benefit of the doubt becasue we arrived on a very busy weekend (tail end of Puerto Rican springbreak), but they were not flexible on checking in early and I wasn't able to get my room until 4:30 and we had been in town since noon. We were exhausted and had to sit in the lobby with all our suitcases after flying 11 hours from Seattle. The restaurants at the hotel are no bueno. I mean who wants to eat at Outback when you are in Puerto Rico?? Maybe some American tourists consider that fun to eat at a sub-par Austrailian chain restaurant when you are on vacation on a beautiful, tropical carribean island, but that is not my idea of fun AT ALL. There is another small restaurant/bar on location called El Patio. Do not go there. My Dad was visiting our hotel one night and ordered an order of Nachos - to his disturbed surprise they were made with Cheez Wiz and they were not cheap. Drinks here are also VERY pricey for watered-down small drinks (tiny, watered-down Margarita was like $9, during happy hour it's like $5, not worth it, just get the free drinks at the managers reception). The only other drawback is that it is not on the beach, next time we go we will probably try to be on the beach. But the fact that Embassy Suites has a section of the beach reserved where you can get lounge chairs and umbrellas went a long way towards making up for it. It's not a far walk at all and it worked out very well for us. BEWARE of additional hotel fees. When we checked out there were an additional $400 in hotel fees tacked onto our bill!!! Next time we will be sure to verify any fees prior to reserving. I don't know if this is common practice in PR or for Embassy Suites or what - but this was highly disturbing. So that reasonable nightly rate may not be so reasonable after all. Parking is also $16/day, but we were aware of that before we got there. Overall we would come back here again, especially with the kiddos, it was a very family-friendly hotel, we will just be sure to verify any fees in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Husband doesn't like to Travel but...”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: I was on egg shells about traveling to a new hotel with the husband and 16 year old who are homebodies. I was pleasantly surprised with the made to order breakfast for my husband and persnickety teenager. My husband enjoyed staying at the hotel and could smoke his aromatic cigars outside while my daughter and I went sightseeing on our own. Buses and cabs close by to explore. Beach is 10 minutes away. We had the Suite/Wheels deal which worked out well but the hotel charges $16.00 plus tax to keep the car at the hotel. I think next time we won't rent a car. The manager's special with free drinks made my husband as happy as a pig in mud. Overall I think it was a good deal for the price and is a good value. Stayed 4/10-4/15 Adios, Ada

Reviews.Title: “Perfect holiday w/ the right hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC_K_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Embassy Suites in San Juan from April 6-9, 2012. We arrived at 2:30am in San Juan airport and swore we would have been stranded. A pleasant surprise to find out that there were lots of van taxis right outside baggage claim. The taxi ride to the hotel is approximately 5 mins. and a $15 flat rate plus $1 per bag. The hotel exterior is very grand, so is the lobby and courtyard with all the ponds and plants. We had a seamless check in and the front desk staff is very helpful and professional. Our suite can accommodate 6 people comfortably and the rooms look exactly like they do online. Pool area is very nice and pool bar cocktails were excellent. We loved the complimentary hot breakfast every morning and manager's reception was also a nice touch. I HIGHLY recommend the tours from Dragonfly Adventures at the concierge desk because their excursions are more than worth it with professional employees such as Bianca. She was the BEST and very knowledgeable of San Juan and recommended restaurants, nightlife activities and even had our names added to the list at BRAVE nightclub for my birthday which was great. I will definitely be back to this hotel on my next visit to San Juan, but this time with a larger group.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break with Family”
Reviews.Author: cwoodsg
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time back to the Embassy Suites and we had a great time! Its the Embassy Suites so I dont have high end expecations. Its great for kids and families. The pool was great for my kids and the breakfast was standard, but it was fine. I am not very picky when it comes to food, so what they had fulfilled me. The beach is about a 5 minute walk which is great and they even have chairs and towels awaiting for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: Roland C
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at this hotel and we will go back next Spring. The hotel is very close to the airport, walking distance to the beach, walking distance to many fast food places. The hotel and casino are clean and well organized. The employees are polite and professional. We even had a chance to deal with the manager Irene -who are great. Oh almost forgot-the breakfast is a real breakfast and its free.

Reviews.Title: “Fine For a One-Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: GinnyAlamo
Reviews.Content: Our extended family of nine spent the last night of our Puerto Rico vacation at the Embassy Suites San Juan Hotel & Casino. We chose this hotel due to it's proximity to the airport. The rooms were very clean and exactly what you would expect from an Embassy Suites Hotel. The hotel was in walking distance to the beach but you did have to walk a few short blocks to get to the beach. We enjoyed the happy hour but didn't enjoy the very long lines waiting to order the drinks. It was extremely crowded. We arrived earlier than the check-in time due to the fact that we were driving from Rincon. Of course our rooms were not ready. We left our luggage in the cars and went to the beach. This is the fourth property I've stayed at in San Juan. I would return for a one-night stay only. I've stayed at other properties that are actually on the beach and just a little bit more money but if you're a hard-core beach person like me, it's definitely worth the extra money to stay on the beach. There were also a lot of kids here! We didn't use the pool or have the complimentary breakfast. Since a lot of travelers stay here due to its proximity to the airport, I recommend that they serve the breakfast beginning at 5:30 am instead of the 7:00 am! Every staff member any of us came in contact with was very, very nice and tried their best to help.

Reviews.Title: “CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD ACCOUNT BEFORE YOU CHECKOUT”
Reviews.Author: 2bytheshore
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this the Embassy Suites March 29-31. We had a 2 bd/2 bth/1 king/ 2 dbl/ 14% resort fee suite. When we arrived the outside staff was very pleasant but it went down hill quickly. I walked up to the front desk and the woman (unfortunately I can't remember her name, she was so personable) didn't even look up from her computer. She said continuing to look down and said "Yes". I told her that we were checking in and she said our room wasn't ready yet. This was about 2:00. She said come back at 3:00. So we just walked around. We couldn't go out to the pool area because you needed a key to get out and in. We decided to eat so we ate at the hotel bar area. There was 2 other tables with 2 each and it took awhile to even get menus. 1 person was working the restaurant and bar area. We ordered 4 appetizers and drinks. After 45 minutes of waiting for apps I asked if they we coming out soon. She said, I'll check. She brought out 3 and forgot 1. I asked about the Fried Raviolis and she said "Oh we are out of those". Whatever. At 3:00 I went back to the desk and the talked to miss nice and she said that our room still wasn't ready yet. Even though keys for other rooms were being handed out left and right. She said come back at 3:30. We once again went and sat waiting. Luckily there are sitting areas in the lobby to wait. Went back at 3:30 and 1 of our rooms were ready. She gave me the key and I asked her to check on the adjoining room. And surprise it was ready. She proceeded to hand me a form to initial and sign for the 14% resort fee and a $50.00 a night incidentals fee and asked for my credit card. I told her that the rate that I paid online included the 14% resort fee. It turned very ugly from there. She said it did not include it so I showed her my paperwork proving it. She took the paper and turned the page and said here it is. Not included. I asked her to show me where it was printed and she kept saying it was in there. She could never show me where it was. I wasn't signing the form and needed to speak to a manager. Another surprise, she wasn't available. She finally showed up and said that it wasn't included in my rate (which it was) and she wanted to make me happy so she would wave it. ($90.00). Which was interesting since I had already paid it. We went up to our room and it was fine for what we needed. We got alittle settled, went down to the pool and then dinner at the Outback. Just like any other. The buffet breakfast the next day was ok. Walked over to the Walgrens and then onto the beach for awhile. Like others have said, there is an area for free chairs, umbrellas and towels. Nice guy working this area. Then, back to the hotel and took a taxi into to Old San Juan ($23 for 6 people). Walked around and had dinner at Cafe San Juan. On the way back another guy tried to charge us $30 but I said that it was $23 coming so how could it be $30 going back. We gave him $25. The next day was checkout. After reading many Trip Advisor reviews (thank you very much) about this hotel with fraudulent issues on that charge cards I decided to go online to my discover account while sitting at the breakfast table. OMG. The hotel had charged us $49.00 a day for the resort fee, $100.00 for incidentals and $267.00 for something that was unexplainable. I walked up to the front desk to speak to a manager. Melvin said "don't worry about the charges they are just on hold". What are they for, Melvin. Melvin needs a course in people skills. Of course, there was no manager around so I said find one. 30 minutes someone would be here. I went back to the table and brought up my account again and everything was in the authorization mode. I called Discover and explained that I paid for my room in advance back in January. There should be no charges from this hotel at all for anything. She transfered me to the Security/Fraud unit. I talked to them and explained the situation. She asked if I was still on the premises and I said yes. I walked back up to the desk and Jose was finally there. I told him that he needed to bring up the charges on the computer and he kept saying "don't worry". I asked what the $267 was for and he just kep saying I don't know. WHAT. I then proceeded to tell him that I was on the phone with the Discover fraud unit and they wanted to speak with him. PRICELESS moment. I quess not many people bring up there credit card accounts while at a hotel. He was told that all the fraudelent charges had gone thru to authorization and they needed to be taken off. While talking to Discover on my cell phone he proceeded to hand me 2 cheap Embassy suites tee shirts and 2 cheap zipper travel bags (which 1 zipper broke the first day). CHECK CHECK CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD ACCOUNTS IF YOU CAN BEFORE YOU LEAVE THIS HOTEL. Watch what you sign and if you know that your rate included the 14% resort fee which is really crazy anyway, don't initial the box on the paperwork they give you when you checkin. If I hadn't checked my accounts we would have had over $400.00 in charges that were not legal charges when we got home. Will never stay here again! Rooms were nice and were fine for what we needed. From from the minute we walked into this hotel the front desk staff and bar staff were rude and unfriendly. They really should take a class in people skills. If you don't like dealing with the public then get another job. But from the second they get you in they have you. Especially if you pay in advance with a non-refunable rate like we had. They can treat you however they want which is what happened. Can't wait for the manager response on this one. It will be a big bandaid to try and cover this up.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out on the morning right after arriving”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo F
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Embassy Suite property I have visited. It was absolutely disappointing. I was not able to sleep the whole night due to the musty smell in the room. It is pretty run down and around the property (parking lot and public areas) it is full of garbage left by uneducated people. I have booked it for 3 weeks but I checked out the morning after I arrived and I did not even slept well on that night. Among the best features it is the cooked to order breakfast and modest casino for gamblers. I don't gamble, so I didn't even go there, but it is there. There is also a Outback Steakhouse here which is pretty nice, but I did not dine in. I would never stay at this hotel again, I would spend an extra $20 a night and stay somewhere else nicer. I have stayed at Best Westerns which had much better rooms than this property. Extremely disappointed !

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool for an airport hotel, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: cjb11711
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites San Juan Hotel and Casino for one night in March 2012. It was okay for a one night stay but I would not recommend it for any more than that. The only thing that I thought was particularly nice about this hotel was the pool area. It has a beautiful pool area with a great area for the kids. They also provide (as part of your $25 resort fee) use of free inflatables for the pool. I didn't think this hotel had particularly good service. The check-in line (at 11:30pm) was extremely long and slow. The desk clerk was nice enough and accommodated my request for a room as far from the atrium as possible because there was a live band playing in the lobby and I was travelling with a child who needed to get some sleep. If you are not familiar with Embassy Suites, you should know that just about all of the rooms on every floor open up to a large atrium and though it's nice enough to look at, it allows you to hear noise from every single floor and the lobby because of the open set-up. When I made my reservation, I requested a crib for my child and I also mentioned it when I checked in, but it took quite a while to get the crib. I had to call down to the desk to ask for it again. My room rate ($199 plus tax & resort fee) also came with parking but no one at the front desk mentioned anything about parking to me, and when I asked about it, they (a) did not give me complete information and (b) seemed like any annoyance to them. Finally, we planned to eat in the lobby restaurant before checking out of the hotel, and I asked the bartender for a high chair. She said she'd get one and then never moved a muscle to actually go grab one, so after 5 minutes of standing around, we left. It didn't really leave a nice impression on my whole experience. I would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: superwoman_200
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Embassy Suites in Vegas multiple times and loved it. We just needed a place to stay near the airport for the last night of our trip since we had an early flight. We got a great deal on this hotel through Priceline but I was still extremely disappointed. We tried to check in at 2:00 (check in is at 3) and our room wasn't ready so that was disappoingint. We didn't get back to check in until 11:30pm and the line to check in was huge. There was one person working the front desk so I waited forever. The guy at check in was not friendly and he didn't give me any information about parking. When I asked, he said we had to go and park then come back to the front desk and get a parking voucher. This was annoying especially since we only had a few hours to sleep before our flight the next day. The parking garage was not helpful for people with luggage (aka all guests) and I got a parking voucher but the next morning, we couldn't get out of the garage with it! It was 6am and we had a flight to catch and all the doors except the front of the hotel were locked! So I had to jump out, sprint through the sprinklers to the front door and ask for help. The guy at the front (same as the night before) was so unhelpful and referred me to the parking valet. They helped me get out but it was a huge hassle and wasted time when I was in a hurry! Our room was clean and nice except for the light in the bathroom seemed to be falling apart. It was quiet and we had no problems and just went to bed for a few hours so I can't say a lot about it other than that. After the parking garage debacle, I got home to find out I was charged an additional $17 for parking! I was furious because we were hotel guests AND NO ONE MENTIONED THIS TO ME. Our car was in the garage for about 6 hours and $17 was absurd. I called the hotel and argued about it since I was truly unhappy with many things and after several calls and a few days, they refunded me the money. I'm really happy and grateful for the help I received, but overall, I would not recommend this place and I don't plan on staying there again. It was only a few minutes from the airport which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: PDWilliams
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites in San Juan the night before our cruise. The rooms were huge, beds comfortable, the managers reception was generous in drinks and some snacks. The pool was lovely and they had a few nice restaurants onsite. The staff were really friendly and helpful. All around a solid place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Large Party? Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: Betws13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a layover between flight and cruise. Hotel is in a good location (close to airport and cruise terminal) but there is no shuttle bus to either, meaning $20+ taxi rides are compulsory with many drivers adding extra charges for large parties and baggage. Our room was described as a 2 bedroom suite, but was actually a living area with sofa bed and a bedroom with two small double beds. Having a party of 5, a 2 bedroom suite would have been more than suitable, but the doubles weren't big enough for two people to sleep comfortably meaning 2 of us were made to sleep on the VERY uncomfortable sofa bed (so uncomfortable in fact that we ended up taking the cushions off the sofa's and sleeping on them on the floor for 3 nights, something you don't want after 23 hours of travelling.) There were not enough towels, cups, tea/coffee or pillows and it took three calls and a visit to reception for them to provide us with these. When we asked about the beds we were told that we would not receive help due to booking through HOTELS.COM. The bathroom has no natural light so is very dark due to the lack of artificial lighting also. Our room was 623 opposite the elevators, something that made it noisy at night. Can't complain about breakfast, acceptable especially seen as it was free! There was plenty of loungers at the pool but the pool itself was dirty and cold. Laundry facilities were good. Don't recommend the Outback Steakhouse. Our server was rude and incompetent and lost our debit card! She was never around to assist us and the food was very disappointing. Have stayed at many budget hotels that have been more pleasant that this, a hotel that claims to be part of the Hilton group. Being a Hilton Honours member I am very disappointed with this stay and won't be returning due to the reasons above.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: RussRamz
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth Embassy Suite property I have visited. While it wasn't the worst, it wasn't the best. Customer service was good, but upon entering the room, there was an instant musty smell. Like all Embassy Suite's, the bathroom has no adequate exhaust ventilation so after taking a shower, the moisture in the air has nowhere to go, but make the entire room feel damp. This is a design flaw in every Embassy Suite hotel I have stayed. It just is a bit worse here since we are so close to the beach. Breakfast was great and there is a nice bar and modest casino for gamblers. I don't gamble, so I wasn't able to make an opinion one way or the other. There is an Outback Steakhouse here. I was initially very excited, but the food was lousy. I ordered a petit fillet mignon with mushroom sauce. My steak was undercooked and the cut of meat was very stringy with tendon material--it wasn't a grocery store quality cut of meat--very disappointing. I also ordered a Caesar salad and the shredded parmesan cheese tasted and felt like it was from the heel of the block of cheese. There was no salty flavor--it felt like plastic. The steamed vegetables were sad as well. The steamed baby carrots on my plate weren't cooked and tasted like they came from a bag. Oh yea, one more thing. The service was third-string at best. I had my salad at my table, but it took 10 minutes to get the attention of someone to get a fork. It wasn't until my main plate came that someone was available to get a set of forks and a knife. Overall the hotel was average, but the in-house Outback Steakhouse was a huge letdown.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a layover....”
Reviews.Author: TravelCapl
Reviews.Content: We are at the San Juan Resort & Casino now, having arrived late last night. The hotel is only about 5-10 minutes from the airport - a standard $19 cab ride. We arrived at the hotel at about 11:15, and had an easy check-in. We had reserved a 2 BR suite - and were very happy with its spaciousness. (it's actually two adjoining rooms - a private king bedroom with a separate living are complete with desk, sofa(bed) and easy chair. The other room had two double beds). There were three large flat screen tv's and two full baths between the two rooms. Blackout curtains made it easy to sleep, and no noticeable noise from outside. We freshened up upon arrival, and went down for a quick drink and bite to eat. Food was quite good. The casino was open, and there was live music, giving the lobby a festive, but not overly loud, atmosphere. In addition the the lobby bar, there is an outback steakhouse, and a little deli-like place. Breakfast was included, and it had the standard buffet fare, along with an omelet station. They had wonderful espresso and hot milk...a personal treat!! By 9, the breakfast area is jammed, and you have to look for a seat, but with perseverance, generally something is available. The pool area is nice and clean. Ample seating, friendly staff. There is a pool bar that opens at 11:30. I spoke with several people who were staying at the hotel for a longer period. They complemented the hotel on location (not far from beach), breakfast, and size of rooms. Something for all ages. We are renting a villa in Humacao for the next week, but the Embassy Suites San Juan was a perfect place to start our trip after a late-night arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Resort Feel w/out Downtown Resort Prices”
Reviews.Author: DCBoater
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3/25 to 3/29 and had a great time. Like most Embassy Suites, big rooms and the gaint atrium was a great place for breakfast and the free happy hours, or just to hang-out at the resturant. Had takeout burgers from the Outback Resturant and used the laundry and work-out room. Once you went outside, the beach was a few blocks away, but the hotel provides lounge chairs & umbrellas for free. Every where we looked around the hotel, we found stores and shops we needed, too many to list. So if you're in San Juan on business or with the family and don't want to pay resort prices, try this place.

Reviews.Title: “OK Property if staying near SJU”
Reviews.Author: lanzmo
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late after being delayed from JFK. It is located about 5 minutes from SJU and with small kids and a 1am arrival we needed some sleep. Upon check in we got the kids ready for bed and ventured on to the other room to relax and watch some TV. The TV did not work and we could not call down for maintenance because they would have stirred our kids out of their sleep. We were in room 743. Of course the kids were up early and we had breakfast and were on to Fajardo....

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: TampaNugget
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3/21 - 3/23, 5th floor. Condition of room was good overall, not perfect; it had a slow draining tub that I mentioned on checkout. Reasonably quiet room. Comfortable bed with lots of pillows made sleeping very easy to do. Entrance Room (two-room suite) had sofa sleeper, tv, desk etc. with wet bar, microwave, refrigerator & coffee maker. Bathroom was clean and adequate with the usual amenities. Hallway outside my room needed better attention when vacuumed; corners had noticeable dust, debris. Outback Steakhouse in lobby was very good and the same as I am used to in the States. Hotel features a very nice atrium where complementary full breakfast is served each morning ( buffet and also made to order omelets, eggs). I did not have time to visit the business center, gym or pool, casino but general upkeep of the property appeared to be very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoBSUBroncos
Reviews.Content: We finally arrived late into San Juan after some flight issues, and this hotel was perfect. Unfortunately, we missed the manager's drink reception, but it was quiet overnight and the breakfast was very good. Not real happy with the $25 "resort fee"... if you're going to charge this fee as mandatory to everybody, then include it in the room rate. If it's not a mandatory fee and truly only for people that use the "resort" (which is explained as the pool area, children's area and fitness centers), then make it an optional fee for the guests that actually use those areas. As I stated, we got in late, slept in, had breakfast and were gone, so no resorting for us to have anything to do with the fee that has to be paid... Minor gripe for an otherwise very nice hotel located extremely convenient to the airport and just a 10 -15 minute cab ride from the cruise ship pier.

Reviews.Title: “Free Drinks and Food!”
Reviews.Author: SizzlingSkies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with my parents-in-law and sister-in-law recently spend a night here after taking a cruise. I was hesitant about staying here, because I am quite picky about hotels and would consider myself a germaphobe and was nervous after reading some of the reviews for this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel and almost wish we had had more time to spend there. It was much nicer than I expected. The lobby area is beautiful (in fact, there was even a wedding taking place right in the lobby when we arrived). The rooms were a little outdated, but were very clean. We had a 2 bedroom suite (one bedroom had a king bed and one bedroom had two full sized beds) with 2 bathrooms and a common living room. The layout worked wonderfully with a different access door to each bedroom and a connecting door between the two areas. After a long week we decided we wanted to take it easy and stay on the premises for the evening. There was a very large pool area, a casino, several restaurants and a store located right at the hotel and accessible from the lobby. The best part was that from 5:30pm-7:30pm the hotel's bar was open and the drinks were free, you just had to go up and tell the bartender what drink you wanted. Each time we went up, the bartender gave us two drinks of whatever we said. They also had all you can eat free fresh popcorn and free tortilla chips with salsa. We spent the night playing cards and having a few drinks and food. Overall it was a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ynievs
Reviews.Content: It is not on the beach but it is a block away of one of the best beaches in the area. The hotel offers a complementary buffet breakfast and two hours free drinks during the evening (Rum punch is a must). It has a nice pool and good atmosphere. Around $180-200 per night it is worth it. The rooms are suites of course. They have a separate sitting area, microwave and fridge. There is a casino and an Outback steakhouse on property. The parking fee is additional around $12 per day. The hotel is located next to the International Airport and it gets a bit noisy but somehow not in your room. Iâ€™m a local and I love this place as it offers good value. The service is good. You can get anything delivered to the hotel. There is a Ponderosa and many other fast food places nearby. You can find cheaper places around but not with this quality. You wonâ€™t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shirley w
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb, 2012 pre cruise and this was one of the best hotels that we have ever, ever stayed at. The staff were great, the room excellent, the pool wonderful. I just cannot recommend this hotel enough. You will not be disappointed! Great family hotel as well. Also there are taxies lined up all day and night to take you wherever you need to go, but be aware some taxies charge about $10.00 more for the same trip and then they want a tip. We took one taxi to the pan america cruise terminal and it was $20.00 and then coming back from the cruise terminal we stayed at the hotel next to embassy suites which was a horrible hotel but that is another review all together, but anyways the ride back was $34.00. You may want a verbal before you ride in there taxi. The hotel was so clean and just perfect....wish I were there now.

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for your purpose”
Reviews.Author: boogyp
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a bit of updating in the suites, but it was perfectly located. Within 5 minutes from the airport; 10 minute drive from Old San Juan; A couple of walkable blocks to the main road; another block to a very nice public beach. The amenities within were great - restaurants, casino, pool. Front desk personnel were very nice and helpful. I would stay here again as a starting/stopping point; not for us (4 adults) for longer than a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: nk416
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great amenities!! Service was awesome!! The happy hour was great def get the rum punches were really good!! Breakfast is also good!! Location is good and safe!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but stole my credit card”
Reviews.Author: Mike-TTUHSC
Reviews.Content: I used my chase visa card only once in puerto rico, to pay for my embassy suites hotel bill in December 2011. 3 months later (last week), an individual in PR began spending $1000/day on the card until visa canceled the card. I do not have proof that it was an employee at that hotel. But I find this very suspicious. If no one else complains of the same thing, call it a fluke. On the other hand, the hotel was actually very nice. The lines at breakfast were long, but the food was good. The pool area was great, the beach area was also a nice touch. Overall I would stay there again, but I would watch my credit card bills closely.

Reviews.Title: “Great family Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brandon H
Reviews.Content: The rooms and service were what I have come to know from Embassy suites. Very nice clean hotel and the kids had a blast. Friday and Saturday night the hotel came alive with local selling products in the large lobby and a band playing in the casino. The casino was a small but good addition to the hotel. Pool was great and the kids pool area was perfect for keeping the little ones entertained. There were a few problems like I returned from my trip to find my room door propped open (nothing was stolen), and breakfast was OK at best (a lot of people to cook for). Great hotel if you have more than 4 people to a room and the free breakfast and drinks help cut down on cost you would have to spend otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “not Embassy Suites standards”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for four nights in March. Their website said "two bedroom suite". When we arrived, there was only one bedroom and the sitting area with a sofa bed. I have stayed at many other Embassy Suites and know that this is their standard room and checked their websites which all describe this room as a "two room suite". I would expect that the brand would use the same terminology throughout their websites. Further, the car rental agency (Vias) that has a direct line in the hotel and was recommended by the concierge lied to us about the cost of the car. On the upside, the pool was very nice. There are other places nearby that seemed nicer and closer to the beach for about the same money. I will try those next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but tried to double charge us”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler768
Reviews.Content: Overall very good. Rooms were excellent for the price we paid, beds comfortable, front desk was helpful, and breakfast was decent. Beautiful pool and beach area. But, it was too good to be true. We booked 2 rooms and charged all our activities to only one of the rooms so there would be no confusion. The bills showed for this as well, one being much higher. Once we were all checked out, paid for the activities, and were already home, the hotel tried to bill us twice! We called multiple times and at one point the woman at the front desk pretended she could not find our reservation, like we didn't stay there! Then when we asked for another copy of both bills, they only sent us a copy of our activity vouchers, which even proved that the charges should have only been charged to one room because only one room was listed on the voucher. They have not been very understanding or helpful at all and now we have to go through our credit card company because the hotel refuses to reimburse us. I have never experienced anything like this.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Post Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: VancouverTripper
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised about all that this Embassy Suites had to offer. From a special free cocktail happy hour to full buffet breakfast, live nightly entertainment, spacious suites, exceptional, friendly service to a fun casino atmosphere. The swimming pool was beautiful and the photos of this property does not do it justice. They offer a full service at a beach situated within five minutes of the hotel, too. Outback Restaurant is conveniently situated within the hotel. The rooms were spacious, clean and the beds were ever so comfortable. It is close to the airport for convenience and only a fifteen minute taxi to the cruise terminal. I'd recommend this hotel over and above the others we saw as it offered a resort-like setting and tremendous value. We visited Old San Juan both days we were there and always looked forward to returning to our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Chrisknowsbest
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here two days prior to our cruise. We liked the room that had a nice view of the airplanes landing at the San Juan airport nearby; the windows kept out any noise. Our two sons slept on the pull-out sofa bed, which was a little uncomfortable. Included in the price was breakfast, including made to order omlettes, and snacks and in the afternoon. Because I am a HHonors Diamond member our family got to use the express line for this each day. There was a very nice pool area for our family to enjoy, including a hot tub and kiddie pool. Because of the proximity to the airport, one hears every take-off and landing, though that didn't really bother us. We had lunch at the pool each day, and dinner one night at the Outback Steakhouse on site. These were both more expensive than on the mainland, but not out of line with typical Caribbean resort prices. My wife and I each used a coupon for a $10.00 matching wager on an even money bet on either blackjack or roulette. We each won then cashed out. The beach, restaurants, shops and hotels were a two block walk away. We paid for this stay using HHonors points! All in all it was a great stay; I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay, but wouldn't pay top $ again!”
Reviews.Author: SASB88
Reviews.Content: We paid three hundred a night for this hotel (2 bedroom which was just two adjoining rooms - disappointment). I think I could have found something more desireable for $300/night - but maybe not - this was our first time to Puerto Rico. Breakfast was decent - typical greasy bacon & sausage, bland eggs, etc. One thing that bothered me was our housekeeping. One day we got there at 6:30 p.m. (housekeeping was supposed to be until 4 p.m.) and there were 4 hotel staff members in our room (one was going through the television!!!) This kind of made us feel violated / privacy violated....but everything was intact. Strange, yes. Needless-to-say, we kept our tag in the door and declined housekeeping the rest of the time. Very close to restaurants, shops, and beach. We actually spent a great deal of time just out at the pool. Excellent location - extremely close to airport. While out at pool, planes would land just off the property. But, that was definitely not a drawback. It made you feel like you were on vacation. Oh, gained several pounds from the chips/salsa and popcorn every night at the manager's reception. That was a nice extra. Anyway, decent chain hotel - not the best and not the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - location is perfect in Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: e42027
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large group in January. The hotel staff was outstanding, making our stay a great experience. Breakfast is served each morning and the server will make you pancakes or omlettes to order. Each evening the hotel has a happy hour with free drinks and chips or popcorn. This is a nice treat before going out to dinner. The hotel is located walking distance to the beach.. They have a private beach with towel service and lounges. The area around the hotel has all kinds of food, something for everyone (sit down, fast foood, etc). We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kss1947
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after our cruise and enjoyed our stay vs our precruise stay at another hotel. This suite was very roomy and comfortable. They could use some up dating. Great location as it is close to restaurants and a little over a block to the beach. It has a great pool to just chill out at. The cooked to order breakfast was good and the managers reception at night was also great. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveling G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights after a cruise.We found the suite very comfortable and spacious. It's location is great being close many restaurants and two blocks to the beach. The complimentary cooked to order breakfast was great and afternoon managers reception cocktails rounded out the day!The pool was very nice and large with many lounge chairs. We got a great rate on Hotwire which made this stay even better!

Reviews.Title: “This place needs help”
Reviews.Author: EricfromGroton
Reviews.Content: The restaurant couldn't keep up with the one waiter handling everyone. He really tried but he was running back and forth. The views were of highway and the airport. It's OK to stay at but not for any kind of a vacation. Located right downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate”
Reviews.Author: bettygirl14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on our way back from a trip to Vieques, PR. We got a great rate on Priceline the day of the stay. The suite was very large, it had a great sitting area, large bathroom and a king bedroom. The suite was very clean and it was fairly quiet, except we were on the second floor and the lobby area is quite the attraction so there was faint noise. I would have preferred to be on a higher floor, it probably would have cut down on the noise. Needless to say, the stay exceeded our expectations for the price and the quality of the hotel. It is also very close to the airport so that was nice, but far from Old San Juan, where I would suggest to go for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business and Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Deepfin
Reviews.Content: The staff very helpful close to the beach and shopping. In and out quickly from the airport. I can't say enough good things about this place. The rates were good and the happy hour up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Our 12 nights in the Island Of Enchanchment”
Reviews.Author: Lourdes A
Reviews.Content: Our experience @ The Embassy was great! From the moment you step out of the taxi and receive a greeting with a smile, to the front desk where everyone is efficient, polite and just plain nice. The hotel lobby is very warm with lovely plants and coqui sounds all over the place. The suite decor is o.k., just hotel furnishings with plenty of space and comfort. The choice of breakfast, which is included in the price, is pursuant to taste, whether made to order or you can select from a good variety on the counters. The coffee was outstanding, strong and tasty! Then in the evening you also get two (2) hours of happy hour also included in the price!! Our houskeeping lady, Vidalina Mercedes was wonderful. Beautiful personality, efficient, detailed worker. During breakfast I could not help noticing Ivette, she maintained the coffe counter spotless, picked up tables, offered to help people that needed help and was all over the place working hard and with a beautiful smile and disposition. Also, @ breakfast Rene, Nilda and Juan Vazquez walked the extra mile!!! The are all quick and efficient! We spoke to the senior Food & Beverage Manager to congratulate him and his staff because good employees are a reflection of great management. The beautiful pool area, bar area, Outback Rest were also great. And last but not least the employee at the beach on 2/21 was very accomodating and helpful. Our most sincere appreciation to everyone for making our stay a memorable one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport, far from old San juan-nice bfast!”
Reviews.Author: dbfact2
Reviews.Content: The "real" espresso machine" at the included bfast was the biggest highlight for me! This year's "high season" in PR is seeing fewer crowds, so the lines at bfast were never that long. Employees were moving quickly to keep up with things (like when the espresso machine would need the grounds emptied). Three kinds of coffee: American and Puerto Rican (like strong American coffee) already brewed. Funniest thing about San Juan is lack of information about the bus routes. They seem to have a VERY strong taxi union. The rate to get to the Embassy Suite is $12.50, despite the fact it would be in walking distance if there was a pedistrian overpass. Otherwise, it is impossible due to the highway traffic. If you like vegetables (they are somewhat hard to come by in PR), I suggest the all-you-can eat salad bar at the near-by (walking, 1 block) Ponderosa for $9.95. The bus' pretty much go straight to Old San Juan (dropping you at the "entrance") for .75. Take longer during the day (45ish minutes), but virtually empty at night (25 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel near airport and beach”
Reviews.Author: metalmomma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights after returning from a cruise and a drive to Ponce across the island. The hotel is a stone's throw from the airport and the Isla Verde beach, plus is a short walk from the bus stop that can take you into Old San Juan for just a few pennies. If you are a senior the fare is only 35 cents. There are several little inexpensive restaurants a block away and the hotel also has several in-house dining venues, including an Outback. The complimentary and very substantial breakfast features cook to order eggs and all the typical breakfast sides, including fruit, potatoes, french toast and pancakes, plus other breads and pastries. Rooms are large, especially the living area. There are large flat screen TV's in both the living area and the bedroom. The bed was very comfortable, but had a rather heavy duvet with comfortor inside, so we kept the AC on to stay comfortable, as there were no light blankets available. There is a little glass topped dressing table in the bedroom in addition to a large dresser and two side tables. There is an in room safe that they charge $35 for the key until you return it on leaving. The $35 was still on our credit card bill this morning here in California, two days since our return. We were on the "Hilton Honors" floor, #7, so had a nice view of the city. The pool is huge, but is more like a lagoon, so not great for lap swimming. The grounds surrounding the pool are lovely and make a nice, relaxing place to have a drink and appetizers. The evening happy hour, which runs from 5:30 to 7:30pm offers two free drinks (wine is terrible, so stick to bar drinks or the pre-mixed rum punch or margaritas), chips and salsa plus popcorn. The interior is a little dark, but is very tropical feeling, as there are real palm trees and plants surrounding a nice size pond built with rocks and a little waterfall. This hotel would be a nice place for families, as the kids really seemed to enjoy the pool area. The hotel gives you towels for the beach and offers seating there as well. All in all, a nice place to relax and enjoy the beauty of San Juan and all that Old San Juan has to offer, as it is easily accessed via an inexpensive rus ride. Be sure to savor some mofongu while in Puerto Rico, plus order the escargot there, as it is the best I have ever eaten. Very black and tender, usually prepared with shrimp in an olive oil, butter, garlic and green onion mix. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “decent enough”
Reviews.Author: justsomeone
Reviews.Content: I spent a few nights here before a cruise, and here's what I thought. Hotel wasn't terrible but wasn't great, either. It was a short walk to the beach, but the pool area was right next to the runway, which is great if you're an airplane lover and not so good if you'd like some quiet. About that pool. It was FREEZING, like an ice bath. Basically, it was unusable. Very few people were going in because it was so damn cold. The rest of the hotel wasn't bad but, again, wasn't great. The breakfast and evening reception were good, and the room was OK if not dated. The in-room safe was an absolute nightmare, by the way. It was old and key-operated, not digital, and it was broken when I arrived. When I called the front desk the first time, the woman said she'd send someone up right away. About a half hour, 45 minutes later, I called again and she said the same thing -- someone would be right up. About another 45 minutes later, I called again and got the same response, only this time, they finally showed up. That it took three calls was an absolute disgrace, no excuses. By the time the maintenance guys fixed the lock, hours had passed. And there were still problems opening and closing the safe after that. Negatives aside, this was a decent enough place for what I bid on priceline.And the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Three great visits in two weeks time”
Reviews.Author: gayla59
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a few other times and I have never written a review, so I thought it was time. We were there January 21st, 29th and February 5th. In each instance the front desk staff was very helpful and got us into our room quickly. That isn't a small task on Sunday mornings, since the hotel is pretty full on Saturdays and there are a lot of people coming off the cruise ships. Our rooms as well as the hotel in general were all clean and neat. One of my favorite areas is the pool and as always it was fun and enjoyable. Manager's reception was just drinks and chips & salsa or pop corn. Breakfast was nice with Omlettes and fresh fruit. Since I really dislike scrambled eggs I am always happy when there is another option to breakfast than eggs. I will agree with some previous reviews that the rooms are a bit dated, but since they are well kept I can deal with that easily enough. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This Embassy Suites needs major room upgrades!”
Reviews.Author: 1037wolf
Reviews.Content: First I want to start out with the good things about this hotel. The staff at the front desk as well as the housekeeping staff go out of their way to make your stay comfortable and welcoming. They are all very friendly and accomodating. This hotel could be so much more with just a few major changes. All the rooms are worn, tired, and dirty. Housekeeping does all it can to keep it looking good, but carpeting is worn and dirty, bathrooms have no ventilation at all and end up steamy and dim. Why you would not have an exhaust fan in a bathroom is beyond me, with some bright lights to put make up on? The extra space for the suite is so nice to have, but if you want anyone at all to sleep on the pull out couch, you need to make it a comfortable bed! You really could not sleep on that couch unless you were a child. There are very nice futons out there now with a wonderful sleeping mattress that is not a bunch of springs. TV's were flat screen and a nice improvement, but the carpeting! Come on Embassy. As far as the food goes, the breakfast buffet was very nice and very welcoming in the morning. The manager's reception in the evening was also very nice. The food in the Patio area near the casino was terrible! We ordered something to bring out to the pool and when we opened our boxes, we almost laughed, but we needed food, soooo. The tropical salad was nothing less than a dinner salad with a few grapes in it. The nacho grande was nothing more than the chips served the night before at the manager's reception and some cheese whiz. The Italian Panini was so tough, you could harldy bite the sandwich. I don't know, but it cost me $40.00 and wasn't worth $10. Also the pool area is soooo pretty, and inviting, but don't go in the water. It is the coldest pool I have ever stepped foot in. With a few improvements, this is a lovely area, beautiful atrium, and a warm atmosphere, and I would like to come back again, but not until the rooms are renovated and some things change.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall but attention needed”
Reviews.Author: Knighton75971
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late for a 2 night stop prior to a cruise. We had travelled 23 hours so a quick checkiin was a help. Room was very spacious and 2 tvs was a ehlp with jetlag times. Very quiet room. Next morning enjoyed the "" free breakfast" except for the coffee, which is unusual for an hotel in Puerto Rico. Juice was not good either. Hots were fine. However some of thr group did not get a hot breakfast due to no eggs/bacon or even sausage? Why did it run out and more so why was there only on cook for the cooking station. Pool was nice with great views of landing aircraft. Pool bar did not open on time ( they claimed it was lack of ice). The menu shown was not available so we were very limited to what could be had. However on renetring the hotel found all the menu available at the shop , so why were we not told by the bar staff. Evening reception was good value, as it was Included, and if you asked there was a wide range of drinks to be had. popcorn and salsa to nibble on. Went to the Steak house and got a table booked for eight, Whilst waiting there were various nibbles and so on offered. Got to table and it was laid for 6, short wait whilst they sorted that out. Gave order for eight and three meals arrived.Confusion as to what to do , wait or shout. Waitress came along and relaised we had not got all the meals. Still took 25 mins to sort so party had a disjointed meal . Sad really as food , for me , was good. However some of the others found it not so good and cold.Complaints seem to be ridden over, so no tip there and really it was not the fault of the waitress, so far as we could see. Next morning , again breakfast was fine for me but other party members had no hot food at all. Really does need to be sorted , if it is included then it needs to be there. Pool area was fine and checked out at 1200 was again good so we could go straight to the ship. Overall for me a good experience but some of the pary were disappointed, especially with the breakfast staffs attitude when the food ran out. ( like its not my fault? well who's is it then!)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: karen p
Reviews.Content: For the most part the hotel was nice. The suite was clean and roomy. There were a couple of minor issues with it. First, there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom and after any shower or bath, the whole suite got a bit steamy. Second, there was no towel bar or rack so trying to dry a towel for later reuse was impossible when hanging it on the door hook, given the general humidity in the bathroom from the lack of exhaust fan. As for amenities, there's an Outback Steakhouse which is like every other Outback Steakhouse. The service was very good, even though we came in for a full dinner about 15 minutes before closing. The breakfast buffet has "cook to order" eggs and you can even get an egg white omelet with your choice of fillings. The other items on the buffet were all good. Go early, though. Around 9am you might be looking for an empty table and also at a good 45 minutes from start to finish. There's a casino in the hotel lobby. They have many slot machines, two roulette wheels and three blackjack tables. The dealers, for the most part, were nice. Some, however, almost seemed to be on the side of the house. For example, they were never apologetic for taking six cards and making a 21 to beat your 20. Every other casino I've been to the dealers seem to want you to win and it just didn't feel that way there. No big deal, though. I still managed to pull a couple hundred dollars from the blackjack tables during my stay. The casino has only been opened for a few months, so maybe they'll iron out any kinks. Also, everything requires approval from the pit boss. Asking the dealer to change a $5 chip into singles for a "propina" has to be approved by the pit boss and can take a couple of minutes. Like I said, though, maybe just growing pains. Lastly, Dragonfly Adventures has a kiosk in the lobby to book your excursions and tours. The tours themselves were great, but the information we got from Dragonfly prior to going was horrible. We did the El Yunque trip and the bioluminescent bay kayak trip. First, the El Yunque trip had a spot where you could wade under a waterfall. Obviously, you were going to get soaking wet. Nothing was mentioned about this at the Dragonfly desk and we felt left out when everyone was splashing around in bathing suits they were apparently informed to bring along and having a good time while we stood there without a change of clothes watching them. Second, the we were told on the kayak trip we might get splashed a little. I've kayaked before both with and without a skirt in a river kayak and generally you do only get splashed a little. These kayaks, however, were open top ocean kayaks. I don't have a problem at all with getting wet kayaking. And in fact, there were shower facilities at the take-out point for the explicit purpose of washing off the salt water and putting on some dry clothes. My problem was that Dragonfly made no mention of this at all and we had to ride 90 minutes back to the Embassy Suites with "dinghy butt". The final thing is not a knock on Dragonfly at all, but most of the fun stuff is east of the Embassy Suites, so you are first on the van and last one off and you spend as much as or more time driving compared to the actual excursion. You do get to experience more of the fabulous Puerto Rican drivers than the other guests, though. (If you've never been, they are all crazy.) If I go back to Puerto Rico, I'd consider staying here again although two free nights from HHonors was a big factor. Dragonfly does some nice trips, but I will always bring a bathing suit and a change of dry clothes wherever we go - even on the Bacardi tour :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business stay”
Reviews.Author: Bobbareeno
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for ten nights total while on business in San Juan. I found the property to be very clean and well kept. Onsite parking was in a parking deck adjacent to the hotel. There was a daily fee for parking. The front desk personnel were always very friendly and very eager to help with any situation. I had to check out and travel to Aguadilla for one night during my stay and the sales manager (Karen) was very helpful. She personally took care to ensure I would retain my rate and parking discount that had been afforded to our group. Happy hour was very nice and gold and diamond Honors people get a "VIP" pass to go to a separate line for drinks. This was extremely nice on the weekends when the cruise vacationers fill up the hotel and the lines for happy hour become VERY long. I will say that our entire group found the Outback Steakhouse located on the premises to be overpriced for what you got. I paid $21 for a french onion soup and a chicken caesar salad. On the weekends the hotel allows local jewelry vendors to set up tables in the lobby and sell their crafts. The rooms were very quiet and always kept clean by the housekeeping staff. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: k B
Reviews.Content: Hotel and especially the room showing its age. Refrigerator broken, furniture worn and frayed. Concierge gave incorrect information several times. Many tables always dirty in lounge, bar and open areas when open. Female servers obviouly catered to the hunky guys and left the rest of the customers to fend on their own. I have stayed at many nicer places for less than half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Weekend Value”
Reviews.Author: HeleneDC
Reviews.Content: The special $159 weekend rate made this a great place to start our PR vacation with multiple family members. Saved money with two rooms in each suite, the good breakfast (although staff seemed overwhelmed keeping up with the number of people eating breakfast), and the location near a supermarket let us stock up on supplies and snacks. - nice beach two blocks away with special Embassy section stocked with chairs and towels - affordable access to Old San Juan on the 75 cent bus (Note: we were told the buses ran every 20 minutes but this was not so on the weekend) - courteous staff; - great pool - nice seating areas in foyer for our extended family to meet and talk

Reviews.Title: “Great for family of 5 - good value”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Raines
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in pretty good shape, the lobby was well kept and had some beautiful fish tanks to admire when you walk in. Didn't spend too much time in the casino but the staff was helpful there and throughout the hotel. The manager's reception in the evening was fantastic! The drinks were *strong* and they had popcorn and chips and salsa -- keeping everyone happy. The breakfast in the morning had omelets to order or buffet and we had our fill. The only area that needed some improvement was the room, that had seen some where and tear. Overall, it was a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Good value-great location”
Reviews.Author: nktz
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean well kept hotel with central location. Beautiful lobby area, helpful staff, nice suites. Near bus line to old San Juan, near airport, close walk to beach, grocery stores etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Sindbad2007
Reviews.Content: On vacation Jan 23 - 27, 2011. Hotel is kind tucked in between the highway exists just off Isla Verde Street. Very visible from the highway and the major street "Isla Verde". Big entrence and grand foyer/reception area. Casino kind small but I guess it fits the bill if you are a gambler. Walking distnce from the famous Intercontinental and casino san Juan. Plenty of fast food restaurants around. The rooms are outdated but very functional and clean. New flat TVs, mini fridge, etc... Breakfast buffet and manager's reception in the evening are included in the price for all guests at no extra charge. However there could be a lineup for either unless you are a Gold or Diamond Hilton Honors member, then a special quicker line. Two very distinctive and important features: The pool is awesome, and there is an Outback inside the hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Will cosider this hotel next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: princesskatesmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights precruise. We really enjoyed it and will rebook for next year. The breakfast was very good however it was long to wait for omeletes/eggs Happy hour was great a nice time to relax Great service at the beach The rooms are a little dated but clean Overall we were very happy with everything

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!... SKIP Out Back Restraunt for DINNER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bradhere02
Reviews.Content: The Hotel location is a good location for the airport. Nice beach ( 2 blocks from hotel) (The hotel has a private area with chairs and umbrellas / FREE) The hotel is close to public transportation. (Bus fare to Old San Juan is 75 cents) The public transportaion is very good ( AC) and clean. Take the bus to the main terminal (you will be in the Old San Juan area) They have a free trolley that travels the area (when you see a place you like / get off ) The hotel has a Great Staff that is willing to help you. There is also, a very good tour office located in the lobby. The tour of the rain forest is GREAT... Like in all Embassy Suites you will have a Great Breakfast Buffet and Evening Cocktail Time. The rooms are clean and large. Nice bathrooms. If you like to gamble / good casino ( please do not expect Vegas size ). Try many of the Great Restraunts located in the area. (Platos, Meterpol, Places in many hotels in the area) Best Wishes for A Great Time in Puerto Rico...

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Vikkietoria
Reviews.Content: My flight was delayed so I arrived at midnight. They had told us that since it was so busy that they has sold our room and would have to stay in the TimeShare plaza next door. When we finally got a room the nest day, it smelled like smoke and mildew, but we were assigned another room. This one wasn't bad, but it could have been cleaner. Because of our problems, they gave us a voucher for 75 USD off of dinner. The dinner was very good but somewhat overpriced even with the voucher. Breakfast was very crowded and a little cold. We expected better from them. There is a Walgreens nearby so we were able to grab some things before our cruise departure.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Halls4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Embassy Suites twice, two times in a row, both pre-cruise for one night. The hotel is very convenient to the airport, maybe a 15 minute taxi ride to the cruise terminal. Around the hotel are a few restaurants, Walgreens, beach, Outback, small park. It's not convenient for trips into Old San Juan. We've enjoyed our stay both times and will stay again pre-cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Would have enjoyed it more without 100 college kids”
Reviews.Author: calenita
Reviews.Content: When we stayed at the Embassy Suites in early January there were well over 100 college kids there for winter swimming training from a whole bunch of US colleges, so it had a bit of a spring break feel to it which was not great. The students were not rowdy but they were overwhelming and could be rude - breaking in line and taking over the whole breakfast area. Wait for breakfast was horrendous. The swimmers would arrive on buses from their training so you would get an influx of 40 at a time waiting for breakfast and the hotel did not allow for this by having extra serving lines. Waiting for 45 minutes in line for a hot breakfast buffet is crazy. Finding a chair at the pool was a challenge when they were around too. I think if we had stayed at the hotel without the huge number of students there it would have been better. The beds are not the most comfortable. Very soft and the sofa bed had big holes in it according to our teen. But the room was clean and the front desk staff very nice and friendly. We arrived early so they put our luggage in storage and gave us a key for access to the pool where you can get free towels. The beach is about a five minute walk away - one block - and there is an Embassy Suites stand there where they give free towels, umbrellas and chairs. Nice. The managers reception in the afternoon was nice with free drinks, popcorn, chips and salsa. The pool is really beautifull and the hot tub nice - if you can get out there when there aren't 20 college kids in it. I would go back but not at the beginning of January when the hotel is taken over by college kids. For the price - considering you get a hot breakfast and can accomodate five to a suite, it is a good deal for San Juan. If you want to go to old San Juan you need to take a bus or taxi. Airport was very close - about five minute cab.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: ambertini4
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a few hotels in San Juan and this was the worst. We recently stayed for 2 nights. It was extremely crowded. Our reservation was incorrect. They had us booked in two separate rooms for each night. Our room wasn't clean - trash in garbage and mini fridge. Manager's happy hour isn't worth the hour long wait. Location is near the airport and a extremely busy highway. You can hear everything while trying to relax near the pool. They charged us double for one night. The manager quickly credited our account, but it was annoying. Too many issues to ever consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “EMBASSY SUITES SAN JUAN NEW YEAR'S WEEK 2011/2012”
Reviews.Author: nnjprman
Reviews.Content: New Years week 2011/2012 was the second time I have stayed that this hotel. The first time was a few years ago. I was traveling with two family members so I considered the large size suites and the included breakfast when I was choose this hotel. We all had a great time in Puerto Rico. The hotel has itâ€™s good and bad points. Good Points: Large Suite Breakfast included Nightly free drinks between 5:30 â€“ 7:30 Clean & Nicely appointed public areas Decent maid service Fairly clean room Bad Points: Additional tourist fee charge at the end of the stay Room needs to be renovated. It looked dated. Service at the pool / snack bar was extremely slow. I placed an order for an appetizer and some drinks and it took over 45 minutes to get it. Overall, we had a great time in Puerto Rico. We are not extremely picky travelers. As long as the room was clean and the service was half way decent, we were fine with everything. The pool area and casino were nice. The area that the hotel was in seemed safe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Juan and needs a large room on a budget. This hotel is not luxurious in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but well-worn”
Reviews.Author: sneezenwheez
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (2 parents 3 small kids) stayed comfortably in the room with two queen beds and a pull-out sofa couch. The room was worn out. Stains on everything and yucky carpet. You want to wear slippers while walking around in the room. On the bright side the pool,breakfast,lobby area and free wi-fi were excellent. Guest services arranged day trips and car rental with good prices. Safe neighborhood with an easy walk to the beach. There is a private area on the beach for hotel guests. Hotel is very close to the airport. Overall it was a good value. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel with good Internet Connection”
Reviews.Author: CommOfficer
Reviews.Content: Decent working desk with a reasonably nice chair and a good Internet connection. Parking was available in the garage next door which made that part easy. Breakfast had a wide assortment of items but I mainly grabbed something small to go since I was there to work. Only small white Styrofoam cups and solid lids which made getting a cup of coffee to go harder than it should be. Most ES places have a little bigger cups with drinking lids that you can grab your coffee in but that wasn't a huge issue. The rooms are nice but tired. Housekeeping tries their best but the rooms really do need renovation. The refrigerator was wobbling around on three little feet and the microwave only had 2 of its 4 feet. I think if they had a dedicated guy who went through 1 room at a time fixing all the little odds and ends it would probably make the rooms a lot nicer. The bathroom was very nice though and I must stress that the room was really clean. I'll stay here again since it is just too convenient to the airport and I get my Hilton points too. The concierge lady by the front door was REALLY friendly and VERY helpful. She made the one down day when I didn't have to work a great day with suggestions of places to go.

Reviews.Title: “High Season Madness”
Reviews.Author: Khowaga
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites is located convenient to the San Juan airport -- it takes three minutes to get there from the airport and ten minutes to get back, thanks to the configuration of the highway system. As another reviewer mentioned, there is no hotel shuttle (there don't actually seem to be such things for any of the properties), and a taxi will cost around $12-15. Parking at the hotel is chaotic--there was never a problem getting a space, but it seemed like we were constantly behind drivers who couldn't work the gate and then insisted on going the wrong way upon entering the garage (it wasn't just us -- we noticed the garage staff seemed a bit bewildered by this behavior, too). Parking, at $16 a day for self park, is less than I've paid at other hotels in the area. I stayed there with my parents between Christmas and New Year's, at the height of the busy season. The hotel was a bit overrun with college swimming teams in town for winter break training, and the fact that the hotel was bursting at the seams showed quite a bit: the line at breakfast and at the manager's reception / happy hour in the afternoon were both incredibly long (forty five minutes for the latter). The first day we were there, the staff seemed to be overwhelmed; by the time we left, systems seemed to be in place to deal with the madness. The hotel is not on the beach - the beach is about a ten minute walk away up a side street. There is a section of Isla Verde beach reserved for guests at the Embassy Suites (look for the flag), where a staff member will provide you with beach chair, towel, and umbrella. Restaurants in the hotel are a bit pricey--we ate at the bar the first night because we arrived late, and the prices were on par with a restaurant in Old San Juan, even if the service and quality was not. There's an Outback Steakhouse in the hotel, which is one of the most expensive places in Isla Verde to eat -- ask at the front desk (not at the concierge stand -- the concierge is a private company) for recommendations for local restaurants within walking distance. There's a Pueblo grocery store next door for basic provisions.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: rabass
Reviews.Content: Only stayed there one night to go on cruise. Had King size bed but the room was very small but adequate for our needs. Excellent breakfast buffet. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “SLOW check in, Dirty soiled rooms, Convenient to highway and airport”
Reviews.Author: goniles
