Reviews.Content: This was one of the dirtiest Embassy Suites I have stayed in. The carpet was soiled and the bathroom was dirty. The check in time was 4 and we could not even get into our rooms until after 4:15. They charge a resort fee of 11% even if you just stay for one night and do not use the facility. They had laundry facility and a small fitness room. The several story lobby was nice but decorated very tacky. (A beer can Christmas tree?). They leave you water in the room for $3.50 a bottle. The hotel staff was rude and seemed very untrained.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: siestaclaud
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick overnight before a cruise. Got a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom for less than $300. Upon review of the final bill found a "hotel fee" charge of $40 was added. I had printed out my online receipt before I came. Went to the desk and they took off the fee but told me it was an error in their system and I should have to pay the fee. So take that into considration when you are booking. Check all the fees first. The location is good. Close to the airport and walking distance to the beach and lots of restaurants in the area. We needed to pick up a few things before the cruise and the Walgreens was a block away. I would stay there again pre-cruise, but not with a $40 fee!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mrgeemoney
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby with fish tanks and streams of fish. The lobby also has 2 restaurants with one of them an Outback steakhouse.Cook to order breakfast is great but get there early cause it gets very crowded and hard to find a table to sit and eat. They have a managers cocktail party every night in the lobby and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are all suites with a living-room and bedroom. The beds are big and comfortable but the bathroom was a bit dark with little lighting but OK. The rooms could use an update soon in a couple of years. The hotel is located close to just about everything you need and is right next to the airport. The only drawback is the noise and music from the lobby, if your looking for a hotel to get some peace and quiet this is not it. All of the rooms surround the lobby which is always busy with music and people so you can hear everything in your living-room of your suite. If you close the door to your bedroom you can't hear the music from the lobby. Its a great hotel with a great atmosphere and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Good surprise”
Reviews.Author: borg2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Embassy Suites only one night on return from a cruise. It was by far the best deal in an area where hotels are expensive. Wonderful facilities for children, many families here. we paid $125 plus 15% tax. Excellent beds with duvets. Grand swimming pools. coffee micro and frig. Big plus is free happy hour with snacks. A very nice breakfast buffet. Gorgeous lobby surreounded by tiers of balconied rooms. Husband had rare treat of option for a smoking room. 3 blocks from a great beach/ 10 minutes from the airport. food is limited a steak house, reasonable $20, and a patio cafe with very limited menu. Other places within 2 blocks. Isla Verde is heavy traffic and impossible to park . For this reason, hotel parking is $16 per day. We did rent a car in earlier visit, (pre cruise) at U save, a local place that delivers to and from airport. an older car but adequate and $25 per day. be sure to have insurance documentation with you or you will pay $10 a day for liability. (this is a foreign country), We were very pleased with this place, only down side was the bath tub which seemed to have survived some trauma.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good stay at Embassy Suites in PR”
Reviews.Author: KSOLY
Reviews.Content: We had a enjoyable stay at the Embassy Suites near the airport in San Juan, Puerto Rico (Nov-2011). Room was spacious, clean and nicely appointed, although it may need updating in a year or so. Hotel had good restaurants inside, including a pizza cafe, Outback Steakhouse and El Patio grill (great food). The beach was about three blocks or so away, but easy walk. Grocery store and Walgreens nearby for necessities and snacks. Price was fair for this area, but the free breakfast every morning makes it a good deal (full buffet with short-order pancakes and omelets!).

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you get a good price”
Reviews.Author: JSMinMN
Reviews.Content: this hotel is off the beach, so is really only a good option if you get a good price, so shop around. It's a nice hotel in typical Embassy fashion with the free breakfast and evening happy hour, which can same some buck in pricey San Juan. there are a few other eating option right on site, and it's only a block to the main street with more option. if you walk out the front door, go all the way to beach (2 blocks) and there area couple beach joints that I like for a change of pace and to watch the sea. Rooms were good too. As far as I could tell, they include the resort charge of 14% in the price, as opposed to other higher end hotels that add it. Make sure you are aware of this San Juan practice when pricing out hotels.

Reviews.Title: “High price for an overnight stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph T
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and 2 friends for an overnight, awaiting for a friend to arrive the next day and then we were going to drive to the western part of the island. My 2 friends did not make it that night due to flight delays, so I stayed the night solo. When I booked the reservation, the rate for a single person was $179 and for 3 people $194. When I checked in at the hotel, I advised the agent my 2 friends would not be staying and since it was just me, could the rate be adjusted to the single rate of $179. His reply was "you have the best rate for the night". However, in talking to another hotel employee, the hotel was only 1/4 full! It is a basic Embassy design with a great atrium, evening reception and breakfast. I did not arrive for the reception, but the breakfast was disappointing. All of the hot food was cold, the toaster's were not working, but the coffee was good. There is a lobby restaurant serving "local" cuisine (go out and get better food at a cheaper price). And there is an Outback Steakhouse that is attached, a great pool area and a very small casino. And because of the casino, your bill is smacked with a resort fee. So for the $194 I was quoted, with tax and the "resort fee", my total was $245 for 1 night, which I believe is a big rip off. The hotel is one block from Isla Verde avenue where you can get a bus into San Juan and also another 1/2 block to some great Isla Verde beaches. Check the area out, there are better hotels you can find.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: tszabo
Reviews.Content: This was the only hotel I stayed in at San Juan, and the first one at Embassy Suites in a long time, so I donâ€™t have a great point of comparison. I primarily chose it because I was able to use points, and they had a 2 bedroom /2 bathroom suite available (which was essentially just two adjoining rooms, one with a living area and the other not). It is located about a 5 minute walk to the beach, which was a decent beach â€“ fun waves, wide & long and not too crowded. Beach chairs, towels, and umbrellas included (although chairs were a little old looking and lacked the added padding of the nearby Ritz Carlton). Note that the Embassy Suites portion of the beach enters the shade around 4 (at least in November), although you could move to another area. Included breakfast was ok. It did include custom-order omelets and pancakes. Was a little chaotic and not replenished that well. Included Happy Hour is a nice touch, with a few drinks, popcorn, chips/salsa. The margarita was particularly tasty. Some sort of menu would have been helpful, though. Rooms were standard, but a bit worn (rug coming apart, furniture showing tear), at least room 830. Bathroom was good (loads of counter space), but weird how there was no towel racks, except some small hooks at the back of the door (awkward). The electronic key function on one of the doors also did not work. Annoyed when had to take $13 taxi from airport (when less than a mile away), but Embassy Suites said they cannot provide a shuttle due to government regulation. Would recommend trying to share taxi with others to not feel like being ripped off. Also, housekeeping seemed confused. They came into our room early in the morning, sometimes just walking in or knocking but not waiting for an answer before coming in. Even though we requested no serviceâ€¦weird.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Vacation”
Reviews.Author: nebraska
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice. Loved the landscaping and pool. Enjoyed the evening drinks and breakfast in the morning. When we arrived our room had a terrible ordor and we couldn't switch rooms because it was 100% booked. They did come up right away and try to clean...really didn't help. Loved being within walking distance to the beach. They provided chairs and umbrellas...and the beach was always empty. The place was too crowded for our taste. There were tons of activities and events being held at the hotel....proms, weddings, conventions, and reunions. There were long drink and breakfast lines because of how crowded the place was...but really shouldn't complain because it was included in the price. Security had to come to the pool on several occasions because of older teenagers causing problems...drinking age is 18...so lots of teens were staying at the place. The staff was wonderful and friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could've stayed longer - great for pre/post cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Karen V
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel right around check in time so there were no delays. Everyone is super friendly. They were a bit short-handed at the front desk at check-in so that took a little longer than expected. The rooms/suites are awesome, very clean too. I loved the pool area, jacuzzi, etc. If I had anything to comment negatively on it would be a) the "managers cocktail party" should be more of a "bar" setting with more than 2 bartenders at it. Having the "line-up" really made it un-personal and undesirable having to stand in line for drinks. Any other Embassy I have been to had a regular bar with many bartenders on staff for the occasion so there was very little waiting. Also b) for breakfast, again the lines were really long too. Maybe having 2 lines for buffet food and then just 1 station for omelettes would be better. the breakfast was great though! I did like how the pool area always a security guard walking around - that made me feel comfortable and knowing that my items were safe, should I decide to get in the water and leave my belongings. The pool was great and the jacuzzi was perfect (except the jets weren't the best). As far as the outdoor facilities, my only complaint would be that the tiki-bar should stay open later than 5:30. The bartender was great (i can't remember her name) but she was always smiling! All in all, I would definitely come back to this hotel and everyone in my group was happy as well. One piece of advice - the handicapped rooms are on the second floor right directly above the casino and on certain nights they have live music and it's loud.

Reviews.Title: “a great surprise for weary travellers like us”
Reviews.Author: yanks105
Reviews.Content: we loved this place, beautiful grounds, great pool, happy hour, gym, fantastic breakfast. a real surprise as we had been delayed in san juan for a day and were not sure what to expect..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Wanda_W35790
Reviews.Content: We chose the San Juan Embassy Suites for an overnight stay prior to a cruise. The hotel is beautiful and offered evening drinks and snacks and a full breakfast. The service was excellent. On our return, we were offered the option of relaxing there instead of eight hours at the airport. The front manager, Melvin Rodriguez, was gracious and welcoming. After 28 years as a Hilton Honor Member, we have never been treated any better than by Mr. Rodiguez.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Embassy Suites in the chain!”
Reviews.Author: MtnWill
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member and spend 100 nights a year in Hilton hotels on business. Upon arrival at SJU, I took a two minute ($15 cab ride) to this hotel because they have no shuttle (UNACCEPTABLE). Then I waited in line for more than 15 minutes to check in, and received a less than luke-warm welcome, and when I spoke to the Manager he seemed uninterested in truly helping me. My recommendation? Stay at another Hilton hotel in the area! This one is just interested in getting tourists in and out and obviously has no interest in repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: Justatouristlikeyou
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, safe, quiet and had all the emenities one could need. Great customer service. Crafters/artists on a few week nights & weekends brings local candies and art to you. Very reasonably priced too. Pool is nice, kiddie area is contained so the little suckers only have one way in & out. Walking distance to beach & stores but not recommended after dark. Breakfast was awesome. Internet is free & valets are quick. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed !!!”
Reviews.Author: 777bailey
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, bed was best slept in ever! Staff courteous, breakfast was good, restaurant food was ok. Plenty of air conditioning this past hot summer. Stayed one week in September, pool was nice, plenty of chairs and towels. Not really touristy area, beach 2 blocks glass and rocks on beach, not very clean, will stay in Old San Juan next time I go on business.

Reviews.Title: “The free breakfast and the casino were great.”
Reviews.Author: njfults
Reviews.Content: We didnt really get a good feel on this hotel. But one thing I think everyone should know is they play very loud music until around 2am! It didnt really bother my husband and I b/c we didnt go to bed till 130 anyway and have a white noise machine but it is something you should be aware of. The breakfast was very good and FREE : ) Very close to airport is a ++ Cleanliness was not top notch but for San Juan I guess it was good. Buy in advance to get a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: rmamani
Reviews.Content: Free WiFi and Breakfast included, what a delight. Great location near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: ShoeConnoisseur
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here just one night (pre-cruise) but we decided that night that if we were to ever to vacation in San Juan this would be the place to stay the hotel lobby was beautiful, from the pond with live fish swimming in it to the charming poolside view it was just nice. We got there early due to flight arrival time and the hotel staff was very courteous. When we checked in we were very pleased with our room. The resturant availabilty in the hotel and surrounding the hotel was abundant. I even found a boutique to shop at. Overall it was a 5 star experience for us.We recommend this hotel highly!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Here”
Reviews.Author: sheila5199
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here In August. Our first trip was about five years ago.The area is safe and we feel comfortable walking around, eating in local restaurants, and taking the public bus into Old San Juan, We also like the facilities in the hotel: nice pool, small casino, two restaurants. The El Patio restaurant is a new addition since our last trip, and I loved the sangria so much I opted to buy it instead of taking advantage of the free drinks at the Manager's Reception. A few minor issues: the lines for the breakfast and nightly manager's reception were very, very long. For those guests who are Hilton Honors Gold (as we are) there was an express line. Also, the rooms were fairly well cleaned, definitely no bedbugs, but not superlative and could use updating. Overall, we liked it a lot and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs Bed bugs, Anyone else ??Embassy Suites San Juan Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: greggharrell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel October 6 - October 11 2011. Room 706 After the second day several of us noticed we ALL had red, itch bumps. Never having come in contact with anything like that in our life, wasnt sure what was going on. By the third day they because worse and we decided to talk to the front desk manager Irene about it and was told they didnt have and never have had bedbugs?? The next day when we noticed blood i demanded to talk to the hotel manager Olivier Maumaire, After showing him only my bites he was concerned enough and sent a Dr to our room to check out my family. Dr Rodriguez examined my family,bite marks all over our bodies he diagnosed & treated us for bedbug bites, prescribing us 2 creams that cost a total of $113, paid for by the hotel. We should have known something was up when they sent the House cleaning manager Elena Jimenez to remove the bedding before we even had time to pack. As a result of our stay, we had to seek medical attention when we returned home, had all of our cloths dry cleaned and throw away 5 pieces of luggage, because it could not cleaned. We didnt want there bugs brought into our home. While at the hotel, they assumed responsibility, once we returned back home, They have treated us as if we brought it upon our selfs. From a visit to our family Dr, we had over 500 bite marks on all of us. NONSENSE for what we endured as a result from our stay there, Painful itching, in some case bleeding bite marks they we will have forever. If you have stayed at this hotel and have encountered what we did, please get in touch with me.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it..just a few complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Kishonda
Reviews.Content: Ok I will break this down. I loved my stay, but there were a few issues... GOOD.. -Breakfast!!!!!! Loved the cooked to order omelets, scrambled eggs, coffee pancakes..sausage, bacon etc. Even the muffins were delicious!! And it's all you can eat, so I was very happy with this!! I can't say enough about this, it is SO worth it. -Convience..Embassy has everything you need inside the hotel. There is a casino with a lounge and live band and singers every night. I really enjoyed the band as I'm not so much of a gambler. They have an Outback restaurant inside the hotel, a pizza place AND the hotel restaurant (el Patio), which serves good drinks and good food..try the churrasco. It's a little pricey (21-30 dollars) but if you want to stay in the hotel and still enjoy a good meal, this is a good option. They also have internet kiosk, which came in handy to pay some bills and check my facebook and bank balance. They have plenty of lounge chairs and couches if you just want to hang out. The hotel is also very close to the beach, although I have to say its not the two blocks everyone says it is. It's more like 6, but the walk is straight down the street and it seemed safe and nice. There are also fast food joints..(Wendy's etc) and spanish restaurants close by (Ponderosa and Mi Casita). I went to Ponderosa and it was NOT worth the money..the food and ambiance were mediocre at best. Although I never did it, I hear you can catch the bus right across the street, or you can catch a cab right outside the hotel. Please make sure you negotiate a price before getting inside. They also have a price menu to your right that shows the price for a trip to the mall, or Old San Juan..so look at this first because they will try to rip you off (it happened to me). Room-My room was nice. Although I could tell it was a little dated, it was comfy and clean. Concierge-Shout out to Lena!!!! She was so nice and accomodating. She really made me feel welcomed! Thanks for booking my tour to OSJ for me, I had a great time!! BAD- HouseKeeping-My room was not cleaned unless I called the front desk. Friday I called to say my room was not cleaned yet, and the young man told me the staff has until 5pm. ARE YOU SERIOUS??!! I've never heard of that before! So he sends someone up and she half way cleans up. She DOES NOT CHANGE MY SHEETS. She just makes up the bed, throws some trash away and wipes down the bathroom and tables. Saturday afternoon I came back from my tour at 4:30pm and my room was the way I left it....AGAIN! Again I call the front desk and the lady tells me that the staff leaves at 5pm. Well that doesnt mean that they can wait until the end of the shift to clean!! I really think that if I didnt call they wouldnt have come at all! And here is the kicker..............the housekeeping cart was left outside my room..308..EVERYDAY!! Just ridiculous. I bought this to the attention of the front desk (Illeana) and she comped me for the 14% fee. That was good, but I would rather have had my room cleaned. Charges- My room was paid in advance, so when I got there, I was supposed to pay a deposit, $50 a night (3 nights) and any extra charges, ie room service. I had room serivice $31 dollars and $50 for the Old San Juan tour, so my charges should have been about $80. I had all types of erroneous charges from Embassy Suites once I checked my account balance! Thanks to the staff for correcting this quickly, but please get it together!! Even with the bad stuff, this was an AWESOME first trip to Puerto Rico. I loved the hotel, it was very lively at all times of the day. I loved the tour of Old San Juan! Please do the tour, you will love the history, architecture, shopping and food. And to all those who may want to travel alone like I did, no worries! You will meet new friends like I did on the tour or in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: nadia2923
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the staff are very nice. We arrived early so they held our baggage so we could go eat and tour the town. The beach is walking distance and the bus stop is at the corner which takes you just about everywhere for 50cents. The hotel complimentary breakfast is awesome!!! The outback is on site for dinner if you want as well. The pool is very nice and area is clean. I would recommend to anyone. Clean rooms, showers work well, toilets flush and cleaning service is good too.

Reviews.Title: “Always great to return to this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Ltnjoe
Reviews.Content: Yearly trip to PR ends with three days two nights at the Embassy. It is just great hotel, great value for the money and truly representative of the Embassy chain. Had a suite on the 8th floor overlooking the pool area...wow. Check in flawless, complementary two hour cocktail party and breakfast in the morning, flawless as expected. Room was clean, comfortable, the best housekeeping person I have ever met or dealt with bar none. No request was ever too much. The staff at this hotel, everyone I walked by always said hello, good morning, have a good day...from the valet parking attendant to the guy vacuuming the lobby...now thats customer service. All calls to the front desk for special request were handled promptly and courteously....I mean, the only negative on this hotel is that is about two block from the beach...but guess what...they have their own Embassy area at the beach and the excellent customer service extends there too....I honestly cannot say anything wrong about this hotel, this is my third years coming here and they outdo themselves everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Hotel, Great Pool, a little bit tired, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TGU-ORD
Reviews.Content: It is a very comfortable family hotel, which means parents and kids of all ages. If you want adults only hotel, this is not that place to be. I do like the extra space in my suite! I had a very enjoyable long holiday weekend stay. This place was packed with locals. I like Puerto Ricans, friendly, made a bunch of friends in pool, we later on sat together for evening managers reception. It helps that I speak Spanish, I did see a few gringos. One thing that is accurate with other reviews, staff is friendly, but more used to chill island speed, so donâ€™t get impatient. Also the hotel is worn out, the carpet, walls, etc are in need of major renovation, the AC is also inconsistent. But rooms are clean, beds and bathrooms are clean Pool is great, large, with waterfalls, hot tubs, kids area. The bar has beer bucket deals, I think $10 for 5 of them. Breakfast is just ok, afternoon reception is also just ok, the place was full, long lines, but moved quickly. There was a mega wedding that Saturday night, the music vibrates throughout the atrium, till late night, so if you have a low floor room, it may be a problem, but I could not hear music once in my bedroom. Honestly it seemed so fun, that I wanted to crash it The hotel overlooks pool, then highway and airport. It is a $15 cab ride to airport. Bus to old san juan stops a block from hotel and takes you there in less than 15 minutes. On the way back we took a taxi since it was late. Two long blocks walk to beautiful beach in isla verde, you can walk through main street to plenty of familiar fast food places or authentic PR restaurants. Also, once exiting he hotel, on the right, about a 10 minute walk, there is a supermarket, so we went there our first night, bought food, snacks and drinks and stored them in our suite refrigerator. Overall it was an enjoyable stay, but donâ€™t expect a brand new hotel with top of the line service.

Reviews.Title: “Busy place”
Reviews.Author: coupoleonthemove
Reviews.Content: We just got here today. Early check in a plus. We've had four problems in 4 hours. All resolved promptly by friendly staff...and now the place is over run by local children. Normally wouldn't mind but tonight we are tired. So far great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites - San Juan - Not Up To Par!!”
Reviews.Author: Bryan W
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond Member, I am loyal and faithful to the brand. This is one of the worst Embassy Suites I have ever stayed in. It is so worn out, in desperate need of maintenance and repairs, and the rooms are worse than a Motel 6. The Breakfast is SUB PAR!!! I am a staunch advocate/critic when it comes to hotels. I stay at a minimum of 3 to 5 properties each week, and this hotel as I mentioned above is SUB PAR!! I would not recommend this property for those folks who expect an Embassy Suites to be as most of those are in the States, because you will be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wretched Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geostationary
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst Hilton property I have ever visited. The room was dismal, frayed carpet, broken drapes, chipped bathtub, stained countertops, dirty walls, broken refrigerator. At one point two of the four elevators in the hotel were out of service. The garage elevator did not work at all during my 12 day stay. Staff were surly and unhelpful. Food at breakfast was sub-par (should be able to get ripe fruit in the tropics). The internet was painfully slow, worse than dial up.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok”
Reviews.Author: ats262m
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights Saturday to Monday. Hotel was full of vacationers, and was quite noisy in the evening with partying and lots of small children on the loose. Location is good, one block from the local bus into Old San Juan, and 2 blocks to the beach and many shops and restaurants within walking distance. Room we had on the 7th floor set aside for Hilton Honors was on the small side and in need of some TLC; but it was adequate and functional. Breakfast was catering for a huge crowd, and they give Hilton Honors members a special line so you get served without much of a wait - that was a nice touch. They didnt offer the normal Hilton Honors free water bottles, but they did offer the free wi-fi. All in all, the stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Way to End a Great Vacation . . .”
Reviews.Author: AngetheHungry
Reviews.Content: We rented two rooms at this Embassy following the completion of our cruise, which started and ended in San Juan. The hotel managed to save our rooms even though there were many people stuck while Hurricane Irene was going up the east coast. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, especially the woman at the front desk - can't remember name. Anyway, I asked for roll-aways for both rooms and small toothpaste tubes and, bam, they appeared. Breakfast was good; however, the juice machine was not working too well. Hopefully the staff is reading this site and can take this advice and run with it. All in all a great way to end a cruise, which I'll write about in the appropriate place.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: terri1186
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our original hotel was without power and water after Irene. It turned out to be perfect - we traveled with our adult children (ages 23 and 21) - the beauty of the Embassy is that there are two connecting rooms, each with a TV and also a common area room with its own TV as well. Everyone had their own space. A full breakfast buffet complete with made-to-order omelets is offered daily as well as a manager's reception which offers complimentary drinks and popcorn/tortilla chips. There is a nice pool area - an adorable separate kiddie pool as well as an outside bar. Outback Steakhouse is located in the hotel - we had dinner there twice and not being a huge fan of chain restaurants, I was pleasantly surprised. The service and food were great. The concierge could not have been more helpful - be certain to check out the catalog of excursions when you check in. We toured old San Juan, the Bacardi factory, took a kayak tour of the bio-bays and enjoyed a catamaran snorkeling trip. My one criticism is that the rooms could use an update - the carpet was worn and

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ourgangof3
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that we have stayed at Embassy Suites and will stay here again if we return to PR. My kids and I were in PR during Hurricane Irene. Despite the storm and the fact that many other hotels in the area had no power, we barely even felt the storm. They did not even have to dim the lights or cut the AC. While full housekeeping was suspended during the storm, staff did come around to collect trash and replace towels. We found the staff to pleasant and accomodating. The rooms were spacious and very clean, and the quality of the bedding was excellent. Rooms consist of two room suites, with a living room/dining room separate from the sleeping area. This was very convenient on the evenings that the kids and I just wanted to grab a pizza from the snack bar in the lobby and chill in front of the TV. My daughter loved the extra TV and the privacy. The hotel itself is very nice. The lobby is beautiful, with a small waterfall, foot bridge, and goldfish pond. There is a game room for the kids and a casino for adults. Every evening the hotel offers a happy hour with free drinks, chips, and popcorn. There is an Outback Steakhouse on site, plus two snack bars and a hotel restaurant/bar. Cooked to order hot breakfast is served each morning and offers a variety of choices to satisfy picky eaters. Outside, there is a lovely lagoon-like pool with a waterfall that the children and I very much enjoyed after the rain stopped. To the side is a small playground and kiddie pool for little kids. On the beach, two blocks away, a separate area is reserved for hotel guests with complimentary towels, lounge chairs, and umbrellas, which made it easy to just grab your sunglasses and go. Equally convenient is the public bus one block away, across from the Ponderosa restaurant, which will take you into Old San Juan for 75 cents. On the down side, several washing machines were out of order, and the arm chair in the living room of our suite was a bit worn looking. The managment might also consider adding an indoor playground as an extra option during inclement weather. Overall, this is a superb hotel for the price, and the included breakfast and happy hour makes it an even better value.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to ride out a Cat. 1 Hurricane”
Reviews.Author: Elkridge-Flynn
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed three days in San Juan after a week long cruise.. Hurricane Irene past just south of San Juan the first night and it rained lick crazy for the next two day. The staff did a great job keeping everyone comfortable. When talking to a few of the staff is was told that may of them where without power and water at home.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: johninclearwater
Reviews.Content: What a nice resort! We were pleasantly surprised as we had never been to Puerto Rico and didn't know what to expect. This resort was better than expected and the service was excellent. The "extras were awesome including the cook to order breakfast and buffett and the comp daily happy hour. The staff were great and catered to all of our needs. Good for family or business with a beautiful pristine pool and grounds. We would definitely come back again. I would recommend the Rocaliza Eco Adventure and going to Rincon to see some of the most beautiful Beaches in the world. This is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: nelsonvalent
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to spend time and relax. beautiful pool area where you could enjoy a drink that is free from 5 to 7 EVERY day any drink or beer. walking distance to the beach where you could get chair an umbrella and towels courtesy of Embassy Suite dont take the one from the room. Enjoy is Excellent hotel on my book.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convienent access to beach”
Reviews.Author: cruiszr2
Reviews.Content: We returned from a cruise and stayed one night. We were allowed to check into one of our rooms early, 9 a.m. which made using the facilities much easier. The pool is large and the kids really enjoyed it, there were plenty of lounge chairs around deck of the pool. The only negative was the traffic noise on the highway overpass located near the pool but after a few minutes the kids noise overwhelmed the traffic noise anyway. The hotel was clean and attractive with a small casino, about twice the square footage of our cruise ship casino with more table games though. The full breakfast offered to guests was very enjoyable and if you are a Hilton Honors member you can even skip the long lines. The manager's reception in the afternoon was nice with tap beer, soda and mixed drinks but could have offered more than just popcorn and chips, maybe I'm just picky. The beach is a short two block walk away with an Embassy Suites concessionaire providing beach chairs and umbrellas for guests at the hotel, a very nice touch. Overall a nice but short stay, would have liked to stay longer. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moomduck1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while in Puerto Rico. We loved it. I wish we could have had more time here. The rooms were large and the beds comfy. The food in the hotel restaurant was very good. There were 2 free drinks per person every evening from 5-7, but beware that the lines are long and move slowly. We took ours back to our room. There were also some free snacks - popcorn and nachos. The lobby was beautiful. The pool looked wonderful, but we weren't there long enough to swim. We were on a trip from Mayaguez to Phili, and had to spend one night in San Juan as a layover. We really wished we had planned on being there longer so that we could enjoy the hotel. The casino looked small, but we weren't interested in that any way. The breakfast (free) in the morning was huge. We had an early flight, but luckily for us, we were able to grab something about 15 min before it officially opened. We did not have time to enjoy some of the breakfast items, like made to order omelets, but that was ok. It cost about $11 and $1 per bag (one way) to get there from the airport and cost about $20 one way to get to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Vinay0725
Reviews.Content: 1. Decent rooms and beds. 2. Clean Restrooms. 3. Courteous Staff although housekeeping is a little slow. 4. Okay Pool 5. Okay Breakfast and Restaurant on site. 6. Close to the Airport. 7. No Free Parking but Self Park in adjacent parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: anachechi
Reviews.Content: As all the Embassy Suites I stayed before, I really liked this hotel. The service is great, all in the hotel are willing to assist you whenever you need it. I asked for a crib for my baby and I had it put in my room in less than 20 min. The breakfast buffet is wonderful! Not just the plain american buffets served in other hotels and the manager or supervisor there is a sweet... I just didn't like much the location, was confusing and the beach across is not that nice..otherwise we enjoyed our stay and definetely would come back...

Reviews.Title: “Downward slide”
Reviews.Author: Craig B
Reviews.Content: Hotel cleanliness and services are slacking my room needed lots of work. My room was poorly cleaned, toilet seat falling off and soiled, sink faucet handle came off in my hand , hair in shower and on bathroom floor bedroom not vacuumed. My sheets were soiled on my bed in what looked to be a red drink stain and the sofa bed blankets had holes in them. Pool area is beautiful but needs for staff to clean up the landscaped areas in the center of the pool they were full of debrisâ€™ . Front desk attendant a male who attended my check in was extremely rude his female counter part who over heard and stepped in was very pleasant and professional her name began with the Letter A, wish I could remember her name she was very helpful and should be commended for her outstanding service. My party of 5 people witness room service plates and dishes outside rooms for nearly 10 hrs. in front of the elevator. I will give positive marks for the lobby bar service it was great from Raquel and Jennifer Castro and the Sangria was excellent. The Outback steak house food was great, service however could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: 42Eyes
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay last minute. Because of the "Emily Hurriccane" that was coming to the Island of Vieques. We chose it because of the "Free" Breakfast buffet & Mgr. Happy hour. The bonus was their was a grocery store right around the corner walking distance. Plus they have a fridge & microwave in room. The down side was room were very dated and old. Bathrooms were old looking but clean. Pool area was nice they offered a Toddler area, 2ft deep pool is great! They had starfish, sea horses, fish designs in the pool. Little patio furniture, play area with many slides. My daughter loved it!! Could use a bit more shade over there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: weinstk
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed the night before a cruise on Royal Caribbean. The hotel is literally 5 minutes from the airport, a $15 taxi ride (no van service). We had called the hotel earlier since our daughter was arriving from upstate NY on a separate flight. As per the instructions, they let her check-in and get some rest before we arrived 5 hours later. Of course, it helped that she had just turned 21 and had a credit card. The room (by the tiled floor, near the elevator) was fine although noisy (we should have asked to be moved but we were just happy to be there on-time). The hotel was crowded but the staff did an exceptional job handling the crowded manager's evening reception (2 generous drinks, lots of rum) and morning breakfast. There was a quick scare when all but 1 main elevator broke and dozens of people with gigantic cruise-related suitcases were stranded on the floors. However the repairs happened quickly and the problem was solved. As with all Embassy Suites, the free WiFi worked great. We grabbed a taxi on Sunday morning (about 15 minutes to the cruise terminal, ~$35 with tip for lots of suitcases) and enjoyed a great cruise the following week. The area around the Embassy Suites is nothing to write home about but did not appear unsafe. The choice of bars and eating establishments is quite sketchy, in our opinion. There is an Outback in the lobby which we did not visit. We took a quick walk along the beach area and decided to head back to the hotel. A few bars, big condo fences, garbage dumpsters, and plenty of street garbage. And lots of ambulances driving around with sirens on.

Reviews.Title: “Went for work but after I played”
Reviews.Author: Kt-Alexis
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. It had breakfast and evening snacks. Free drinks. There is a small casino and a restaurant. It is close to the beach. So many things close in walking distance. The whole experience was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: sbchamps
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at one of the beach hotels in the area and they are booked, this is a nice alternative. The rooms are bigger than other hotels as they are suites. The hotel has an Outback Steakhouse inside. The breakfast buffet is also very good. It gets a little crowded for breakfast, but still worth the wait if you eat breakfast. This is a fine place for business as well as family vacations. The casino is a little small, but they offer almost all the games minus craps. I stay here for business occasionally and have never had a negative stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: threekiddos
Reviews.Content: We had a two room suite for one-night prior to a cruise leaving from San Juan. The hotel has a tropical feel, nice breakfast. The pool area was lovely and it was a short two block walk to the beach (we did it with three kids and were fine). There we could get chairs and towels from the Embassy Suites stand. The beach was very nice. The concierge was very helpful. He recommended Plato's for a Puerto Rican dinner. It was a wonderful restaurant with a magician who was hired by the restaurant and wouldn't accept tips. Yummy plantain dishes and the atmosphere in the restaurant was very nice - casually elegant with white linen tablecoths. The hotel has an Outback and a casino, but we didn't frequent either. Plenty of cabs to get to the cruise ship or to the Fort. A good stay and I would recommend it given the fair pricing, good service and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What your personal belongings!!”
Reviews.Author: SPR2011
Reviews.Content: I took my family on a vacation and stayed at this facility for 5 nights. I knew something strange was going on when the personnel repeatedly (daily) needed access to our rooms to check smoke detectors. While we were out of the hotel, apparently the fire alarm went off and they evacuated the hotel. Long story short- I noticed some of my clothes were missing, especially the high-end designer items $$$. The hotel management explained that the only individuals who entered our rooms were hotel staff and they did not find my clothing- hmmm. No acknowledgment of loss, consideration or compensation. Beautiful looking hotel but criminals abound! Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Good for your money”
Reviews.Author: Travelmonster420
Reviews.Content: Was stuck in San Juan for a night and stayed here. Was alot better then i thought it was going to be. For the money you can't beat it. It had an Outback steak house a pizza place and casino. The room was clean and good for the money. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel will be back next year”
Reviews.Author: msb2427
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay with family or with friends. The hotel staff was excellent at all times. The hotel stayed clean the pool area was always clean and well kept. The best part of the hotel is the managers reception every night. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone with a family or just traveling with a group of friend. The one person who stuck out to me wa Iris at the fron desk. She really made my day with how friendly she was! I am going back next year with my family!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with appropriate expectations”
Reviews.Author: jcm1164
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for around July 4th. Picked the hotel primarily because of price, breakfast buffet and proximity to the beach. Suite was as expected - comfortable, spacious and clean. Buffet - July 3rd and 4th were very busy and the lines were very long. Wait was about 40 minutes each day. After those days, the crowd left and the wait was less than 10 minutes. In general, the food was good. Advice, if you don't want the cook to order, just say excuse me and go to the front of the line - the layout almost forces you to stay in the line even if you don't want the omelettes or pancakes Drinks in the afternoon - didn't do them but the lines were long. They also had popcorn, nachos and soft drinks - no lines there. Pool - Comfortable, didn't get too crowded. Plenty of towels. Would like to have a bar or grill at the pool but not having one wasn't a big deal. Beach (Isla Verde) - went there the morning of July 4th. First, to find the Embassy Suites area, you have to go left about 200 yards and look for the Embassy Suites sign - wasn't easy to find it but you get complimentary beach chairs and towels. The set up was nice but around noon it got very crowded and very loud. There must have been 50 people sitting under the trees by the Embassy Suites sign - it was shaded. They were playing music and cooking out. It did get a bit loud but i was in the water so it wasn't that big of a deal. The people weren't bothering anybody - it was more like a celebration... Only went one other time and it was later in the afternoon - it was quiet then. Taxis - always available. $13 to the airport and $22 to Old San Juan. Other - there are restaurants and other stores a few streets away (Chili's, fast food, a couple of Puerto Rican restaurants, Walgreens and a grocery store). There were also a lot of kids - but it's a family hotel and that's to be expected. They were all well behaved. Hotel Store - forget the name of it but it was great. Sold pizza, hot dogs, drinks and snacks - all at a reasonable price. Outback Steakhouse - had dinner there one night. Opens at 5:30, good service, reasonable prices. I saw comments about the staff not being friendly - they were all friendly with me and my family. The hotel isn't a 5 star luxury hotel but it's very good at what it does. If your family wants a cost effective vacation, near the beach this is the place for you - it's not a 5 star property or a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: megam0nt0na
Reviews.Content: great choice for travels who want to be away from the hustle but close enough to get around without much hastle. 5 min away from Isla Verde beach that is lined with more luxurious places such as the Intercontinental and the ESJ (Hotel El San Juan)-- which is where you way want to get for nightlife. Bus/cab service to old san juan closeby and affordable. Complimentary breakfast buffet was clutch. Lines for the omelet line were pretty long, but worth it. Free happy hour is what you would expect. cheap ingredients and watered down. Not worth the wait in line given the affordability of drinks in PR itself. Housekeeping was kind, front desk kind was accommodating, especially Irene. We had arrived well before checkin and she made a room available. Men outside (transportation?) were quick to get us cabs or directions. The concierge staff is hit or miss. Rooms were well kept, pool was a little dirty. They offered complimentary 5 min massages poolside

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: LoriOrangeCounty_CA
Reviews.Content: We also stayed at Embassy Suites at the front and back end of our cruise on the Carnival Victory. We arrived in San Juan rather late Friday, June 17th and left the hotel on Sunday, June 19th. We also stayed Sunday, June 26th and departed for home June 27th. I made reservations months ago and requested a rollaway bed for both stays. The manager on duty said there wasn't one available when we arrived June 17th. I was angry. After I became angry, a rollaway magically became available. The same thing happened upon our arrival Sunday, June 26th (except it was a different manager on duty). After I became angry, a rollaway became magically available again. The staff overall was rude. (The two female bartenders were kind, accomodating, and provided good service.) This is the way it is----we are caucasian and middle class people. We found the Puerto Rican people employed at the hotel seemed polite to other Puerto Ricans but rude to caucasian people. Other people commented on this as well. The staff at the Outback Steakhouse were very helpful and accomodating. The happy hour was pretty good but the lines were long. If we do this again for a cruise, we will stay at a different hotel. Most Puerto Rican people were rude and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE IN JUNE!”
Reviews.Author: anuttoh
Reviews.Content: I have been here in the past, but never in June "PROM MONTH". The week we were there, there were 2 proms, one was on the monday night after we arrived on sunday (June 5th). the 18 year old adults had the run of the hotel. and when i say run, i mean run, relay races in the halls at all hours of the night, fire alarms being set off at 2/3 am, security being called, etc. And it just wasn't that one night. Apparently some were staying more than one night. Very rude, obnoxious "adults", talking about my niece in the elevator in spanish, not realizing she understood the language. spoke to the night manager, absolutely no help! his line of defense was "they are 18, and they need no supervision". (18 is the drinking age, etc, in P.R). The only bright spot was that they do now have beach chairs at the beach. The pool area was overrun by the "adults" also, no where to run or hide except the beach! Great hotel, but stay away in June. I did receive compensation from the hotel after voicing my dismay online.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, affordable hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: bagladee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre & post cruise. I had a hard time finding a hotel to accomodate my family of 5. This suite was perfect. We had 2 double beds in the bedroom and a sofa sleeper in the living room. The package also included a free hot breakfast. It was very clean and very safe. In fact, my kids proclaimed we'd never stayed anywhere this nice!! Highly recommend this place. Close walk to beach and restaurants. Also, we didn't find this out until check out, but the hotel has chairs and umbrellas and towels on the beach reserved for hotel guests only!! Go check it out!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: klarinDallas
Reviews.Content: We flew into Puerto Rico two days early for a Carnival cruise. The Embassay Suites was the perfect place to rest before and after a cruise. The hotel itself is beautiful with a full breakfast every morning, a casino, and a lovely, huge pool and hot tub. It is kept very clean, though the ladies room by the pool needed attention. When I told the staff about it, they sent two people immediately to correct the situasion. It is not right on the ocean, but you can easily walk to the beach. And with such a beautiful pool, we didn't feel like leaving the property. If you do stay at the Embassay, don't miss the hot cereal at the breakfast buffet. It is awesome! We asked one of the staff what is in it and she took the time to go to the chef and came back with a list of ingrediants which included coconut milk, coconut cream and lemon zest. It is wonderful and so is the Embassy Suites!!

Reviews.Title: “Lesson Learned!”
Reviews.Author: ford316
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before but never in June. 2 proms & 2 conventions later, suffice to say the conventions were fine, the PROMS on the other hand were VERY DISRUPTIVE!!! 18 year old's running up and down the halls, pulling fire alarms, music to 2 am, REALLY!!! No real satisfaction from the hotel. My daughter and I were in the elevator when one of the young men made comment about her, unbeknownst to him that she understood Spanish, not happy with his remarks. When I complained to the Hotel management, because they were UNSUPERVISED, hotel said that they were 18 and did not need supervision. Apparently you can get a hotel room in Puerto Rico at the age of 18, not 21 as it is stateside! Other than all that, the hotel breakfasts and manager's cocktail party are great, just don't go there in June!! Lesson learned

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: boardergirl855
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel. We loved absolutely everything about it - the interior, the exterior, the ambiance, the room, the pool, the Outback restaurant, the breakfasts, the happy hour... everything! We would recommend it to anyone and go back in a heartbeat. The pool is amazing! It was cold, but in the hot temperatures, it was refreshing. There were always chairs available by the pool and, if you wanted to walk to the beach, the hotel has reserved chairs there as well. (We walked to the beach one day but didn't stay, choosing the pool instead). This hotel isn't near the old city of San Juan, but a cheap bus ride or an efficient taxi ride will get you there without any problems. And, even though it's near the airport and my room faced out towards it, I didn't hear a thing at night and slept like a rock. The front desk staff were always friendly and helpful, whether our request was for recommendations, directions, or an assistance related to our stay, such as an early check-in or luggage hold after our check out. I had trouble faxing something from the business office and they even printed and faxed it for me at their desk without question. The 4 of us loved it here and can't say enough good things about it.

Reviews.Title: “Super in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: JeffR1962
Reviews.Content: We chose the Embassy Suites initially for its proximity to the San Juan Airport. Our cruise ended on Sunday and we were not to fly out until Tuesday. They have a strict check in policy (at least they did the day we arrived) so there was some delay getting into our rooms but an offer of breakfast and a comfortable chair made it easier. The rooms were very nice, the pool excellent and the breakfast and manager's get together in the evenings were great. We booked an excursion to El Yunque Rainforest through the concierge which turned out to be a favorite day for our family - ask for Alexander L. and Roberto M. to be your guides and you will be rewarded with fun, enthusiasm and two guys who love what they do and where they take you. Would gladly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'll definately go back....but!”
Reviews.Author: Nuyorican417
Reviews.Content: I will make sure I don't order anymore drinks from poolside....the girl that was making the drinks definately does not like her job and needs a refresher course on how to make drinks. First of all she didn't show up until 1:00 pm when she should of opened at 11:30 am. Then when she finally showed up I ordered a Mango Margarita and I got mango nectar...when I questioned her about it she said that because I asked for extra alcohol it affected the way it should of came out...P.S. I didn't taste the alcohol at all and after that I ordered one from the bar at the lobby and I got a perfect Mango Margarita! Now I only stayed for two nights therefore I expected my room to be made on my second day there and when I got back to my room nothing was done ....garbage still in the garbage pails, bed unmade, ran out of toilet tissue and towels...I called housekeeping and they told me that they usually continue cleaning rooms up until 6pm!! I got back to my room at 6pm! And because of that I rated them very good....if not for those two incidents I would of rated them Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Fun Casino”
Reviews.Author: jport7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on a business trip. The manager's special "free drinks" was a nice perk. After dinner at Outback (in hotel), I played Blackjack for hours and did very well. Immediately lost my winnings in the slots, back to the tables, repeat. Breakfast buffet was really good as well. My only complaint is that as I was getting ready for my shower, I realized there wasn't any soap or shampoo. You have to call down and request it.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend the hotel 100%”
Reviews.Author: ruthcaliz
Reviews.Content: Every room is a suite, equipped with 2 plasmas, microwave, refrigerator, coffe maker, desk, free wifi. Extremely clean. They offer complimentary HOT breakfast with multiple choices like omelets, fried eggs, pancakes, fruits, oatmeal, cereals, juices, coffe, etc. Also, every evening, from 5:30 to 7:30 PM they have a Happy Hour with FREE beverages (including alcoholic) for all the guests. The pool is nice and the casino too. The hotel is located near to multiple soteres and restaurants in the middle of a touristic zone. The beach is across the street and the hotel has personnel at the beach, with towels and chairs, at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Isla Verde area of San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Amaboskcus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Embassy Suites for five nights. Located less than 10 minutes from the airport. Nice, clean rooms. Free hot breakfast daily. Courteous, helpful and professional staff. Beautiful pool. Free wi-fi. Great concierge service. Never a wait for a taxi. Easy access by cab or bus to Old San Juan, rain forest and other attractions. Located about 2 blocks from the beach but that was not a problem because the hotel maintains a beach concession that provides free lounge chairs, umbrellas and beach towels for guests. Beach attendant sets everything up for you. Great bars on the beach. Easy walking distance to stores, restaurants. Casino employed professional, fair gaming. Great experience. We would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: emrogerspa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites for one night prior to embarkation on a cruise, leaving from San Juan. We have stayed at Embassy Suites previously, and we enjoyed them. Let's start with the good - the pool area was nice and while next to a busy highway & airport it was fairly quiet and a nice area. The manager's happy hour was crowded, but the line moved quickly. The staff was very nice and gladly provided you with free beverages. The casino was nice, and the live band was fun entertainment. While the hotel lobby is a busy place, the rooms were quiet. Now the not so good. The aquariums in the lobby were so dirty you couldn't see the fish - that should have told us something. The in room safe did not have a key, and I questioned the front desk I was told that they didn't have any other key. I asked for a room with a functioning safe and was told that none were available. The room was not clean - dirty bathroom and AC vent covered in mold. The TV in the living room did not work right. We sat in the Outback for 20 minutes without anyone taking our beverage order, and we walked out. We walked to the beach, and we quickly learned that were not in a great part of town. The beach was pretty, and while terribly crowded the afternoon of our arrival, we walked the beach the AM of our departure and it was quite nice. I would not recommend this hotel to others. While the price was right, sometimes you get what you pay for. I will stay at another Embassy Suites but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Treatment poor shift manager”
Reviews.Author: CarlosVazquez
Reviews.Content: My visit to the hotel was on April 23 to 25. The hotel is excellent in quality, food and recreation, but in service are the worst for the Puerto Rican. My inedible arises since my son mislaid the phone in the Game Room as a teenager stole it and I notify the front desk to Mr. Freddy Gonzalez and he did NOTHING to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: hoagiemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites after out wonderful cruise on Carnival Victory. The Embassy was a great deal. We got there early Sunday morning since we had to get off our ship and they kept our luggage and told us to have breakfast and enjoy the pool and the beach. We walked to the beach were they provide us with chairs and a umbrella. We also enjoyed the pool until our room was ready. We were treated with warm and pleasant staff who work very hard at making your stay enjoyable. The breakfast is great and they also have happy hour (which is really 2 hours). The rum punch is sooo good. We loved the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jnar77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and a block off the best beach we visited in Puerto Rico. It was walking distance from tons of restaurants, shops, bars, and Walgreen's. My family felt very comfortable in the area.The food at Outback was delicious and the staff were extremely helpful during our stay. It was after hours and the tour concierge was closed, but the front desk staff at the hotel still helped us book a snorkeling tour. The pool was very relaxing as well. The only thing I have to complain about was the follow up after we left. We got home missing a couple of small souvenirs and called a few times to see if maybe we left them in the room. The young lady we spoke with could never find the housekeeping manager and did not return any phone calls. A return phone call and our experience would have been perfect. I gave them five stars anyway. We would definitely stay there again and I'm not knocking the entire stay for one person.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal on the strip if isla verde”
Reviews.Author: Beachfest
Reviews.Content: I've stood here plenty of times before. Always a great deal. Pool is nice with a mini-waterfall. Beach is 2 blocks away. Rooms are some apartments in ny, trust me because I've lived in them. Free breakfast is good and not just cause it's free. They have a daily happy hour that is nice. My girlfriend loves their Miami vice.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the heart of the action, but many positives. Especially for families.”
Reviews.Author: pappy32
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an ultra-hip, sexy location close to the vibrant bar scene of Old San Juan, this is probably not your hotel. My husband and I stayed for four nights at this hotel, and it provided exactly what we needed - close proximity to the airport (due to our very late and very early flight times), a very good breakfast, access to public transportation (thus all the attractions), comfortable room, and 2 hours of complimentary drinks (huge bonus!). The fitness facility was well-appointed, and access to a decent beach was short walk down the block. But this is not really an area you want to be wandering around late. There are some decent restaurants in the area, but if you want to really get your party on, either do it early in Old San Juan, or stay close to the hotel scene in Isla Verde. Staff was super-friendly! Rooms had everything you need, including fridge and microwave, and while not super-chic, were very comfortable. Did not use the pool, but it looked very nice and included a playground for the kids, plus a nice bar. If we brought our kids (as many of the other guests had) it would have been a perfect location. There was one incident that scared me to death, and if we wouldn't have checked out only 2 hours after it happened to catch an early flight, we would have made a bigger stink with the management. At 3 am, I awoke to the sound of someone messing with the keycard and successfully opening our room door! I was screaming at my husband to wake up, and at that point, whoever had entered our room was either scared off or realized it wasn't their room. The door slammed and by the time he made it out into the hall, whoever it was must have slipped into the stairwell, which was right next to our room. Needless to say, we never went back to sleep. I really want to believe it was just someone who happened to mistakenly wander into the wrong room, but it's probably pretty unlikely. But aside from that, we had a lot of fun. You absolutely must remember this is not a resort so to speak, but it provides a good home base for your exploration of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheClint
Reviews.Content: First off, I have stayed at a few of the other local hotels in the area. The Embassy Suite blows them all away. The staff is more than friendly. The hotel is a very beautiful, inside and out. The common area, is a lovely atrium with trees and a fish pond. The pool area is immaculate, especially the days that Victor is working. A HUGE pool with a waterfall and a beautiful surrounding. The services here are nothing short of spectacular. Every morning there is your standard buffet breakfast, but they also have an omelet station if you so choose. In the evenings the breakfast area is converted to a fully stocked bar where every night there is a manager's special open bar for two hours. Not to mention there's an Outback in the hotel along with a casino. My only issue with the hotel is that the casino does not have a Craps table. Embassy Suites...Get a Craps table!!! Talk to Christina at the front desk. She is extremely friendly and very eager to ensure that you have the best stay possible. In fact the entire staff is this way also.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Manaxer
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception from the Bellman to the receptionist "Cristina" if you can remember someone's name from a Hotel stay that usually mean something very bad happen or you had a great experience with your stay, well I was lucky the latter did happen from the moment I got out of the Taxi from the Airport ($10.00 + $1.00 per Bag) I knew that I made the right choice in selecting a pre-cruise stay. The Hotel staff is highly rated in my book. I have mention Cristina above for a reason simply put she's first class in welcoming guest to her Hotel. The place was very clean and there is a festive atmosphere in the Lobby without any disturbance; the suite is spacious well lit and quiet, Breakfast is actually better than advertise overall a great place to stay specially before and perhaps after a cruise. Will stay there again for sure, my companion vow the same...

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT for vacations on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: DrChuck59
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one evening at this hotel, and only because of its close proximity to the airport. However, in just that one stay, we discovered a fantastic Hilton hotel for the budget-concious family. As a devoted HHonors gold member, I was pleasantly surprised. For less than the price of surrounding hotels, you will get the dependable, standard Embassy Suites room with bedroom, bath, coffee pot, and office/lounge. Hispeed WiFi is included, of course, for the HHonors member (and for a modest fee otherwise). WiFi is free at the lobby area, as are public terminals and free business desk support. While you will not get a view of the beach, they have a very nice pool area with bar and cafe, one of the best local coffee shops I visited, a pleasant bar, and Outback's steakhouse. The typical Continental-plus Breakfast each morning provides real value, and surrounding the hotel are all the typical high- and low-end restaurants. (Ruth's Chris, Ponderosa, BK, etc.) Just 5 minutes walk and 2 blocks away is a wonderful Florida-style public beach with walk-up bar, cafe, skee-dos, parasailing, and $4/day loungers at a beautiful cove-protected ocean. Several car-rental companies are a block away and will come to the hotel, and you are just 15 minutes from old San Juan for touring. However, I recommend you use taxis. Except for the city-style highway (no Interstates in P.R.), roads are very narrow and parking extremely limited. Furthermore, roads close and dead-end without warning, and the "transito" or one-way roads have no semblance of order! Even with a GPS, I found navigating the area challenging and reverted to taxis. While we will undoubtedly book the Hotel El Convento (see my review), this is hotel gets top-honors from us for an economical visit to friends or to languish at the beach in P.R.!

Reviews.Title: “It did the job”
Reviews.Author: Emzaro
Reviews.Content: We went to PR for a much needed break from the cold and snow and to visit family. We chose Embassy suites because we are a family of 5 (kids:10,13,15) and this is the only hotel in all of PR that could fit 5 people without getting 2 rooms. There are some nice places with villas around the island, but we were using Hilton points that only allowed a stay in a hotel and not a timeshare/villa. That being said, it was perfect for what we needed.... a place big enough, breakfast included, pool, and beach. Here is some info: location - convenient, 5 minutes from airport (you can see it next to highway), planes flying over didn't take away from experience, if your little ones like airplanes it may even be a plus ha! pool - very nice, plenty of room, not heated which can be chilly for me in February spa- didn't do , but it was a hut behind pool area where you could have mani/pedi, massage casino - small, looks fun, but not the place singles would go to meet people..too small. We didn't bother because it was a family trip room - spacious for 4, but a bit tight for 5- we tried sleeping on fold-out couch so kids could be in the separate room with double beds. That didn't work. My husband and I ended up on a bed with 2 kids on the other. The youngest slept on the fold-out because he was light enough to not feel all the springs and bars. beach- very short walk, but you do need to cross a busy street (no traffic light) as another reviewer mentioned. Once you get to the beach, you have to walk left a little ways until you see the Embassy Suites banners where you can get chairs and towels. The beach is ok. This is not the part of the island where you get white, fine sand. Also, whoever sat on the chairs before us left a corona bottle and about 15 botttle caps in the sand which my husband and I cleaned up... shame on whoever did that.. no respect! food - breakfast was fine. I don't know what people complained about in other reviews. It's like any other buffet.. eggs, bacon/sausage, fruit, french toast, cereal, etc... you can also order an omelette made the way you want. The fruit was ok.. pineapple great.. cantaloupe hard. I think some people complain about it because they expect a gourmet meal.. maybe they should be staying at the Ritz or something. You get what you pay for. We never ate dinner at the hotel. We ate in Old San Juan and at the restaurant Mi Casita down the street. It's very close and the food was great! They deliver to the hotel, too.. typical Puerto Rican food.. loved it! Parking - I think it was $17/day I could complain about the fact that the music blasted on weekends until midnight or something..... that we were a towel short and it took the front desk until the next day to bring it (they said 20 minutes) or that we ordered an extra blanket and didn't get it for 2 days (after mentioning it to the desk on phone once and staff twice) , but hey ! we were on vacation and relaxing and this place did the job. We went to Old San Juan twice, drove to GuÃ¡nica to the mangrove island called "Guilligan island", visited Ponce, and went to Arecibo to see the observatory, and we also saw family.. perfect!! Although we honestly enjoyed our stay, we wouldn't stay there again. ** Get connecting rooms if you have a family bigger than 4. I found out they had a few, but you need to call way ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: andreac43
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2/26/11-3/3/11 for my 53rd birthday. Since my sis and I have never been to PR we had no "real" idea about location but this was the Best, especially if you are not renting a car. and wanting to do outdoor adventures and seeing Old San Juan. The bus ride was longer than a cab but only 75 cents is right up my alley! I booked through Expedia (air & hotel from Chicago) although we had a late check in of 11:30 pm the front desk staff was so accomodating in getting us checked in quickly and letting us know the lay of the land. We got our bags into the room on the 2nd floor and headed to the bar. It was a bit disappoinng for my sis that the bar keep did not have mint for mojito's or her type of vodka. He was courteous and efficient in setting us up with our 2nd choice cocktails. We did check out the casino but did not gamble. it was loud and yes you can hear it from your living room but as others have said, the bedroom was quiet. I must express that the beds were fantastic! having a bad back and sleeping on a theraputic mattress at home, I was worried without need. The bed and pillows were so comfortable that my sleep was never affected! The room was clean with plenty of towels. I do wish they would put regular blankets in the closet for covering up on the couch though. The complimentary breakfast was superb! The staff friendly and quick. I can not believe how many people do not tip. I know its included but come on, these folks work hard, have a great attitude and take fantastic care of their guests! The happy hour was appreciated after coming back from day long excursions! Again, Tip your bartender! The only negative I would have is the hot tub and parents who believe that is their childrens bath tub or swimming pool. I did read the rules of the tub and it says "children under 18 must be accompanied by a parent" Personally I do not want kids in my hot tub but I am not the proprieter. I would highly recommend this location to those who want to go to Fajardo or the rain forest as well as the other direction into OSJ. We will come back to PR and are looking at the Embassey Suites in Dorado. Thanks for a terrific birthday. One more point~ I think its excellent that management responds to negative reviews here. it shows that they do care!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Close to airport and beach. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaNYC10011
Reviews.Content: Was here for both business and leisure. Traveled with my elderly mother and 2 year old daughter. The staff were great. Very friendly. Incredibly helpful. Breakfast was convenient and a nice perk. Pool floats and towels are provided. They even have a beach area exclusive for Embassy Suites guests that includes lounge chairs, umbrellas, and towels. The negatives: I found a pair of jeans behind the couch from the previous guest, the pull-out in the living room is not very comfortable, and it can get very loud from the casino and music they have playing until 2 am. You can't hear it too much in the bedroom, but if you plan on using the living room, keep this in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Couples/Families and First Time Visitors”
Reviews.Author: JenniferKevin
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location. Consistent with US Embassy Suites. We've decided that Isla Verde is the perfect place to stay. It's not too Metropolitan, but it is within walking distance of anything you'll need. The area locals and visitors are very friendly and kind.The roooms are exactly what we expected. The fridge is a huge bonus. The pool area is great, very relaxed and welcoming. The staff is nice, though overworked, but they aren't around if you don't want them, but they are always willing to help. You should consider tipping them more, free drinks and breakfast doesn't mean the staff shouldn't get paid. We saw a lot of people not tipping at all. The lines for breakfast and Manager's reception will be long, as we expected. It's easy to walk to the grocery store and buy your own booze and bagels if you aren't patient. Parking is pretty affordable if you want to rent a car while there. we paid $16 a night to park at hotel, which was ok with us. We used ViasRentals to rent a car and liked the people there very much. There is beach service just a short walk (two blocks) that has chairs, towels and umbrellas free of charge for guests. They do run out of chairs and umbrellas at times, but the beach is nice enough to just put a towel down. Isla Verde is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome guest services!!! Will book again”
Reviews.Author: rashiars511
Reviews.Content: Here are the highlights 1. Awesome complementary breakfast, sorry, not just awesome but grand!!!! 2. Super complimentary happy hour drinks bar opens for - 2 hrs, drink anything, as much as you like like with complementary snacks and pay nothing 3. Guest services - amazing! helpful and friendly....we came in at 5:00 am had a check-in at 4:00 pm and they let us check in at 9:30 am. What more can you ask? 5. A few minutes walk to a very nice beach. Hotel has its own chairs, penumbra and towels for hotel guests. The beach has a. of course the clean blue green water and nice sand with a lot to do near by b. 3 pretty cool cheap bars where you can drink and watch basketball game in case you're missing one :) c.convenient jet ski rentals.... d. awesome walk and access to checkout nice resorts on the shore line 6. The hotel is conveniently located with in a 5 minute walk of local transportation area. Please keep exact change (75 cents for buses) to old San Juan. Commute on bus is about 35 minutes with all the stops and taxi takes about 20 bucks one way! 7. About 7 minutes taxi ride from the airport 8. There's outback steakhouse inside the hotel

Reviews.Title: “when you want to be home away from home, embassy takes care of you”
Reviews.Author: oramos7122
Reviews.Content: Let's begin with the guys in the valet parking, the are proffesional but personal, even though is hundreds of guest, they remember your name, gives you the news on the roads with problems and say hello with a smile. now, the front desk...I have only beautiful things to say about all of them. My little fridge stop working and all inside got spoiled, Iris in the front desk not only got my fridge replaced but sent a frit and cheese plate to my room with a bottle of wine, she appologized for all my spoiled good and gave me a sweet "gift" in return. the breakfast staff...Alexis is excelent, all the staff is incomparable, they make me feel like family, we exchange family stories, I get big hugs every morning, fresh coffe and an omelet to die for. now we go to Evelyn, my "suite lady", she cleans my room to my liking, she is a true friend. I can call her from work if I forget to take the sign from the door and she comes righ in and take care of me. Once I was sick with THE FLU, she offered to check on me, bring me soup and cleaned my room at odd hours for my covenience, I love that lady.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment written all over my face”
Reviews.Author: ketap06
Reviews.Content: Basically my sisters and I went on a 4 day trip to Puerto Rico last week. With so much anticipation of excitement just to get there.That quickly changed. A big percentage of that staff really needs to have workshops or additional training in etiquette. They have no manners,politeness and customer service skills.They are they to help assist the customers not make them feel alienated. Management really need to put that into consideration. I would never refer a friend to stay at the Embassy Suite in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel. Great for the price. Thought it was above 3.5 star level.”
Reviews.Author: robertoluvsaz
