Reviews.Content: My family stopped at this hotel for one night after our cruise. This hotel was clean, friendly service, and it had a great pool area and the environment in the lobby was very nice. This hotel is close to San Juan Luis Munoz Marin Airport, and is fairly close to restaurants. There is an Outback inside that looked nice. Didn't eat dinner there but we got desserts that were great. The room was very comfortable and the beds were very comfortable as well. Breakfast is included at Embassy Suites, and we did not get to go to there breakfast due to our early 7:30 flight the next morning, they begin breakfast around 6:30 on weekends. This hotel I thought had a great pool area. Hot tubs, a waterfall, and of course, the pool was very nice. The beach is also within an easy walking distance. I would for sure stay here in the future if I could get it again. Would reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OK - price is right”
Reviews.Author: LT69
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights over xmas break, including New Years eve. Can't beat the breakfast and happy hours thay Embassy Suites gives you. Location not great, few blocks from the beach area and backed up to a freeway. Not the easiest to find from the freeway. Near airport but still quite a drive to old San Juan. Had a casino which was pretty cheesey, lots of smoke. There were several nicer hotels over by the beach, but they were much pricier. For a couple days it would be fine, I wish we had stayed near old San Juan though. Outback restaurant was fine.

Reviews.Title: “So very disapointed !!!”
Reviews.Author: steveweese
Reviews.Content: Have used Hilton Hotels for years mainly Embassy Suites and I am sad to make this report. First the Good. Lovely Hotel just beautiful. Great Location, close to beach and Airport. Breakfast Poor. Bad fruit and just poor overall. Happy Hour on weekends was a joke.On thing this hotel does a good job of is to book groups and meeting, conventions and such. 20 t0 25 minute wait for drinks is too long. Then the US Navy was there for meeting and the navy guys butted in line all night long even after several complaints from other customers. I am embarrassed for the Navy. Their pool bar really is not ever open. The inside bar ran out of Mint for Mojitos No big deal untill after 2 days I left and walked to a store and bought 3 packages of mint for them. Then they made the drink with lemons and not limes. Told us they were out. When we told them the drink was made wrong they wanted to agrgue with us so we just left and spent our money and other places. Then the maid ripped us of after we left say the we had used the water ib our room and also a mufffin which we were billed for. Sorry but I am in to big of hurry to finish but please be carefull with your vactions and think twice before you book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free happy hour!”
Reviews.Author: erikaalexis
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel for the price. Free breakfasts and happy hour rocked, but you pay for it with the 14% resort fee that you must pay daily! Good location near airport, bus stop, 24 hour grocery store, and beach :-)

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ammi2024
Reviews.Content: I read reviews after booking my trip (not wise on my part) and I was concerned about reviews regarding the location of the hotel (near airport and highway). However, the location was never a problem for my husband and me. The hotel is not on the beach, it is about a block and a half away, but we did have a room where we could see the blue water and waves in the distance. Our room was clean and house keeping was always available. Although we stayed on the 6th floor, I was so amazed that I could actually hear the Coquis softly singing when I went to bed. I miss that sound so much now! The pool area was clean and never crowded (we were there for the weekdays, not the weekend). We barely noticed the sound of planes or traffic. The pool bar was open according to the posted hours. The daily free breakfast was actually very good and we indulged in freshly made omelets every morning - the wide selection of breakfast foods was great. There was never a long wait for omelets except for our last day (a Friday), where we waited less than 5 minutes to give our omelet order. Every night is the "manager's special" with free drinks from 5:30pm to 7:30pm. Remember, this is complimentary, so they are not using top of the line liquor, but it was nice to grab a free drink. This was not crowded either. All of the hotel staff were friendly and polite. The hotel has a tour company on site, Dragon Fly tours. All of the women who work for the company are friendly and helpful. One of the staff members, Alicia, helped us set up 3 events: tour of El Yunque (a long hike, but fun- and great tour guide Mr. Lopez), a couples massage in a private area behind the pool (so relaxing!) and a reservation for dinner at a restaurant at Caribe Hilton (amazing food, service and beach view - we had a romantic dinner overlooking the beach and the moon shining down on the ocean). There is an Outback Steakhouse in the hotel and the staff were great there too. If you are in search of authentic Puerto Rican food, there is a great restaurant, Coladas, up the block at a neighboring hotel. The food and drinks there were wonderful! There is a small casino in the hotel, but Iâ€™m not big on gambling, so we didnâ€™t go in. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would not mind staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our pre-cruise travel...”
Reviews.Author: much2buzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night on December 18, 2010 for our pre-cruise travel. Check in was extremely easy. Our room was exactly what we expected with a bonus view of the pool. The room was nice, quiet and clean. Breakfast was good with lots of choices with very limited seating. Lots of construction in the area, however, could not hear it at all once inside. I would stay at this hotel again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay. Full Suite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: irondoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over New Years with my extended family over New Years. It was very close to the airport, so very convenient, but it was quite quiet. No plane noise. The hotel boasts a multistory atrium and is well appointed. There is a daily happy hour with free beer, wine, and chips which is very nice for a quick snack and a full included breakfast everyday with omelettes, eggs, bacon and much more! The rooms were spacious and as the title says are all suites, with both a bedroom, living room with foldout couch, microwave and refridge. The beds were very comfortable and the room updated and clean with good housekeeping. The pool area was quite nice and although very near an overpass was nicely screened by trees and vegitation. The pool was quite cold, and unfortunately the hot tub was broken for 3 of 5 days. I found the staff behind the desk not quite as welcoming as I'm used to. They were unhelpful in assisting with a printer which would not print in the business center, however the business center was free! $19 per day for parking is a bit high as well. The hotel is a block or two from a very nice beach and has included free towels and beach chairs for hotel guests! There are numerous nice restaurants and inexpensive options as well within walking distance. The hotel and airport are about 20 mins from the fort and the old town area, so a car, bus, or taxi will be necessary to visit these areas. Just for new years, we decided not to do the $89 per person buffet and partied in our room, but the open balconies and atrium allowed us to enjoy the confetti, live music and festivities from a commanding view of the 2nd floor open balcony and atrium. And much new years revelrie was occurring on all the hotel balconies, so was the best of both worlds! The rooms were remarkably well insulated, I think helped by the extra space of the living area, because even though we turned in before the festivies were over downstairs, I did not hear any extra noise! There is a casino inside as well which I did not visit.

Reviews.Title: “Construction, but a nice place otherwise.”
Reviews.Author: AkulaTheShark
Reviews.Content: As we pulled into the carport out front I could hear the pile driver attempting to ram its latest charge home. CLANG, CLANG, CLANG.... "Great!" was all I could think. I had business to do in PR and wanted to make sure I was ready for it. Luckily the pile driver didn't run all night, but there is plenty of construction going on. They have closed one of the entrances, and are working on a parking structure or something, next to the hotel. The casino is smallish, blackjack is 5 deck out of a shuffle master. There are quite a few slots, and other games. I didn't see craps. The breakfast is excellent, the coffee is very good. I wasn't impressed with the service, everyone seems a little angry. I don't suggest eating at the outback in the lobby, it isn't good and doesn't live up to the outback on the mainland US. Metropole is pretty close and is excellent food. (EXCELLENT) There is another hotel very close by, right out the front door, head over there for drinks at the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, given other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Maybeinerror
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in this hotel at the end of our trip to PR, and had a very satisfactory experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our suite was comfortable and clean. (Our children--8 & 10--did not give high marks to the pull-out couch bed, but that's why they got to sleep on it, not the parents!) Our Hilton Honors membership entitled us to "skip the line" for the breakfast buffet (which was a good thing since there were several college swim teams also at the hotel who arrived at the same time for breakfast that we did). We did not use the pool, but it certainly looked lovely (my husband reported, however, that the hot tub was not "hot"). We ate dinner in the Outback Steakhouse off the lobby, where the service was slow but friendly and the food was no different than the Outback in our hometown. Even with the proximity to the airport, we were not bothered in the least by airplane noise. We checked out in the morning and checked our bags with the bellman while we explored San Juan ($20 cab ride to Old San Juan). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Poor Service - STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK”
Reviews.Author: nadomom
Reviews.Content: We received exceptionally, insultingly poor service at this hotel. To start off, the employee at the front desk lost our reservation. After we were able to "prove" our reservation by presenting our printed-off reservation receipt, we were grudgingly granted a room. We received a roll-away bed in our room without a pillow or blanket. We called housekeeping with a request for these items, and were assured that we would receive them within ten minutes. We called again after an hour, and went down to inquire at the front desk after two hours. The head manager who was at the desk was brusque and defensive. After another hour (three hours after our initial call) we called again. Finally, after four hours, the housekeeper came with only half of the items requested. When we asked her for a blanket, she said that we had never requested one; however, we speak spanish as well as english, and were able to see that "blanket" was indeed written on her list. We finally received the blanket thirty minutes later with a hasty apology from the manager. We found this service to be extremely insulting and poor. While the guest rooms are nice, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone due to its extremely poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, lousy service, stench by the pool”
Reviews.Author: SmdAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: Pros Rooms are nice. Free breakfast a plus. Â Located near many restaurants and a block from Isla Verde beach. Cons Front desk extremely disorganized, very slow check in, unwilling to explain room charges. Major stench by the pool on our second day, smells like sewage (due to proximity of trash trucks, says staff). Location advertises a pool bar and restaurant, but it was not open during posted hours. After many complaints from patrons, staff reluctantly opened it. Back bedrooms are quiet, but do not count on using the sofabed in the living area if you want to sleep. Loud music from the atrium goes til midnight. Location advertises room safes, but front desk could not locate key for ours, Â so no safe for us.

Reviews.Title: “A large family hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: inhogheaven
Reviews.Content: We arrived Nov 25 pre-cruise, and stayed for 3 days. This hotel has everything you should need. A small resort store, a casino and bar, a generous seating area with creek and foliage, a very nicely designed resort pool area with it's own kiddie pool, an outdoor smoking area, attentive taxi stand, a grocery store within walking distance, and two computers in the business center. The breakfast is very generous. The manager's reception is also very generous. This hotel is extremely popular with local Puerto Rican families. When we arrived it was the busy Thanksgiving weekend so the hotel was full of large boisterous families. If this is not your gig, look elsewhere. You will pay much more elsewhere which will limit the number of kids you spend your time with. My adopted parents were completely intolerant of the noise and the number of kids. As a result, they hated their experience here. I had an Ipod which I used to lessen the noise at the pool. I appreciated that I was visiting another culture, and I made it work. I would have preferred a quiet hotel, but I was able to co-exist here. The staff in every section were very good. There is no control at the pool so the kids took over the pool, period. The families were up partying till way after midnight. Expect noise when they return to their hotel rooms. Expect lines for breakfast and for the Managers reception. When you make your reservation, ask what kind of parties they have booked during your stay. This will help you decide if the amenities are worth it should the hotel have big parties scheduled. I will recommend the hotel but expect that you will check on what to expect before you book it. Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPolo187
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our little son stayed at the Embassy Suite in Puerto Rico for 2 nights. The location is perfect as it is very close to the beach and to the airport which means that you can leave to the airport at the very last minute! Around the hotel there are a few restaurants and bars and a supermarket too. The walk to the beach is about 5 minutes walking, but if you wish the relax by the pool you will not be disappointed as the pool is simply gorgeous! We did not have any food in the hotel apart of breakfast which was of good quality. The big plus in this hotel is the 'open bar' from 17:30 to 19:30....free drinks for everyone!!! Overall a very good stay, would love to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Embassy Suites I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: born2travel2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites, San Juan for our honeymoon. We chose this hotel for the price and close proximity to the beach and airport. BIG MISTAKE! First of all, the room was not on par w/other ES properties I've visited. The bathroom was hideous! It was not that clean, paint was chipping, the wood on the door was stripped. It was just tacky. The couch felt like it was made of plastic. The bedroom was tiny and we had a view of the parking lot and construction site. Another con was that the hotel is located in a heavy construction zone. The beach (Isla Verde) was NOT one of the nicest, quite dirty in fact. My advice would be to spend a couple of extra hundred bucks (if you can) and stay in Condodo. It's worth it, especially if you're on an extended stay. Staff was not very courteous. They treated us like we were an annoyance. Breakfast was unorganized and I felt like the staff was "policing" the dining room to make sure guests weren't trying to take food out.

Reviews.Title: “Busy, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: Nuristanoply
Reviews.Content: This is your standard Embassy Suites. It was clean and the staff was friendly. It is an excellent hotel if you are on business. Easy access to freeways. The area is a little seedy, but we didn't have any issues during our stay. The breakfast and evening manager's special was excellent. The Hotel has an outstanding Outback Restaurant inside so you don't have to roam around the city after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Worked great for our family for a pre and post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: coloparkers
Reviews.Content: We're big fans of Embassy Suites properties as they provide more room than a typical hotel room (great for a family) and are a good value with the included breakfast and evening cocktails. This property did not disappoint in regards to those criteria. Breakfast was tasty and there were tons of food options. The evening manager's reception/cocktail hour was a bit more chaotic. The lines were very long, but did move quickly. I stuck with wine so it wasn't watered down, as some previous posters have commented. The snacks were a bit skimpy: popcorn and crumbled/broken chex type mix. Don't expect to make a meal of it, but it's free, right? We enjoyed the pool area and felt they do a good job disguising the fact you're backed up to the highway. Room was clean and roomy and soundproofing was excellent. We didn't hear planes despite proximity to the airport and we didn't hear the bar/lobby/casino area directly below us on our final night. You are within walking distance to the beach, a small market, and several restaurants including fast food if you desire. There are also three free computers with internet access in the lobby to quickly look through your email, etc.. Also, the indoor garden/atrium area is a very nice place to sit and visit. I actually had family visiting Puerto Rico at the same time staying in a different area. We enjoyed sitting in the atrium area for over an hour visiting while the kids enjoyed the koi pond, arcade, and riding the glass elevators. On the down side you're quite far from Old San Juan so if this is your objective stay there instead. The cab ride to OSJ and the cruise port was $15 for five of us plus $1 per piece of luggage. That was expensive enough that we didn't want to go into OSJ for an evening meal or some exploring. The taxi ride from the airport (which you can see from the hotel) was about $12 plus $1 per bag. Pretty excessive, IMHO. I'd recommend this hotel for a brief stay as it is a good value and near the beach. Although the pool is nice, it's not a "resort" pool as it is on the small side. Rooms don't have balconies or views so don't consider this property if you're looking for a romantic extended stay. If you're looking for beachfront, consider Priceline and try to get one of the many beachfront hotels a few blocks away. Or if you want the ambiance of Old San Juan (but no beach) consider hotels in that area. We were very pleased with our stay here as it met all our needs. I would stay here again if I were in San Juan for a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: dreamer3825
Reviews.Content: Good location to be able to walk to the beach, although I wish it was on the beach. I found the area to be very safe. My sister & I walked back to the hotel from the nightclub at El San Juan at 4 a.m. and felt safer than we do in the States. Breakfast was pretty good, free drinks in the early evening were a nice touch. The hotel has an Outback, a little pizza place, and some other restaurants. We had lunch there and it was very good (although pricey). There were not a lot of other restaurants nearby (except in the other hotels), so we went to Old San Juan for dinner most nights.The casino there was small but nice - I won a little on the slots.The rooms were a little dated but were good, it was nice to have a suite. Customer service in the hotel was excellent - everyone that I encountered was very nice and professional. The pool was very nice. The airport is very close by, but the hotel does a nice job of keeping it on the down low. Jacuzzi was big. I really enjoyed this hotel, and San Juan in general!

Reviews.Title: “Too many other places to stay - pass on this one”
Reviews.Author: SEAPlatinum
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 nights as a Hilton Honors Diamond Member. It is very close to the airport which was convenient and you do hear the planes when outside at the pool. We rented a car so we didn't check out accessibility to public transporation etc. Room was typical Embassy Suite (ES) layout - but couch was not in good shape as previous reviewer noted. Safe did not have electronic combo - you needed to make a $85 security deposit to get the key from front desk - let's them know you have valuable stuff in your room doesn't it? Bathroom had some signs of aging - caulking smeared all along the floor, missing in parts of the shower enclosure and a few missing curtain hooks. As a Diamond member, we are entitled to have certain amenities brought to our room which they apparently don't do before check in - they wait until 6:30 or 7 or in my case, when I go down and ask for them the second time because they weren't there by 8PM. At other ES, they are in the room when I check in since my room has been preassigned. There is a casino in the lobby. We are used to noisy kids and people in the lobby having their voices echo, but the loud music that goes until midnight (or 1 on Friday-Sunday) is quite loud, even with the door to your room closed and is easily heard over the television. Evening reception was ridiculous - the drinks were dispensed from a fountain tap and were so watered down, I don't think anyone had checked to see if the syrup needed to be refilled in some time. Breakfast was a bit disorganized as is often the case at ES. For some reason, the flow doesn't work and there are choke points in the process. Lots of tables in the lobby to use and they were kept clean which is something we don't usually see. The two guys who were cooking really hustled. Pool was nice - lots of lounge chairs. Good sun exposure for most of the day. Bartender had to call to get instructions on how to charge my drink to the room. Note to food manager - That should have been covered a few times before leaving him outside alone. All in all, we enjoyed our trip to San Juan, but will stay at another hotel on our return. We recommend you learn from our experiences and stay somewhere else. If I had been told that this particular ES was not at the high end of their quality range, I would have stayed elsehere. There are many other Hilton properties in Puerto Rico to choose from. We stay about 45 nights a year between Hilton & Hyatt groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great place”
Reviews.Author: meOnTP
Reviews.Content: Close the beaches, restaurants, clubs. Nice Hotel, but Puerto Rico was the real selling point. Had to walk about 2 blocks to get to the beach, but its is incredible. The hotel staff are just amazing and the hotel quality is good, clean and in good shape. No balcony and no exceptional view, but you don't need that. The pool was nice, happy hour was good, the breakfast was incredible. A little pricey, though. Great experience, never seen so many good looking women! A that includes the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Cozee
Reviews.Content: The staff were great during check in and check out. The process went smoothly and was quick. The king suite was clean and comfortable. It was a little slippery around the pool so wear sandals with a good grip. There is a Pueblo grocery store nearby, just ask for directions. The Outback in the hotel had fast service, price was reasonable, and the food tasty.The cocktail hour was disappointing as it consisted of dried out popcorn and drinks with no alcohol! I guess they meant well. The breakfast was worth it as there was a lot of variety and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: KhemQueen
Reviews.Content: The casino was VERY SLOW in customer service. The couch that made into a bed was awful...If you didn't have back problems before your night of slumber you certainly did the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy's Best”
Reviews.Author: Sobeorbust
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde. I go to PR every year to visit family and alwasy have a couple of days before returning home to relax. No better place to do it that at the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde. The place is just amazing, great hotel, great location, who cares about a 2 block walk to the beach, great pool great everything. The staff is the upmost profesionals and extremely helpful. I made use of the Lobby Bar, great drinks, and a very nice hostess in the afternoon. Bought lunch there too, no complaints. The lobby bar next to the Casino is also very nice and the bartender there tops. Room was clean everything worked, housekeeping was flawless, front desk amazing. I honestly cant say enough good things about this hotel. As far as I am concerned there is no better place to stay when I go to PR for the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: nurseholly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a leisure trip recently. The hotel was very close to the airport and within walking distance to beach, restaurants, and a 24 hr. grocery store! Fairly short cab ride to Old San Juan - cabs available at hotel all the time. Breakfast every morning was delicious and the afternoon manager's reception was fun! The snacks were a little boring but you can get as many drinks as you want (and they take suggestions)! The pool area was gorgeous with lots of chairs...we didn't have too much trouble finding empty chairs in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: t2mn
Reviews.Content: Hotel was standard Embassy Suites. Check-in was smooth and quick. We had a two room suite which was really nice - lots of room. Breakfast each day was good - long lines as you would expect but good food. If you go early you can get a table - like before 8. Evening reception was also really good - they stock many choices of drinks. I would highly recommend the tours they offer on-site. We had a blast at all of the ones we went on ---horseback riding was the best. Rainforest tour was awesome and don't miss the bio-bay kayak tour. The only downside is the activities are like a 30-45 minute ride from hotel. Hotel location is actually really good - close to airport (which you can't hear) and walking to grocery store and several restarants. This is NOT a beach hotel - but pool is really nice. Beach is a 5-10 minute walk. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this hotel for the price !”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELING-REGINA
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a great breakfast and cocktail hour included in the price. Paid $113/night. 2 blocks to the beach and to the supermarket. All rooms are suites which was great for having a frig and microwave. Pool/jacuzzi grounds were very pretty. Did a good job trying to camoflauge the sound of the highway right behind hotel with waterfalls. Not near Old San Juan - $20 cab ride each way to get there. Hotels on Ave Isle Verde one block away had lots of nightlife so it wasn't a big deal. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base for vacation in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Travelcrazy311
Reviews.Content: We booked based on price, location, and tripadvisor reviews. The hotel and rooms are just as pictured. You will have more space here than many of the surrounding hotel rooms offer. We had a quiet room (higher floors are best for noise control) with a large flat-screen tv in both the living room and bedroom. Ms Sorda, our housekeeper, was exceptional, and always had a smile for us. During our stay the hotel conducted a fire drill, complete with firemen in their turn-out gear. They even staged a rescue, which made me feel that the hotel really cares about safety. The place is well laid out and everything is a short walk. The pool is divine and in the evenings we had it practically to ourselves. Breakfast is very tasty (I highly recommend the fluffy "pan-keks" !) The beach is an easy five minute walk. There is a Walgreens and many restaurants nearby, including Starbucks about 2 blocks away at El San Juan Hotel. We were able to tour El San Juan and also El Conquistador Hotels during our visit, and found them to be elegant but a bit highbrow for our taste. Embassy Suites is geared to families and offer many services. There are always cabs waiting out front. If you want to rent a car, Dollar is across the street. Spend the extra 4 bucks a day and use valet instead of self-parking. It's worth it. There is a pizza parlor, gift shop, also a steakhouse and a pool bar. We loved the daily manager's reception. I do recommend you wait until about 6 or 630 when the lines become much shorter. Book your own adventures and you will save money. Beware of drivers as stop signs and red lights are more of a suggestion than a mandate in PR. Must see: El Morro, the bio bay..in Old San Juan, eat at St Germain's cafe for lunch or Al dente for dinner. We are planning to return to this hotel next year. It was the perfect hub for all our adventures!

Reviews.Title: “That price is not on my reservation!”
Reviews.Author: BColeman
Reviews.Content: I used the online website to make a reservation and I called the hotel a few days prior to checking in to double check that my rooms were next to each other. On the reservation page I printed out said exactly: 2BDRM/2 BA STE- 1 KG/2DBL. That means 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, one room with a king and another room with 2 queens. First, she told me that my reservation was for one room and the price of the second room was not included in my reservation rate. So, the price of my hotel stay has nearly doubled. Yes, extremely upsetting!!! Looking on the bright side, luckily I found out 4 days before checking-in instead of the day I checked out and got the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: DAGTucson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a mile from the airport and thus seemed a good place for an overnight stay prior to boarding an early morning flight. Not! There is no airport shuttle, so getting there and back is a $12 cab ride each way. My (non-smoking) room was clean but smelled of stale smoke; one of the chairs was falling apart and the alarm clock didn't work, a major annoyance given that the requested wakeup call never came. The staff was indifferent and had no explanation for a $16 "hotel service fee," that should have been billed as a "hotel non-service" fee. The only positive thing about my short stay was a good meal at the Outback Steakhouse on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: VFNY
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week's stay at the Embassy Suites. Overall, the hotel offers an awful lot for the money. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff was excellent. They responded quickly to all requests. For the $15 daliy resort fee you get a breakfast that is not the usual cold cereal & muffins. It is made to order omelets, pancakes etc. At night, every guest gets 2 free alcoholic or soft drinks as well as snacks. One of the drawbacks is that the beach is 2 blocks away. There is also fee to park your car at the hotel. The hotel is very close to a highway and the airport, so the views leave a lot to be desired, although we did not hear the planes. If you don't mind walking to the beach and having a view of a highway and airport, this hotel has a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and great location...but the rooms and service are lacking”
Reviews.Author: dumbyellodog
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Embassy Suites from Aug 6 - 13 for a weeklong vacation. The hotel lobby and pool area are absolutely beautiful...love hearing the Coqui frogs in the lobby! The hotel is no more than 10 minutes from the airport and just a block or so from the Isle Verde beach, so location is excellent. It took us a few times to figure out how exactly to get to the hotel from the highway, but we figured it out by trial and error. We stayed using the Stay and Dine with Us promotion, which was well worth the small room price increase. On the downside to our visit, the service was spotty at best. When we checked in, we we not given our vouchers for food, the front desk attendant told us the $50 would be automatically deducted from our bill when we ordered food. When I checked the bill in the morning, the room service charge was still present. After taking to the front desk, they realized they did not give us our vouchers upon check in. Would have been nice if they compensated us for the error. It took 3 days of asking for extra blankets before we actually received them (had to go personally down to the front desk to get them!). The room (336) was showing its age...chipped paint, burn marks in the carpet, the shower soap dish was falling off the wall due to faulty caulking. Overall a good hotel to stay at, but needs a litlle TLC.

Reviews.Title: “My experience was wonderful. The staff exceeded our expecations.”
Reviews.Author: jdpug1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located minutes from the airport. We arrived early in the morning. Melvin at the front desk was wonderful. He directed us to the buffet breakfast with cooks also preparing made to order requests. The breakfast was hot with lots of variety to choose from. The staff was prompt in meeting guests needs while keeping supplies stocked. We then did some gambling in the on site casino and before we knew it our room was ready. When we arrived at the room it was fresh and clean with a big bathroom, coffee maker and mini-refrigerator. There was a nice grocery store and pharmacy within short walking distance. We enjoyed the bartenders at the complimentary happy hour. They were very friendly. The hotel is a brief walk to the beach, however, we enjoyed the pool so much that we never found the need to go to the beech. When I had a problem with my cell phone, Christina at the front desk was very helpful in locating a sprint store nearby. Nice hotel and staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “There is no need to leave the hotel to have a good time.”
Reviews.Author: pegspeanut
Reviews.Content: We and our friends stayed at the hotel for 4 days. From our arrival from the airport (10 minutes away) until check-out, we had no complaints. The rooms were clean, all of the lights worked, the refrigerator was cold, our view was awesome and there was free internet. The tables in the breakfast/atrium area were used throughout the day and several times were sticky and dirty by evening. The entire staff was friendly, helpful and smiling. The cook to order breakfast was good, and like the evening Manager's Reception, was complimentary. We enjoyed the Casino. in fact, we enjoyed it several times a day! If there was a negative it would probably be the pool. It was quite large and lovely, but very busy with kids, many of whom were jumping and diving from the rocks. The parents should have been policing them and a hotel security person was....but not often enough. We went to Old San Juan one day for shopping and lunch and then didn't venture off the property again as we were there for R & R. The Hotel restaurant was the Outback Steakhouse! It's one of my favorites and lived up to my expectations in food quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Isabel176
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 5 nights. Breakfast was great and enjoyed the daily manager's reception. Room and service was great. I would stay at the Embassy again and again.

Reviews.Title: “COULD NOT BE BETER”
Reviews.Author: Maribel75
Reviews.Content: I stayed from the 18th-23th of July. And i have to say i was sooo satisfied.I loved the hotel, it was close to alot of places: airport, supermarkets, mall, souvenirs stores and various places to sit and eat. The hotel has many facilities, Casino, Pool, Game room ect. The rooms was very nice, the staff also. Everything was great. But it was this one day housekeeping forgot to put bed sheets, but besides that to me its the best hotel in the area. great for a Family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Big Let Down”
Reviews.Author: travelguy78
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family one night post cruise. Having stayed at Hilton Embassy Suites in the past we expected nothing less than the clean, comfortable stay we have always experienced, but this hotel did not live up to the usual Hilton experience. To begin the hotel itself was understaffed. Tables at breakfast and happy hour were sparse , and it took upwards of 40min for staff to come and bus the dirty tables after people were done eating. The rooms as well were terribly disappointing. The carpet felt soggy, and the room itself had a musty smell. Worst of all one of our bed sheets had a brown stain on them, which looked like dried blood or food. Furniture was old and there were several damaged lighting fixtures hanging awkwardly from the walls. The hotel was very crowded, mainly with families and lots of children and teens. Many of these children roamed unsupervised throughout the hotel all day and night. The noise at night was terrible and made getting to sleep very difficult. Was glad to check out in the morning. Never again. Try the Doubletree San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Brynoke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I choose this hotel to stay the night before leaving on our cruise because of its location to the airport. I have to admit that the overall the hotel was pleasant and clean. The casino was relatively small and we went in and lost $5 in the slots. We thought the hotel staff was courteous throughout and very helpful when we asked for directions to nearby localities. If I were going to stay in San Juan for an extended period, I would consider another property closer to Old San Juan and the beaches, but this hotel served its purposes for what we needed. Thanks Embassy Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Thinker_to_go
Reviews.Content: As Embassy Suites go, this one is about right: comfortable, right price range, better than average level of luxury, etc. The rooms do seem a bit run-down (the air conditioning return vent, for example, showed quite a bit of rust), but, at least in my case, not to the point of disappointment. The property is right next to the airport and close to (though not on) the beach. This made for convenient travel in and out, but only after you figure out how to navigate this area (Isla Verde): you miss a turn and you end up waaay off. Get used to that if, though, Puerto Rico is notorious for being hard to drive around. The local beach is OK, if a little dirty. The pool is huge. Breakfast and the manager's reception were alright; nothing to write home about. Here's what I'd say to others considering staying here: it's a great place to be if you are going to travel around north-east PR. Get up, have breakfast, and head out for the day. When you get back, head to the pool or the casino before you go to sleep (on the as-expected high-quality Hilton beds). Repeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Embassy Suites for a Limited Stay or Airport/Cruise Connection”
Reviews.Author: LeaveFromPA
Reviews.Content: I stayed one evening at this embassy suites. In general, it is the typical embassy. There is nothing particularly special about it as a hotel, but it is a good, quality choice for individuals or families. It is quiet, clean and the staff takes good care of the hotel. I would say the following things impressed me: (1) I had a view of the pool. The staff was constantly cleaning it. People seemed to be enjoying it very much. (2) The breakfast/managers reception were typical, but it was packed...expect to spend some time in tline. (3) Taxis are easy to get...and prices to the standard places (old san juan, airport, etc) are pre-set. Dont bother renting a car unless you plan to go far away. (4) Beach was pleasant...but hot...bring sun screen. (5) THe casino is nice, but tiny. Dont expect Vegas...but it's not a smokey slot parlor either. There is little to do around here, so I would not think this is a good location for more than a day or two. Its fine to spend a night and move on though.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: internationalboy
Reviews.Content: This atrium hotel with lively casino is 2 blocks from Isla Verde Beach, an Atlantic Ocean playground. Distance to cruise-ship piers is 6 miles; Old San Juan is 7 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Forth Visit - Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: RedCarnationReady
Reviews.Content: This hotel does get busy but it feels sort of like an "Adult Camp"; you meet people at Breakfast, at the Pool, at the Manager's Reception..it's a pretty social place. Having an extra room is wonderful! Great location. Sorry I missed seeing my favorite staffer, Melvyn!!! The ONLY "complaint" I might have is that the main lobby is too dark at night and the sound of the waterfalls/fountain sure is loud but once you're in your room, total peace and quiet and their pool is fantastic and open late!

Reviews.Title: “Who Can Complain When You're In Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: Boston-Girl03
Reviews.Content: Room/suite was average size. The only thing it had going for it was that it was "two rooms". It wasn't particulary clean but not too bad. Every morning there is a large breakfast which was great and every afternoon there was a manager's reception with free alcoholic drinks and snacks. There were so many fees tacked on to the room besides the regular room charge that I almost feel like the free reception wasn't free. There was a pool bar but no service. Also, the bar didn't open until after 1:pm. so if you wanted anything to drink, water, soda, you had to go inside the hotel and get it yourself. I thought the daily resort fee would at least include service at the pool. Not sure what the resort fee actually was for but who can complain about a few fees here and there when you're in gorgeous Puerto Rico! There is a small casino in the hotel but there are a few better ones at the hotels a block away. The weather was beautiful, day and night. and staying on the island is a blast. This hotel is a short cab ride away from Old San Juan but just one block from the beach. Be careful of the drivers outside of the hotel. They rip you off by charging you almost double of what the ride into Old San Juan should be. Unfortunately, we found that out on our last day. Next time I go to Puerto Rico, I would stay closer to Old San Juan since we went there just about every day, but overall, it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Going down hill”
Reviews.Author: gator2828
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to Puerto Rico on business for many years and usually stay at the Isla Verde Embassy Suites. The last few times I have noticed a steady downturn in the quality of this hotel. On arrival I checked into my room and discovered the air was broken. The air was repaired only to break at 11:30 pm. That night the hotel was over run with kids celebrating prom. While this is a milestone in their lives, the staff should not have allowed obviously juveniles to drink openly in the hotel and be served the complimentry drinks. While the drinking age in PR is 18, I saw kids 15-16 years old openly drinking and being served at the bar. The next morning the soap dish broke off the wall in the shwer and fell on my foot. At the buffet breakfast, just about everything was gone by 8:30 am and the cooks said they had no intention of cooking any more. This seemed strange since breakfast is served until 9:30 am. Both nights I stayed the hotel hosted proms and the noise and slamming of doors went on until at least 4:00 am. While once a great hotel this place is suffering from neglect and very poor attitude of staff. I guess next time I will stay at the Intercontinental or the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but things can always be better.”
Reviews.Author: mjdarrell
Reviews.Content: Stay was from May 15th thru the 19th. Arrived in SJU around 1:30; but didnt go directly to the hotel because I knew check in wasnt until 4pm. Rented a car from SJU and we went directly to Plaza Las Americas to check that out. Got to the Embassy Suites around 5pm. Check in was a breeze. I asked for a room overlooking the SJU runway and they quickly accomodated. The suite was very nice. There were 2 beds for the kids and I slept on the pull out couch. Although, when I woke up the next morning I began to itch from what I can only think were some type of bugs. The kids didnt complain of itching so I was okay and decided I could live with it. Anyway, back to check-in on the first day, we went directly to the pool and relaxed. The next morning, Sunday May 16th, my birthday, I woke up to a note under my door that there was a 5.8 tremblor in the zone of Mayaguex which is about 120 miles west of San Juan. It occured about 1am however I didnt feel it. It woke my son up. I didnt notice any items had shifted. But, what a bang to start a birthday. Anyway, back to the hotel. The breakfast buffet is everything other reviewers have said. They cook omlets to order. Plus, there is bacon, sausage, potatoes, corn beef hash, pancakes, french toast, fruits, cereal, juice, coffee, hot chocolate, et al. The atrium area on the weekend had vendors that were showing their wares(sp). There was even a man who was making pottery with a clay machine. It reminded me of Demi Moore in "Ghost". The nice part of that was that he would let the kids try their hand at pottery making. The only downside was Carolina experienced some torrential downpours that flooded the streets and consequently affected the roof and subsequently the pipes which caused some problems. Specifically, there was no water coming out of the shower. I called the front desk and they told me it would be rectified in "10 minutes" Maintenance came to my room twice. All told it took approximately 90 minutes. The maintenance man was so apologetic that there was no way I could hold onto my disgust. We did experience the opportunity to eat at the Outback Steakhouse on the property and the staff was great. To be honest, the food alright. The kids loved it though. Since it was my birthday, they sang happy birthday to me in both english and spanish. Another night I got pizza for the kids from the Atrium Cafe. They didnt have any complaints. Because there are so many fast food places nearby, like Church's Chicken, Ponderosa, Burger King, Chilis, et al, everyone should be able to dine on what they want and be happy. I came to Puerto Rico for my 50th birthday and a vacation. Lastly, to have a relaxing good time. And I did. Lastly, the Manager Reception was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i realy expected”
Reviews.Author: sxm1997queen
Reviews.Content: The Welcome by the staff was ok. They were friendly. The breakfast was ok. The location was ok. The place was clean that is a plus. The rooms was not what i expected. Thier was a baseball event of some kind so it had kids running around knocking on your doors. The internet connection gave a little issue to get on. The cocktail hour was not all that what we expected. The casino to me was not all that either. The fact that i have been to casinos before especially in St Maarten where you gamble and get free drinks once you gambling . That did not happen thier. Other than that is was not what i expected for me when i see the room pictures online to what i see in reality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- but ended up with missing items!”
Reviews.Author: vgomez1215
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at this hotel in the past and had a fantastic time. So there was no doubt that when we were planning our trip, the Embassy Suites was our top choice. We had a great time- but on our second day there, my boyfriend's swim trunks went missing. We thought maybe the housekeeping staff mistakenly took it with our towels so we went to the reception desk and inquired about a lost and found box or how we can ask our house keeper about the trunks. The receptionist radioed someone to inquire about our missing trunks but of course, "'they were not found in the laundry". The receptionist that "helped" us wasn't too concerned that the trunks were missing and didn't even offer to contact us if they turned up. We went about our vacation and enjoyed the daily breakfast and Manager's reception, which was great, but we noticed they did not have top-shelf liquor like they had the last time we stayed there. No biggie- liquor is liquor and its nice that the bartenders were friendly! Anyway, on our 4th day there, my favorite cover-up went missing!! Now, we feel like our stuff isn't just disappearing. Its upsetting to us because we enjoyed our stay and if it wasn't because our clothing was 'disappearing' we would probably stay here every time we go to PR. But next time, we are probably going to stay elsewhere. On this trip, we went to Las Cavernas de Camuy, a must-see for anyone interested in natural wonders.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and even better Happy Hour”
Reviews.Author: beachygal411
Reviews.Content: The room was about what you'd expect- clean and comfortable. Service was fine, bed comfortable. We enjoyed the great breakfast and the Happy Hour. I liked that the Outback was right there- always consistently good. We didn't get too lucky at the casino and the street out front in Isla Verde was a mess that tied up traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Free-Form Tropical Pool and the Buffet Breakfast was Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: cz63
Reviews.Content: During our post-cruise stay in San Juan, we stayed at the Embassy Suites in Isla Verda, July 12-16, 2009. After deparking from our cruise ship, the Carnival Victory, we made our way to the Embassy Suites and arrived there around 11:00 am. The disadvantage of arriving so early, was that our room was not ready and we were told, would not be ready until 3:30 pm. In the meantime, we were given a pool access card and were able to store our luggage in the secured confines of the Conference Room. It was amazing to see this room filled with so many bagsâ€”and they all had Carnival Victory tags on them too! After dropping off our luggage, we changed into our swim suits and hung out with other Carnival Victory cruisers by the enormous tropical landscaped pool complete with waterfalls! At 3:30 pm, my husband went back to the front desk to check if our room was readyâ€”it wasnâ€™t. We were told it would be another Â½ hour. We checked again at 4:30 and finally weâ€™re given the key to our room. We had a spacious suite on the 7th floor, (complete with mini-fridge and microwave), overlooking the gorgeous, free-form tropical pool. The boys were immediately drawn to the large 37â€� flat-screen TV! The lobby Atrium is very nicely landscaped with tropical plants, ponds and waterfalls. There are four glass elevators, allowing its passengers to peer down into the tropical beauty of the Atrium. In the morning we enjoyed the hot buffet breakfast, served until 9:30 am in the tropical Atrium. The breakfast buffet included bacon, sausages, cereal, muffins, bagels, toast, fresh fruit, juices, coffee, tea and even soda! The Embassy Suites also offered â€œmade-to-orderâ€� breakfast which included omelets, eggs and pancakes. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious! After being spoiled with all the good food on the Carnival Victory, the breakfast provided at the Embassy Suites was the next best thing to being back on the Lido Deck! Another nice perk offered by the Embassy Suites was the Managers Reception Party, held every evening from 5:30-7:30 pm, in the tropical Atrium. During the Managers Reception, guests are offered free alcoholic drinks and soft drinks. Free snacks including popcorn, peanuts, party mix or chips with salsa were also offered. The Managerâ€™s Reception party was a big hit with the boys. No matter where we were in Puerto Rico, or what excursion we were doing, we always had to get back to the resort in time for the Managers Reception. They did not want to miss out on any of the free refreshments! The Embassy Suites is close to the airport and although you do hear some air plane noise down at the pool, it is still a great place to stay. It is about a 5-minute walk to the beach and is close to lots of shops and restaurants. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: tashnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!!! Central location, Clean and Friendly staff!! I would recommend this hotel!! The only negative was that parking was not free!! The hotel had printed and easy to follow directions to all sights Breakfast was great!! If you got to P.R. stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel”
Reviews.Author: momof3atl
Reviews.Content: The breakfast alone was totally worth it. We JUST left another 5 star hotel in Nashville, (the Gaylord) and my kids were begging to come back to the Embassy Suites. Only downside is the parking expense. The rooms were clean and large. The casino is fun and the pool was clean. Customer service in this hotel was FANTASTIC. It is located in the tourist area with plenty of options for food and the beach in walking distance. We were with a group and they arrived at a variety of times, and it was so close to the airport, that it was no problem. LOVE this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Show me the money!”
Reviews.Author: Trips_All_The_Time
Reviews.Content: Checked into the room @about $200 (parking not included at $18-$20) and then an additional fee for Hotel (?). Not quite sure what that was about. The free happy hour drinks were nice with the popcorn and trailmix snacks but didn't feel like staying in line. We ate at the Outback Steakhouse inside the hotel, looked at the local vendors that were selling homemade goods around the lobby area, hung out in the BOILING hot -hot tub (I liked it for 10 minutes but felt like my skin was getting boiled off), and gambled. We gambled and basically earned back all the money for our stay at the black jack tables. The internet connection was pretty good (best out of the 3 different places we stayed at) and many english speaking channels for bedtime. MY FAVORITE PART- The EARLY breakfast made this stay worthwhile. If you are a breakfast person, I ate my way through omlets, hash browns, over-easy eggs, bagels, yogurt, and so much more. yum! We didn't eat until 4 p.m. later that day. Close to San Juan and to El Yunque.

Reviews.Title: “aWESOME WITH KIDS OF ALL AGES ! HAD A GREAT SPRING BREAK !”
Reviews.Author: jones5fam
Reviews.Content: Only 2 short blocks from the beach. My kids 10-16-21 loved Happy hour because Ziion was able to have a kiddie cocktail lol.Every evening and enjoyed the tea at the front desk when coming back from an amazing day at the beach.Enjoyed the daily cooked to order breakfast saved money for a family of 5. Loved the pool area and laundry, Outback and Noble romans was all fantastic located in the Embassy. Not to mention the casino and game room we did not attend.. Beds slept well and room was cleaned and all our needs where met. We used there towels for the beach and they had no problem with that as we brought them back.I will go there everytime. Will say I stayed on the beach at one of the hotels for higher price and no breakfast,laundry or happy hour.The Jones family had a blast ! See ya soon. Woould like to see to omelet makers

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: danzer917
Reviews.Content: I went to the Embassy Suites for the second half of a trip I took with my husband and teen daughter. My husband was sent with the army, so our daughter and I were on our own. After a less than desirable time in Ponce we were not expecting much when we went to San Juan. We were very excited to see that there was a bell hop immediately willing to help with out bags (which was good as we had the whole family's bags and some of the other army boy's bags.) We were able to check in early and the desk was very helpful and courteous during check in! The loby is very nice! There is air conditioning, a large fish tank, palm trees, and nice brook with fish in it, a gazebo, and couches. The rooms are sufficient and the beds are pretty comfortable. We asked for a rolling bed for our daughter and got it in minutes. Our room was clean but I know some of the other boys had to have house keeping come to clean out some things when they checked into their rooms. The hotel itself is very clean, however. The pool area is outstanding!! There is a large pool with a waterfall, a kiddie pool, and a hot tub. The pool deck has lots of palm trees and a fun little tunnel under the water fall that the kids liked to play in. The pool was a good temperature to cool off in. The hotel provided some floats for the kids to play on. The area itself was closed off to non-visitors by a lovely wooden fence and palm trees. (Much better then the chain fences many places use). The pool bar was pretty good (doesn't except cash) and the bar tender worked pretty fast and was very good at multi-tasking! The lounge chairs were plentiful and comfortable and there were several tables to put your things on. My family and I were very impressed with the pool area! The only two little things that I could mention need improvement is the outside shower didn't really work and the pool towels have seen better days. The included breakfast is AMAZING! It included French toast, several meats, potatoes, all the continental breads, and made to order omelets and pancakes. I have paid 20 dollars per person at other hotels for breakfast of this caliber at hotels. One thing to note, it is hard to find seating and the line gets long after 830am, but we always got up early and napped by the pool after breakfast. Happy hour is a nice touch! For two hours there are free drinks (alcoholic and non) and popcorn and chips and salsa. My teen really liked getting a fruit punch that looked like a rum punch and lounging at the pool with it! Location is very good. Walking distance from anything in San Juan and about 5 min. drive to old San Juan. It's not on the beach, but we found the beach not to be too nice so that was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Los Compardes”
Reviews.Author: nenapo
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a great area if you are familiar with Puerto Rico...near the airport and the main road # 2. Staff at the hotel were a pleasure,very helpful . the only thing I didn't like was when at the swimming pool area if you wanted a drink from the bar area you had to go inside bar. The Bar at the pool side only open on saturday.....! suggeustion bar area needed to open 7days a week.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool - rooms not too clean”
Reviews.Author: Bostontravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night pre-cruise. Very much a mixed bag. The good: They have a nice staff from bellmen, to front desk to pool bar servers. The pool area is very nice for kids- lots of areas they can lounge in, plenty of chairs. It is right next to the highway, but the fencing mutes much of the sound. Location is a quick trip from airport, also easy to walk over to beach and quick ride to cruise terminal. Free breakfast quick and perfectly adequate. The bad: The room seemed clean upon first inspection, but when I took my shoes off the rug felt a little tacky. Then I noticed the kids' white socks were filthy on the bottoms from walking on the carpet. Yuck! The rest of the room was well maintained, but the carpet really grossed me out. We're hilton honors members so we stayed for free, but not sure I'd go back. Last year we stayed at Hampton Inn San Juan with hilton points and there were no cleanliness issues at all. The Embassy Suites has more room with the kids, but I think I'd opt for a different locale in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: danielbeez
Reviews.Content: Things that I didn't see in other T.A. reviews: (1) There are two pools, an adult pool, and a very shallow kids pool, really more of a toddler pool. (2) The pools aren't heated, and can be quite cold on relatively chilly days. (3) We traveled with two little ones and a nanny, and the suite was adequate size for us. (4) Besides the Outback Steakhouse there is a Noble Romans with (yucky but edible) pizza, hot dogs, and coffee downstairs. (5) Room overlooking the atrium can be noisy, but not all rooms overlook the atrium, so ask for one that doesn't. You might still, however, have a lot of street noise. (6) The free booze at night attracts a rather white-trashy crowd. I'd much prefer if they had less alchohol and some real appetizers, instead of stale chips. (7) Among the restaurants in easy walking distance are Pizza Hut, Taco Bell, KFC, Church's, Subway, Burger King, a Chinese place, a Puerto Rican place (great food, crappy service), Wendy's, and more. The front desk won't tell you about any of these places unless you ask. (8) Don't rent a car to go to Old San Juan, parking is a huge hassle. But if you are going anywhere else, it's likely going to be cheaper to get a car on Hotwire than to take taxis. (9) The area by the kids pool is right by the highway, plus there was a lot of construction noise, not so pleasant. (10) Get to the buffet before 9 if you don't want a huge line. All in all, we had a nice but not fantastic stay. I give the hotel slightly more than 3.5 stars based on value, but I'm sure there are much nicer hotels in San Juan, on the beach, with heated pools, less noisy, and so forth. But traveling with 3 adults, this hotel saved us from having to get two rooms, and we all got a nice free breakfast, so the tradeoff was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for great location and service”
Reviews.Author: mikeandnoha
Reviews.Content: My wife won our trip to PR so we didn't purposely select this hotel but I can't imagine it turning out any better. We had a great experience at this hotel. The staff, in particular our concierge Melvin & guest manager Jose, were phemnominal in making sure we had everything we wanted / needed and more. The hotel is in a great location to the beach, nighlife, local transit and good food. We will definately stay again on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “If you are stuck in San Juan, YOU WANT to be at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelChick
Reviews.Content: WOW! My husband and I were literally stuck at the San Juan airport this week and didn't know what to do. It was 7:30 pm on a Monday and we called Embassy Suites and they had a great rate because of availability. The taxi fee over was $10, as the hotel is located about a mile away. Totally worth it! I could write a small book about how great this hotel was, but I will do my best to condense. The staff was so friendly! Breezy check in and check out. They had backup amenities that were brought to the room in record time :) The rooms were suites that were very spacious and quiet. The bathroom was huge and very clean. The bed was plush and relaxing and we didn't want to get out! Great pillows, mattress and linens! The OUTBACK steakhouse located within the hotel was friendly and great food. It was also close to the laundry area. So we could wash our airport clothes while we had dinner. So easy and convenient! Their HAPPY HOUR in the evenings from 5:30 to 7:30 was incredible and so nice. FREE drinks, including rum punch, and snacks are offered. As well, the FREE BREAKFAST was so amazing, we talked about it all day. It was by far one of the best free buffet breakfast experiences I have ever had. They served food on the whole spectrum. From hot meats, eggs, french toast to cereal, fruit, pastries etc. Really nice! The Casino was a blast and gave us some nearby entertainment without having to leave. And the pool was awesome. With great hours of 7am to 10pm, we enjoyed as much as possible. The pool was amazingly huge so you didn't feel like you were on top of other people and the hot tub was romantic and cozy! GREAT - AMAZING - FABULOUS! We only stayed two nights because we were stuck and hadn't planned on this hotel, BUT we would go back just to visit San Juan. My husband was able to walk to a nearby Walgreens and get some stuff and he said the beach was really close and within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise value”
Reviews.Author: Bman32
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 room suite for two nights prior to a cruise with another couple. It was a very short ride from the airport. If there had been any sidewalks, we would have considered walking! The exterior and lobby look great and have a nice ambience. There is a big, open lobby with lots of greenery and plenty of seating. The complimentary breakfasts and two hour Manager's receptions with open bar were in this nice, big, open area. Get in line early, as both of these things can get crowded! The two room suite was spacious, with a refrigerator and microwave. One room was a bedroom with a king bed, the second room was a living room with a pull out sofa, desk and chairs. King bed was comfortable, pull out was okay. Flat screen TVs in both rooms. Nice view of the pool from the bedroom. Free WiFi worked nicely. Rooms could use a renovation. Outback restaurant and casino onsite. Live entertainment. It was a bit loud one of the nights. Service was great. Front desk greeting upon arrival was terrific. At breakfast, someone asked how everything was. When we said we needed more pillows, they radioed for someone to bring the pillows right away. Nice outdoor pool with ample seating. Water was a bit cool. Within walking distance of the beach (about two blocks), but hotel is not ON the beach and not oceanview. Many restaurants and stores within walking distance as well. Taxi is ~$20 to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: emutennis
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night prior to our cruise. The location is great and the amenities are good. They provided a very nice cocktail party and a very nice breakfast the next morning with made to order omelets. The pool area was nice as well as the suites. Great value for the price! If you want to go to Old San Juan, it is about a ten minute taxi ride and about $19.00 each way.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is nice.”
Reviews.Author: Lapidum
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Embassy Suites because of the big rooms and free breakfast. The hotel itself is nice. The staff at the front desk was very helpful finding tours for us to attend which made things easy. The tours were fun. They have free internet in the lobby but its slow. The walk to the beach is not so nice, littered and the sidewalk crumbled, (of course that's not Embassy's fault but it leaves a bad impression). Once you're on the beach its good. The pool was very nice and the jacuzzi was good. The cab rides to get to the city cost 20 dollars. We spent 80 dollars a day on cabs. The buses were not reliable. At the end of our stay we were charged a hotel fee/resort fee. It was an added on fee to the paid in-full bill. For two rooms, that was an extra 400 dollars that I was not expecting. It might be related to staying where a casino is located (something we didn't use). There's a grocery store next door which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “BED MITES”
Reviews.Author: lam012289
Reviews.Content: service was terribly slow and the rooms/lobby/pool definitely weren't as clean as we would have liked....the casino stinks so small and lame, the free breakfast is nasty milk is warm, few cereal options, sausage was nasty, pastries were weird, slow slow service for the omletes which were greasy, the scrambled eggs were dry and processed - totally not a healthy start tot he day with this breakfast. all the rooms are suite style which was the only nice part we liked because kids could stay up and watch tv in the other room while dad went to bed earlier...but if your suite faces the lobby be prepared for it to be LOUD at night with weddings/people in the lobby/atrium area because you can hear them talking/clinking glasses/music playing until at least 2am so that was not good. maid service takes forever to come...the first day it was 4pm they still hadnt come and so we called and they said theyd "put us on the list"....didnt end up coming until 730 the second night we suddenly all started getting a weird rash on different parts of our bodies...dad on his neck and crooks of his elbows, me on my legs and wrist....soon we realized it wasnt a sunrash (it had been raining that day) and none of us had used the hotel shampoo or anything because we packed our own...we thought it was maybe the hotel detergent but after some closer googling and webmd we realized that it was a rash from bites from bed mites! they totally dont clean the sheets (there was hair and wrinkles in the sheets the one night we got there, and we had to call to have the beds changed, it took a 1/2 hour for them to come) we checked out that day and switched hotels to the intercontinental SO MUCH BETTER

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little more $ and stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: LindaDenise
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Embassy Suites in San Juan because we could have a separate living space for our 2 kids and a king-size bed for us. We paid $279/night which seemed reasonable for X-mas week but we could have done much better if we had booked through Expedia. We were disappointed from the get-go. Every single day the pool ran out of towels so our kids were freezing when they came out of the pool, which I don't believe was heated. There is only one door that takes you into the hotel from the pool area and it is all the way on the end - a nuisance. The pool bar/"restaurant" closes at 3pm every day so after that you are on your own for food/drinks unless you want to wait for 20 mins at the indoor lobby bar for mediocre food. Maid service was spotty - one day the room wasn't made up until 6pm, one day they didn't deliver any towels or toilet paper, etc. Our room was mid-sized and although it had 2 separate living spaces, it felt small and dark. There are no balconies and all rooms open out to a central courtyard area which is noisy at night. The free breakfast is average and ends at 9:30am, so if you want breakfast after that you have to walk to the Denny's which is 15 minutes away. The gym was out of hand-sanitizer, the pizza place was out of large pizzas, and the pay-per-view function on the TV did not work. The beach is a 10 minute walk which wouldn't be so bad except that you have to cross a busy street and the walk itself is gross (past several dumpsters, not well-lit, etc.) The hotel is literally 5 mins from the airport - you can almost walk there, but there is some noise from the planes and the highway when you are sitting out at the pool. Especially if you have young kids (ours are 8 and 5), I STRONGLY encourage you to spend a little more money and stay at one of the way nicer places on the beach like the Intercontinental or the Marriott Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: 2IslandDreamers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites, pre-cruise, and we were very impressed! To start out, the bell-hop was at the taxi before the car had completely stopped! Check in was very easy, fast and with smiles from everyone behind the counter. The lobby is open, quiet and clean. There was a bit of construction going on, but it did not get in our way. There is an Outback Restaurnt on scene. We stopped in for a snack and a beverage, it was nice. Same thing you'd see at your neighborhood Outback. Our room was large, cool, clean and best of all, smelled FRESH!!!! I realize how hard it is to keep hotel rooms smelling fresh in tropical areas but they did a fine job! We had a long journey, so we took a quick nap before happy hour. Happy hour was not too crowded, we only had to wait a few minuets in line to get our beverages. We walked to Metropol (about a 15 minute walk) for dinner, it was good. The walk 'seemed' safe. I would recommend always staying in a group though. Upon check out, everything went smoothly and again- smiles everywhere! We would stay here again in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Cybertuth
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel in the last three years so needless to say we found it worthwhile. The rooms are large and for a family of 4 we found them quite comfortable. They have limited suites with 2brs for larger families. They have rooms with king beds and also ones with 2 queens. All rooms we stayed in have a sofa sleeper. The complimentary breakfast buffet is very nice, but does get crowded after 9am. The pool is well kept but a bit cold. They also have a nice little laundry with 4 new front loading machines. The location can't be beat. 2blks from the beach. (A very nice beach is Laguillo beach but is a 40 min drive.) If you're planning on staying on the island for a while, rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, might go back.”
Reviews.Author: KarmelDST
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before going on a cruise and then for another night after our cruise. For our first stay, check in was very easy. We were able to get our room very quickly. The rooms were OK. The living room furniture was a bit outdated, but can't complain. My biggest complaint was was waiting for my food to be cooked at the hotel restaurant/bar. The breakfast buffet and managers reception in the evenings was pretty decent. Unfortunately, we didn't make it to the beach that they said was about a block away. Honestly, I don't even remember seeing it. We had a rental car and were forced to get on the freeway any time we needed to get somewhere. Needless to say, I wasn't disappointed with this hotel stay. The size of the rooms allowed our son to run around and not be confined to one space. We also appreciated that there was a refrigerator and micorwave there so that we were able to warm up food and milk for him. However, next time I'd like to stay somewhere that has a little more luxury and is a little closer to some of the tourist attractions. But if necessary, I wouldn't mide the Embassy again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service from a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bigbluedk
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at the Embassy Suites. This hotel is a very lively place (in the good sense of the word), although it can be pretty quiet during the week. However, at weekends it's full of life. The staff is extremely helpful and very friendly. We had a few minor problems in our room during our stay, but they were fixed right away by the staff. As other guests have mentioned, it's also right next to a big supermarket, which is quite convenient. If you're after great Puerto Rican food, make sure you go and visit "Don Jose" which is a short walk away (10-15 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Trekwoman
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks like the picture which is a good thing, it's beautiful. Everything from the pool to suites to the dining area was well kept. The location of this hotel is really good. Everything is within walking distance. We enjoyed the conviences of Pueblo's supermarket which is a short walking distance away where we purchased some items to keep in the refrigerator. We ate at a very good restaurant called Don Jose's which is on the main street once you leave the hotel, delicious food. Each night, this hotel offered complimentary drinks, which is a very nice thing. The beach was literally 2 blocks in front of the hotel. If you like beach and R&R, you'll definately want to check out Isla Verde beach. The water was warm and the sand soft. My friend and I rented a beach chair for $4 for the day and stayed there for hours. Our only disappointment was the nightlife for singles...or let me add 35 and older singles:) There didn't seem to be much to offer in this area. Other than that I would recommend this hotel and location to visit San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent price.”
Reviews.Author: ErinandTony
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the airport ($11 cab ride) and is a close walk to the beach. The breakfast buffett in the morning is great and there is a nice variety of food. Also, the pool is beautiful but i wouldn't recommend it to people looking for peace and quiet as there were lots of kids splashing around. We definitely hit up the casino one night and had a great time. You could definitely spend a day without leaving the hotel. We ate at the Outback in the hotel one night and had fantastic service!

Reviews.Title: “This was the perfect hotel when you are working with a budget and large family”
Reviews.Author: lslyChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 25th anniversary this past summer. Our very good friends were also celebrating. We decided to celebrate together along with our 6 children. We booked a Caribbean cruise. This was not our first cruise but it was our friends. We wanted to fly to San Juan a day early and enjoy the island before our departure on the ship. I searched high and low for hotels and prices. Our biggest bump in the road was that each family consisted of 5 people. 4 of the family members were 18 or older. About 99% of the hotels in San Juan will only accomodate 4 people at the most. And they charge extra after the first 2 people in the room. So my dilemma was paying extra for my adult children plus having to get a second room. We were paying $600 plus for a hotel night stay. I was getting pretty discouraged how costly this 1 extra night was going to cost. My friends were fine with paying the higher costs but I was determined to cut our costs. Then I came upon the Embassy Suites. They had no problem accomodating each of our families in a single room suite. I was getting excited. The cost was under $200 for the night. Much more reasonable than $600 plus. When we arrived at the Embassy Suites, we were very pleased. The hotel was beautiful. The inside of the hotel looked like a tropical setting with running water and everything. All the rooms looked into this atrium area and also had outside windows. We had a perfect view of the pool. The pool was amazing. I felt like we were at some expensive resort. They even had a made-to-order breakfast included in the hotel price. The rooms were clean, the staff helpful. They even stored our luggage for us and gave us late checkout with no extra charge. We were all very pleased. The only downfall was the hotel is not on the beach, but it's only a block or so walk. In fact the families loved the pool so much we never made it to the beach. We would go back here anytime we are in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but unlikely to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Californian09
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is quite fine with clean and wel maintained rooms (we stayed in one bedroom suite), nice lobby, and friendly staff. Although check-in time is sort of late (I believe 4 pm), our room was not ready when we arrived, so we have to wait about half an hour. That's not bad, but then we have to wait more than half an hour in waiting line though it was only two couples in front of us. After we got a room, we tried their pool, and it was terrible experience. No available clean towels, but piles of wet towels around the pool floor.
