People in the pool mostly don't know how to behave in public areas, and nobody pays attention to signs around the pool. In addition to teens literaly falling down on you while you are in the pool, everyone speaks so loud, almost yelling, so you are not able to carry a conversation with own family. We had to leave after 5 minuties and rather stay in the room that day because way to the beach is kind of sophisticated. Beach itself in this area is not good, either. Dining options in the hotel are fine, and you have a lot additional options around.

Reviews.Title: “Complementary Continental breakfast was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: swampsis
Reviews.Content: We got a really good price on this hotel - 125 a night, so we were able to overlook the fact that if you didn't run the air conditioning constantly (which meant very cold) the bedroom smelled like someone had vomitted in it. Being from the states - not used to paying for parking at a hotel, but in puerto rico this is the norm and it cost $25 a day to use the parking garage -and there is no other choice. There is also a casino in the lobby, but I don't require that service. Other than that, the hotel was located in a busy section of the city - not much of a view, but I don't go to hotels for the view. It was within 3 blocks to the beach, easily walkable. We were out and about everyday, and the breakfast was outstanding with made to order omelets and this really great strange warm cereal - never knew what it was - just good. Bottom line, would stay there again, just not in that room - think it was 608 or 680 - tucked around the corner by the ice machine.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid when busy”
Reviews.Author: being-around
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at this property. We needed two rooms. The hotel was busy and they gave us two handicap rooms. One of the rooms smelled like someone had throwed up and we had to change room. We were also hungry and we eat at their restaurant which was so so.

Reviews.Title: “Very Flexible”
Reviews.Author: DavidPortland
Reviews.Content: Had a prepaid reservation through Hilton.com but I missed my connecting flighty to San Juan. Called hotel and they agreed to "push back" my "no change, no cancel" reservation by one night. I really liked that flexibility. Hotel is as described by others. Would like to mention the Outback Steakhouse happy hour. Got a great Bombay martini for just $6.50 after having a few gin and tonics complimentary at the manager's reception. It really helped me enjoy my steak.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: travelingfool1234
Reviews.Content: Location: 2 minutes to the airport, but plane noise is not noticeable. 5 minute walk to the beach. Beach is great in Isla Verde. Long, wide stretches of sand with no crowds. $20 cab ride to Old San Juan. Amenities: Hot breakfast and cocktail hour are free for everyone, BUT the looong line at the free cocktail hour however kept us from enjoying it. They have 2 bartenders serving 500 guests. Parking is $16/day, but in-room wifi is free, which was a nice perk. The hotel has a very nice, large pool with a hot tub and waterfall. The casino looked fun, and there is an Outback steakhouse in the hotel as well. Service: We had limited interaction with employees, but everyone was friendly. Room: The suite was a nice size. Our tv was fuzzy, but there was a 2nd tv so it wasn't much of a convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: lilcot
Reviews.Content: Located about 2 blocks from Isla Verde beach. Plenty of fast food restaurants nearby (Wendy's, Burger King, Pizza Hut). Outback Steakhouse downstairs. Pueblo grocery store one block away - they sell liquor. Walgreens close by. Free hot breakfast (only pork). Free drinks and snacks every evening. Slow internet. Need more service people at the bar. Overall, good hotel for the price. Parking is $16/day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Wanted to stay longer, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Bonthesea
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night but would have liked to stay longer if our time had allowed it. The room was huge and very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful about the local restaurants and sites to see.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, clean, kid-friendly, and lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: vacawkids
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my two daughters (5 and 7) we stayed in a one bedroom suite. My parents traveled with us as well and had their own suite. When we arrived at the hotel an hour before check in, our room wasn't ready but they hotel staff offered to hold our luggage and gave us passes to the pool and bar. When the suites were ready they were clean and a good size for us. We stayed for a week and I have to say that having a comp breakfast and happy hour makes it so much easier when you are traveling with kids. The happy hour is for the entire family because they serve non-alcoholic drinks aswell and snacks. We had family come and visit us at the hotel and they were able to use the pool with us. One night, we had a family member as a guest in our room who slept on the sofa bed and the staff brought up blankets and pillows, no questions asked and no charge for the additional one night guest. My children and parents (who are elderly) were beyond pleased with service from the staff. The hotel is walking distance from the beach, a supermarktet and restaurants near by...We'll definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Dextertalk
Reviews.Content: The hotel has everything except location - great, comfortable suite-style rooms, beautiful pool, helpful staff, decent food. Parking is expensive and it is a long walk to get to other restaurants. It is remarkably quiet considering its proximity to the airport. Good full-breakfast with made-to-order omelets.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: faculty1919
Reviews.Content: First all before anything....the service I got from the employees was absolutely superb. The front desk clerk was extremely helpful. I had a ton of questions and she did not get annoyed or short with me. She was very helpful. The room was huge and very clean. The amenities in the bathroom was great. I wish they had flat screen tv's in the room, but a tube tv was fine. When I checked out I left my GPS in the room. So right after I checked out i went back upstairs to retrieve my GPS and the housekeeper had it ready for me wrapped up in a plastic bag. I was so impressed that she actually held it. I've stayed in rooms where housekeeping or someone or something has stolen my products. Much Much Kudos to Embassy Suites San Juan! (Also....it's a straight, literally straight shot to the beach. And a FREE very good and big breakfast. And FREE drinks and snacks at happy hour.) Perfecto!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: sherlock04
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay with Embassy Suites more than three weeks in advance. Yet when I landed there from the San Juan airport at 10:30 pm at night after a 12 hour journey from California with a little child, they had no rooms for us. They had overbooked us!! They have my phone number, email and this was supposed to be a non refundable booking. Absolutely disgusting. The did offer me a complementary stay at another hotel nearby and I had to settle for it. As it was just to sleep for the night I took that. I shudder to think what if I was staying for more than one night. They would have spoiled my vacation. Totally Unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful common areas and good service, but poor room quality”
Reviews.Author: chris11828
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed at the Embassy Suites in San Juan for three nights (June 10-12, 2009). We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel (about a 5-minute ride; cost right around $15). Check-in was friendly and efficient; we were in suite 717. The way the hotel is set up, thereâ€™s a group of three glass elevators near the entrance / front desk, and one lone glass elevator on the other side of the atrium. All of the elevators move very quickly and smoothly, so thereâ€™s never a long wait for an elevator, regardless of which elevator bank you use. Our suite was right next to the single elevator, but there was never any elevator noise audible in the suite, nor was there any airplane noise even though the hotel is right by the airport, nor was there any traffic noise even though the hotel is right by two busy highways. The only noise we heard came from the noisy guests next door to us, but if they had been talking at a normal volume (i.e. if their kids hadnâ€™t been screaming), we probably wouldnâ€™t have been able to hear them at all. Upon entering the room, we were a bit disappointed in how small it was. When the three of us travel, weâ€™re used to staying in 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom suites, but since we were only staying 3 nights, and 2-bedroom suites were so much more expensive than 1-bedrooms at this hotel, we decided we could live with a 1-bedroom. We didnâ€™t expect anything huge, but this was just tiny. Residence Inns, which are typically much less expensive than Embassy Suites, have much bigger suites than we had at the Embassy Suites. There was no full kitchen, just a tiny microwave, mini-fridge, and sink. The only table in the room was a peninsula table big enough for one or two people to sit at. My parents slept in the bedroom, and I slept on the sofa bed in the living room; when it was folded out, there was almost no room to walk through the living room to get to the bedroom and bathroom. (The sofa bed wasnâ€™t particularly comfortable, but it wasnâ€™t horrible, either. With the right combination of pillows, it was doable.) Also, the pictures on the website show flat-panel HDTVs in the suites; we had two very old CRT TVs. The carpet had too many stains and discolorations to count. The room had a sort of musty smell to it, and the bathroom had mold up near the ceiling. The AC unit was supposed to be white, but a good part of it was brown with rust (see pictures). There was also no fan in the bathroom. There was a shortage of electrical outlets in the room, but Iâ€™ve seen that problem before and I came prepared by bringing a surge protector for my laptop, phone charger, fan, etc. At least my parents slept well on the beds in the bedroom; they were basically the only good things about the room. Apart from the room, though, the hotel was gorgeous. The open atrium created a great atmosphere, and glass elevators are always a nice touch. The casino was great; the gambling age in Puerto Rico is 18, and by law, all casinos are smoke-free, which was perfect for me, a 19-year-old non-smoker who canâ€™t stand the smell of smoke but would still like to play some blackjack. There were several restaurants / places to get food in the hotel, as well as a poolside bar that was supposed to be open until 5 PM daily (although it closed each day due to rain, and even though the rain cleared up well before 5 PM, it didnâ€™t reopen). The food was delicious, but very overpriced; a simple burger was $11. At the pool bar, soft drinks are sold by the can, with no free refills. At the atrium restaurant and lobby bar area, theyâ€™re sold in a more typical way, by the glass, with free refills; I think they were $2.50 each there. Wireless internet access is available throughout the hotel at no additional cost (itâ€™s covered by the hotelâ€™s 14% resort fee). You have to call the front desk for the internet access code, and you have to re-enter it every 24-hour period. Itâ€™s pretty slow, but itâ€™s better than nothing (and hey, itâ€™s complimentary). (There is no hard-wired internet access in the room.) They also have a business center and a kiosk where you can print off boarding passes and get checked in for your flight before you go to the airport. We only went to the managerâ€™s reception once. The lines for alcoholic beverages (beer and wine) were very long. Iâ€™m not a drinker, so I opted for the free soft drinks instead; they have Coke products, which Iâ€™m definitely a fan of. They also offered various snacks, but I didnâ€™t take a close look at them to see exactly what they offered. The managerâ€™s reception takes place daily from 5:30 to 7:30 PM in the atrium near the pool entrance. Speaking of free food and drinks, they also offer a free cooked-to-order breakfast every morning. On weekdays, it ends at 9:30 AM; on Saturdays and Sundays, it ends at 10:30. Iâ€™m a late sleeper, so I never made it out of bed in time to enjoy it. My dad went; he said the lines were long, and the food was average. I also saw a sign in the casino advertising free breakfast every day until 11:30 AM, but it didnâ€™t look like a full breakfast; the picture looked like a few pieces of toast and some fruit. The pool area was huge and beautiful, but I didnâ€™t use it much. I swam for a little while on the first day, but the water seemed a little cool to me. Then again, it had just rained and it was still cloudy, and I consider anything less than about 84 to be cool. I was able to get all the way in, it just wasnâ€™t pleasant. The hot tub was perfect, though. They also had a kiddie pool off to the side, but I didnâ€™t see anyone in it. I would not recommend renting a car and driving in Puerto Rico if youâ€™re not familiar with the island and the way they drive; itâ€™s pretty different from typical U.S. driving (much more aggressive, and taxis seem to always have the right of way no matter which way theyâ€™re going). Just walk or take a taxi wherever you need to go. We went to the Plaza Las AmÃ©ricas two out of the three days we were there; it was about $20 each way, so plan to spend a lot on taxis if you want to get anywhere, but it still beats the heck out of renting a car and driving down there. The Plaza Las AmÃ©ricas is their shopping mall, and itâ€™s got everything from Macyâ€™s to Gap to Borders (an epic two-story Borders at that) and a bunch of local stores, in addition to some 40 restaurants (some fast food and some sit-down). The first day there, we ate at Chiliâ€™s. The Chiliâ€™s restaurants down there have a few menu items that they donâ€™t have in the States; I highly recommend the classic chuletas (delicious lightly-fried and seasoned pork chops). The second day there, 6/12, we were there for the Coheed and Cambria signing on the first floor of Borders; there were well over 200 people there in line to meet the band and get their items signed. (Claudio and the others are amazingly cool, down-to-earth people and incredibly talented musicians. If youâ€™ve never given Coheed and Cambria a good listen, Iâ€™d highly recommend it.) After that, we ate at Subway and then grabbed a taxi to the Coliseo de Puerto Rico JosÃ© Miguel Agrelot, where the Coheed concert was; they were absolutely incredible, as they almost always are live. (Claudio, their lead singer, is Puerto Rican by heritage, so he and the band decided to play a gig in Puerto Rico for the first time; the crowd was definitely happy about that.) It was a little difficult to catch a taxi back to the hotel after the concert. We expected them to have cabs lined up for people who needed to get places but didnâ€™t have rides, but we had to ask a security guy how to get a cab; he just found another one that was already full and asked the driver to call another one to the Coliseo, which he did. I never walked to the beach, but my dad did a couple of the days we were there. Itâ€™s a pretty short, safe walk. He took some pictures of the beach, and it really is gorgeous. Our flight home didnâ€™t leave until 3:00, so my dad (an HHonors member) asked for a late check-out of 1:00 and got it with no problem. One very important note about flights from Puerto Rico back to the States: before you stand in that long line to check your bags, you first have to go through a separate line for USDA inspection. There are a few signs that indicate this, but they are not detailed; they donâ€™t tell you that you have to go stand in a separate line before standing in the line to check your bags, but you do. Go to the USDA inspection line FIRST, and THEN the line to check your bags. Oh, and one last tip about the hotel: right next to the 08 room on each floor (e.g., room 708 on the seventh floor), there are vending machines with Cokes and waters for $1 each. Donâ€™t pay $2.50 for a bottled water at the Atrium CafÃ© / Noble Romanâ€™s place when you can get them for a buck each next to the 08 room. I also heard that there are snack AND drink vending machines next to room 208, but just drink vending machines on the other floors. Overall, the hotel got the job done, but it wasn't a very pleasant experience due to the problems with the room. I'd recommend staying elsewhere (although I'm not sure where, since I'm not familiar with San Juan at all... maybe El San Juan resort and casino). If you have three or more people, definitely go for a 2-bedroom suite, as a 1-bedroom gets awfully crowded (especially considering how tiny the 1-bedrooms at this Embassy Suites are).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, expensive but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: travlingalNyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to cruise. Was happy with the hotel and all included. Rate was very high, but that is PR. The room included breakfast, and nightly drinks. We ate at the Outback inside the hotel...GREAT, Hotel was fun, but about a 10 minute walk to the beach. I like the Embassy chain, and will book with them again. Casino was ok, and added plus, they did have a bar inside the lobby that had afternoon specials. Taxi's very expensive in the area. I recommend get your passport and travel to other places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Property - Highly reccommend”
Reviews.Author: jcmontour
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really great - it is adjacent to the airport (but not noisy) - and the highway ramp (again not noisy) - It was not the best piece of land on the Island, but Embassy Suites has really done an amazing job with the property. Rooms were all great - breakfast and manager's reception well done. Pool area is excellent. GREAT Beach is two blocks (very short and safe walk) from the hotel. When you arrive at the beach there is a husband/wife team renting umbrellas ($10) and loungers ($4) - they dig the hole and set up the umbrella for you. EXCELLENT DEAL. They are on the left under a large old tree at the beach as soon as you get to the end of the block. Vendors wander up and down the beach selling ice cream, water, beer. They are not aggressive - just available if you want them. The beach is excellent. More crowded on weekends (with locals) then on weekdays. The casino at Embassy Suites was also very nice as was the Outback Steakhouse. There is a 24 hour very large grocery store a short (3 minute) walk from the front of the hotel. Internet (wireless) in the room was free (we got a code on our room key package) at check in. Taxi from the airport was $15. Trip from airport to hotel about 10 minutes total. The hotel even hosted 2 senior proms during our stay - something like this would usually raise my eyebrows, but the hotel handled the kids and crowds so well we never even noticed. Intercontinental & El San Juan are both a very short walk (5 minutes?) - we visited both properties and they are nice enough, but twice as much money. Not worth the money. The hotels are 'beach front' - but neither is 'right on the beach', so the embassy suites is a much better deal. Note: The beaches in PR are PUBLIC, so no hotel has any private beach rights.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: scribbobo
Reviews.Content: Wow, we were impressed. We had never stayed at an Embassy Suites. The hotel is a gem...only 2 blocks from the beach. We didn't want to pay the high prices of being located right on the beach, we were being thrifty. Let me tell you, we got more bang for our buck! The rooms are very roomy(as I'm claustrophobic), clean and we had an awesome view. Located only about a mile from the airport. The people working there are very helpful and nice. We had a free hot breakfast, name it, they had it there. Great for a family, cuts down on cost. The manager's special at night was awesome, good drinks. There are some great little restaurants in the area, good authentic food. Old San Juan is only 15 min. away. We will definitely be back! This hotel is great for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Stay... Good deal”
Reviews.Author: chassyone
Reviews.Content: We just returned from San Juan/ Isla Verde Embassy Suites. The cab ride is short and cheap - I only paid $13 and had two suitcases. I found most of the staff to be friendly, Blanca was exceptionally helpful. I loved that their was an Outback Steakhouse in the hotel and quite a few eateries nearby. The beach was within walking distance- approx two blocks. We rented beach chairs for $4 each. Also, the bus stop was approx one block and only cost 75 cents. We were able to take the bus to Old San Juan, then boarded a ferry for 50 cents to go to the free Bacardi Factory tour. It was great to start the day with a hearty breakfast. The hotel provides a cooked to order omelette. Be sure to have Crisobal prepare your omlette- I noticed he made them much better than the other guys. After we finished our daily sightseeing- we arrived for the managers reception where we loaded up on drinks.. I mean they let us DRINK! Just remember to tip the bartenders. Housekeeping was less than mediocore.. it took forever for them to clean the room! Also, the pool was ice COLD, which was not what I was expecting on such a warm day.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Worth It”
Reviews.Author: DCMcG
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in February, with my boyfriend. We flew into San Juan for an extended weekend trip, stayed in Isla Verde for 3 nights, then went to Old San Juan for 2 more nights. We used Hilton points to book our stay here at the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde. I really enjoyed this hotel! I was unsure before we booked it because I generally like being right downtown near attractions when I travel and am more concerned about location than the actual hotel, however this stay far exceeded my expectations, and in fact I enjoyed our time here more than I did at our place in Old San Juan. The hotel is located right down the street from the airport, our taxi ride took less than 10 minutes. The lobby is huge, there is a casino in one corner, which was not too crowded and had great games, a business center with complimentary internet use, a restaurant/bar, and then the rest of the lobby is dedicated to a seating area used for breakfast and happy hour (both of which were delicious). The hotel rooms form a square around the lobby so that the railings all look over the lobby, which was neat because in the morning you could look down and see how long the breakfast line was and in the evening you could hear the bands playing by the bar. I was in a room with a king sized bed and a living room, over looking the pool. The room was standard for an Embassy Suites, if youâ€™ve been to one you know exactly what to expect, and as always it provided lots of space to relax. Microwave and refrigerator also included. The pool at the hotel is amazing, it's large, has a wide deck around it and has waterfalls running through it. I never had a problem grabbing a chair in the sun. The gym is less than fantastic, it's your basic tiny hotel gym with no windows, a few cardio machines and a couple free weights. The beach is a short walk down the street, and there are lots of restaurants in the area, both chains (burger king, subway, etc.), and local establishments. We rented a car one day from another hotel which was in walking distance. The manager's hour was awesome at this hotel, free drinks (you should tip!) and snacks for a few hours, my boyfriend and I enjoyed local rum and beer each evening before heading out for dinner or to the casino. The crowd was mostly families, lots of whom were boarding a cruise ship the next day. Since that is not my scene I got a little annoyed by the small children and obnoxious parents, but on our final night there, there must not have been a boat scheduled and we had most of the place to ourselves, which was awesome! I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel when traveling to San Juan, the amenities are fantastic, and the hotel staff was lovely. Isla Verde is a perfect place to stay too, don't be afraid that it's out of the way, there is plenty to do right by the hotel. Enjoy your travels!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: artfam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the ESSJ - this is our 2nd stay here. We last stayed in June '08 at the time of the infamous prom. We got a great welcome basket upon our return to the hotel. Much better visit this time. This is our first visit with our son (10 yrs old) and he loved the hotel just as much as we did. Let me share some tips: Hotel Tips: - Check in isn't until 4:00 - I would suggest you to become a Hilton Member to get in earlier. -Cab rides from the airport (less than 10 minutes away) will cost $13 -Room has a lot of space for a family. The sofabed was to be expected, but we just asked for extra blankets. -The breakfast was great. If you are looking for a great omlet or traditional Puerto Rican avena (oatmeal), this is the spot for you. We got to breakfast each day at 7 and it wasn't busy. Any time after 8 is packed. -The staff was efficient, but not overly friendly. -The pool looked average - wasn't too impressed. -Several coqui got into the lobby and we heard them singing all night - it was a beautiful sound! Isla Verde Beach: We love this beach. We have been to other beaches in PR and we found this one to be very nice. IThe current is not to strong and allows for some great waves. t is pretty slow during the week, but on the weekend it is packed. Be prepared for a busy beach. But, we had a great time. -You can get beach chairs (small ones) from the hotel for free. Try to get those early also. -It is two long blocks to the beach - I would suggest that you walk on the right side of the street so that you are in the crosswalk. Be careful at the busy intersection before the beach - there isn't a stop light. -You can rent chairs ($4) and an umbrella for $10. They get there at 9 and take them back around 4:45 -Pack snacks - ice cre am, beer, and hot dogs are sold nearby, but it may be a good idea to bring your stuff with you. -We usually got to the beach around 9 each morning and it was very quiet. Restaurants: -Mi Casita is the best, by far. Not the best service, but great food. We spent around $34-$51, including tips. This is our 2nd time visiting here. Do not call any orders in - they won't accept it. Choose your own seat! If you wait at the door, you will be ignored! A block from the hotel. -Metropol - cheaper and better service than Mi Casita - but the food wasn't that great. It was nice to compare. You can walk, but it is a hike. It is a $8 cab ride to the restaurant. -Pueblo - even though this is a grocery store, they have a deli. The food was fantastic and cheap. You can buy a plate (mean, rice/beans, maduros) for less than $8. It is literally around the corner from the hotel. Old San Juan: The cab ride from the hotel to OSJ is around $19. You can take a bus, but we didn't try it. -We attempted to buy a kite - it cost $5 for the kite and $1 for the string. If you don't know how to fly a kite or put it together, then, you are better of watching the pros! -Cemetary (can't remember the name of it) is beautiful - beautiful sculpture and views of Old San Juan. You can see graves from the last 5 years to over a hundred years old. -El Morro - fantastic fort to take the kids. The stairs below are very narrow and slippery at times. Great view. Took our son to the top level and just let him run - great views of the ocean, coastline and city. -Ate at El Patio de Sams - nice food - great service. We had 2 Cuban sandwiches and a vegetarian plate - it cost us around $30. -Take the kids to a pigeon park - for $1 you can buy bird seed and they will land on you! El Yunque: Rainforest was beautiful! We had a guide to take us. He was fantastic! Mr.Rincon was fantastic. If you want a guide to show you the real PR and the best of El Yunque - he is your man. He took us to a deserted part of the rainforest. We saw some beautiful waterfalls and let our son swim in one. There is also a visitor's center that isn't to be missed! You can get cell phone service at the entrance of the park, but that is where it stops! I absolutely love Isla Verde. This is our 2nd trip in 10 months. My advice for you is to bring some sunscreen, bug spray (especially when visiting the Courtyard), SPF50, plenty of singles (dollar bills) and a great attitude. The hotel is a great one. We are not folks who will ever go to a Ritz Carlon or the El San Juan. We like the hotel for its comfort, convenience, and overall price. We loved it and our son loved it! If you are interested in the tour of El Yunque, please email me at rgartigas@bellsouth.net. I will be more than happy to give you the name of our wonderful guide!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Location for a few Days”
Reviews.Author: edmort
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 23 month old and liked the location near the airport, large rooms, and great pool area. The breakfast was adequate and like other reviewers, strongly reccomend this property if pre-cruising or early-morning/late night flight. Challenging walk to beach but in middle of Isle Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Safe”
Reviews.Author: br2bk
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is pretty good. Embassy Suites is typically a quality product, and the hotel in San Juan is no different. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and I felt safe the entire time I was there. Other good points would include the managers reception and the complimentary breakfast. The problem with this hotel is its location. On one hand, it is really close to the airport, so cab-fares were low ($12 each way). On the other hand, the beautiful pool area sits right next to the motorway, so as you are laying out, soaking in the sun - you hear 18 wheelers downshifting, and music blasting from car radio's! I spent exactly 20 minutes by the wonderful pool, because I honestly felt like I was swimming in a pool dropped smack in the middle of a busy highway (which of course - I was)! So I walked to the beach everyday, which was three blocks away. The beach itself is gorgeous. You can rent a beachchair from the El San Juan Hotel for the entire day for $5 and listen to the waves crashing against the white sand beach (which is how a vacation should be). The only problem with this scenario is, the 3 block walk between the Embassy Suites and the beach is a little sketchy. There is a lot of trash along the walkway, and then to get to the final block, you have to cross Isla Verde Avenue, which is a busy road and there is no crossing signal. Overall, it's not a bad option. For my tastes though, next time rather than spend $200 a night for the Embassy Suites, I'll fork out the extra $40 a night and stay at the El San Juan or Intercontinental right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: Balad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip. I was pleasantly surprised to learn of the free breakfast buffet which is actually pretty good! The staff was capable and the rooms were extra clean. The rooms did show a little bit of wear; but, I would definitely stay here again if i was in th area.

Reviews.Title: “great staff and service, rooms worn out”
Reviews.Author: 1037wolf
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to San Juan for a cruise. We stayed twice during this time at the Embassy Suites, San Juan. I will begin by saying the staff, front desk personnel,bartenders, waiters, buffet area servers, etc, are all very hard working dedicated people. They are courteous and go out of their way to make your stay to your liking. That being said, I must say that the room quality is becoming an issue. We stayed there last year and at that time I thought the rooms needed some upgrading. They are not lighted properly, very dim in front room area. The sofa sleepers on both of these trips were not worthy to be slept on. We had another couple with us and they said they were just horrible as far as comfort. Also they need to get the latest flat screen TV's. The ones they have are ancient. The rooms just look worn out and need some new decor and brightness.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BronxBorinquen
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel because it was in such a beautiful isolated location, the rooms were large and very clean, wonderful service and breathtaking landscaping. There are three pools and a jaquzzi with the beach only footsteps away. A great deal with well-rounded quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.”
Reviews.Author: WishUwereHere59
Reviews.Content: Very clean, well kept Embassy Suites. Free morning breakfast and evening drinks as with most Embassy Suites. The pool area is absolutely beautiful. Definitely not your typical hotel pool. I found the staff to be friendly and the rooms clean and comfortable. Taxi to old San Juan, $21. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel & Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Mojorev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on the before and after leg of a 7 day cruise.... 2 different rooms. The views from our rooms were horrible and the hotel is a few blocks from the beach. The 8 story echoing atrium is not at all condusive to the live loud playing bands they host every Fri & Sat night. Don't stay here if you want to sleep before 12 AM because the sounds reverberate throughout the entire property. I called to complain but the night desk manager didn't seem to care that I paid over $300/nt (incl taxes). They were more sympathic to the 5 people listening to the band. Even worse, each night my wife and I scratched from what I believe were bed bugs. Yet, we didn't itch at all during our 7 day cruise. The room had an odd stench that is consistent with that of bed bug infestation. The free morning breakfasts and afternoon happy hour was nice but not at the expense of basic accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “standard embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: jajones42
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week starting dec 25th . standard breakfast and cocktail hour which make e.s. a bargain if you have a large number of people in your room .service from the desk as far as getting extra towels etc was our only complaint as they were slow to respond and once took a couple of calls for service . ate at the outback twice ,once great food and service ,once not. would definetely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “PreCruise Hotel - Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: DRIzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Embassy Suites (Carolina) near the San Juan international airport prior to leaving on the Carnival Victory and a southern caribbean cruise. Traveling from California, we had to leave at 6am Pacific time and not arrive in PR via Dallas until 10pm PR time. By the time we got to the Embassy Suites, all the restaurants were closed despite the website indicating that the Outback steakhouse would be open until 2am. The manager said that only the bar was ever open that late. When I informed him of the error in the hotel's website, he seemed to care less. I would hope they would correct this information because on the cab ride to the hotel, the cabbie offered to pull into a fast food place and get my family food (two very young, starving kids plus 4 exhausted adults). Instead, I opted to trust the hotel website and it was wrong. Secondly, we arrived to a virtual Calypso concert in the hotel lobby - so loud it was hard to hear the clerk at the check in desk. Apparently at least one wedding and one 50 year wedding anniversary were being celebrated. It was mid-night. No one could tell me when the party would end. We were tired and hungry and it didnt seem that rest nor food was going to come anytime soon. This is not what I signed up for. Had to take a cab 6 blocks to a very busy Chilis for dinner. They took an hour to make 5 sandwiches. Got back to the hotel at 130am with music still blaring. still no clue when the party would end. The room was able to void out most of the noise and my 1 year old was able to fall asleep with ease. Room was typical Embassy Suites - clean and comfortable. Breakfast bar was extremely busy and hard to find a table. Buffet line for made to order breakfast was a joke so I opted for precooked eggs, bacon, etc which was just fine and very fresh. otehr choices included tropical fruits, oatmeal, cereals, breads, coffee, milk, juices as you would expect. No newspaper delivered to our room and no Hilton Honors amenities (as an honors gold member, I typically get a free snack and bottled water on check in waiting in my room). I am used to this from all other Hilton brand hotel stays - but not a deal killer by any means. There is a small casino at this hotel with slot machines and a fwe table games. Check out is at noon and this was a very very busy time for the lobby. If you can check out earlier, you will miss the busy period. Check out seemed to maximize around 11am to 1130am. One phone and one remote control in our room was broken. We reported these to front desk but no fix ever came. Overall it was a cozy night, but a bit loud and searching for food options was not fun (pizza delivery ended at midnight). The rooms were fine as was the buffet (althought busy). I'd probably stay here again if just staying one night because of value and proximity to airport - but if you are looking for a long stay in San Juan, I would opt for something closer to the beach or closer to old town. We were advised not to walk the 6 blocks at night to the Chilis restaurant by hotel employees. The description of the beach being 1.5 blocks - hmmm, those are some long blocks. If you want optimum proximity to the cruise terminal, there is a Sheraton in old town right across the street from the terminal. The Embassy Suites is about a 30 min cab ride to the cruise terminal - and costs around $30. Cab from airpor to the hotel was $25 but we suspect we overpaid even though the cab fairs are predetermined by some cab authority at the airport. I bet we had some surpluss added just because we were picked up at the aiport. This fare was based on # of people. The fare to the cruise terminal seemed to be based on distance traveled. Whatever. I was confused. I didnt particularly like Puerto Rico anyway. I'll leave a review on the Carnival Victory elsewhere. If I fail to mention it there, the cruise terminal is horrible and mismanaged. The aiport in SJ is also very undersized and not very well run.

Reviews.Title: “Quite acceptable, not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: RWATL
Reviews.Content: I found this Embassy Suites hotel to be adequate and sufficient enough to merit a neutral / average rating. I'm actually having difficulty writing this review because nothing really stood out as exceptional nor negative. I looked down on the pool and thought it looked like a really nice place to spend the weekend. Unfortunately, I was in San Juan for work.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: luckysnp1
Reviews.Content: The Sunday breakfast was not "cooked to order" and the eggs,waffles and potatoes were cold. The carpet base molding in my room was falling off, there was mold at the floor on the bathroom tile. The staff were fine, very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Embassy Suites for the amazing value and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: quincytoo
Reviews.Content: The last review really went into great detail about the hotel and what ES has to offer :) I won't have to write the huge review I thought I would have to :) We had amazing service from the entire staff right from the moment we checked in at 11AM and Ilene the desk manager had our suite ready for us :) We did eat twice at Outback steakhouse and the first night ordered the happy hour two for one margaritas and was told it was already 7PM on their computer...we looked at my watch (6:49) and the waiter's watch(6:48!) and asked him to go and change the time of their computer. He came back and sweated abit, (turns out his manager was trying to make us pay full price) and then went and honoured the happy hour prices. It was now 6:55, he apologized a few times and seemed relieved that we were not upset...I wondered if this happened often?? We enjoyed our two meals there the first night the steaks and ribs were very good. Second time we arrived at 6 after a tiring day at the rainforest and the hamburgers and chicken burgers (and the happy hour margs LOL) were incredible :) The walk down to the Isla Verde BLVD is a quick maybe 3-5 min walk, I had thought (mistakenly) that we would have to walk two city blocks and cross a extremely busy almost freeway to get to the beach but this was not the case at all. We walked down the little side street to the crosswalk by the burger king strip mall and there was the most lovely beach WOW :) Speaking of the Burger King/Ponderosa strip mall there is a lovely Puerto Rician restaurant in there named Mi Casta)wrng name sorry but you will see it) We ate there once and it was great and very cheap and always busy :) We were delighted with the largness of our king bed one bedroom suite. Housekeeping always left the room spotless and changed our sheets the third day in. Buffet servers were always there to clear away plates and the servers at the Manager's reception were a delight. We made sure to tip housekeepers, breakfast staff and bartenders at the reception and our drinks were there within seconds of us standing in line. I truly can not say enough good things about this hotel and it's great value and staff!! Yea the furniture is a little dated but who cares?? We were not paying Westin, Intercontinental or Ritz -Carlton prices for this hotel. We paid $143.00 plus taxes and the resort fee , we had a car but did not do the valet parking and they actually waived our parking I think because I am a HH member. Nice touch. I travel alot for work and stay at some very nice hotels and resorts and must say this ES, along with all of her staff, really is at the top of the pack because of the great stay we just had there :)

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: winksgal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Embassy Oct. 22-28. We received a AAA rate of $152.99 plus tax, plus the hotels "resort tax" of 12% made the room around $180. Also, self parking in the parking garage was $14 a day. The hotel is located within a mile of the airport, but we were never bothered by plane noise. He was there on business, and I was there for pleasure. The resort tax allows you to make free local calls and use the wifi from your suite. Note: the wifi was sometimes weak on the 7th floor and not powerful enough to use in the bedroom part of the suite. Our room was clean, but the carpet needs to be replaced, and the furniture in the bedroom was nicked. A paint job was also needed in our suite. The king bed in our suite was comfortable, except for stiff pillows. The rate includes breakfast which includes made to order omelets or eggs (tip is not accepted like Embassy's in America); bad pancakes; so-so french toast; fruit; cereal; toast/bagels; juices; coffee; yogurts. Also included is the Manager's Reception Happy Hour from 5:30-7:30 nightly. You can get two drinks (or a double) per person at a time, but there is no limit to how many times you go back. There's one beer on tap, wines, and mid level alcohol. We tipped a dollar at each trip. Some people don't tip at all. Popcorn, a mix of chips, and pop were available as well. Service from the staff was not consistent. Some of the younger employees were not as helpful as the more mature ones. The pool is clean, huge and lovely. There's a pool bar, but it was never open. After numerous people asked for drink and food service, a staffer came out and took orders. Drinks were delivered promptly, but the food took over an hour. Except for a few smoking suites, this is a non-smoking hotel, as most establishments in Puerto Rico.. even the casinos. But, you can smoke outside at the pool, or out front of the hotel. There are ash trays and benches set up in the front, but no ashtrays by the pool. Most people just put their cigarettes out on the ground. Towels are available for free at the pool, and you can also take them to the beach which is a good 2 blocks away. We didn't make it to the beach but heard it was very nice. There's a self laundry room on the main level which requires $1.75 to wash and $1.50 for a 30 minute dry. The front desk will exchange bills for quarters and sell you a small ziploc bag full of powder detergent for $2.14. Note: There is a gift shop, but it's under renovation at this point. We ordered room service 4 times and the food was pretty good. Sometimes not as hot as we'd like, but we'd use the microwave in our suite to warm the food. If you like burgers, order them well-done, or they'll come out pretty rare. I recommend the french onion soup. Pizza Hut and Domino's delivers to the hotel, but you have to go to the lobby to retrieve it. We didn't order from Pizza Hut, but Domino's pizza was good and reasonable. Inside the hotel is an Outback Steakhouse. It's as good as any I've been to, but more expensive. It's open for dinner only Sunday - Friday, and opens for lunch on Saturdays. We ate lunch at Lupi's (near by) which was expensive and just so-so. Be careful ordering pop, no free refills. There are two ATMS in the hotel. There was no fee involved except for what your bank charges. You can also cash a check up to $100 a day at the front desk. Be prepared for your check being denied by the security check company they use. One of our checks was approved, the other denied. The casino is on the small side. Lots of slots including penny slots. Two blackjack tables, a 3 card poker table, and 2 roulette tables in which one was always very busy, and rarely did they open the 2nd even if there were people standing around wanting to play. I think the casino opens at 11 am and closes at 4 am. There was entertainment in the bar/casino area Fri-Sun nights. Good, but most songs were popular hits only in PR. Taxi's are always available but pricey, and you can pay for valet parking for $20 day. There's a free business office to use the internet (2 computers) and free use of the printer. There's a grocery store and other shops a block away. Ponderosa is also close by. There's also plenty of hotels in the area within walking distance that have casinos. The Intercontinental has beautiful grounds, a good casino and a Japanese steakhouse that we heard was very good. All in all, I'd give this hotel 3 stars. Feel free to contact me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay; Near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: 3dawgnight
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan on business. The room was clean and comfortable. The toilet backed up on my second day there, but I reported it on my way out in the morning, and it was repaired before I returned in the evening. Parking is expensive ($14/day), but it's a covered parking deck, which is nice considering the heat. There's a very good complimentary hot breakfast every morning, including an omellete bar, as well as a manager's reception every night where guests get two complementary drinks. The drive to the airport is less than five minutes, but I didn't hear any overhead air traffic while I was inside the hotel. This was my second stay at the Embassy Suites San Juan, and it will be my first choice the next time I find myself in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel- best part of PR and saved the trip”
Reviews.Author: bigmomma100
Reviews.Content: The Embassy suites hotel saved our vacation. The hotel was beautiful and the pool was warm and comfortable as well as huge. We were on the 5th floor and it was quiet and comfortable. Service good, food good and breakfast was the best. The beach is only two blocks (about 3 mins) walk away from the hotel. We stayed and dined at the hotel because the local restaurants were so unfriendly towards tourists especially towards african americans and dominicans. we refused to support this and stayed away. We couldn't believe how rude local island puerto ricans were when they are so nice here at in NY. If it were'nt for the nice, friendly staff at the hotel, we would have ended the trip early and flew to DR or Jamaica.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: momziekins
Reviews.Content: We came to Puerto Rico for a friend's wedding. The bride had chosen this hotel for all the guests from the states to stay in. Very smart bride! This hotel was convenient to the airport and lovely Isla Verde beach. Lots of restaurants & a grocery store nearby. The hotel itself has a nice parking garage for your rental car. The desk staff, bar tenders & gift shop girls speak english. The free breakfast is outstanding! The pool is way above average! We never encountered any problems of any kind and would recommend this hotel to any body, especially first-time Puerto Rico visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great for travelling with older children”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanJacki
Reviews.Content: First I want to start off by saying our trip to Puerto Rico was wonderful and Embassy Suites was a perfect choice for our family. Upon arrival we were greeted with a friendly smile at the front desk and given a room on the 7th floor overlooking the freeflowing outdoor pool. The room was typical Embassy Suites with a separate living room area, microwave, fridge and 2 TVs and pull out sofa. This is a good choice if you are travelling with teens, it felt like we had joining separate rooms. The rooms were spotless every day, the housekeeping staff does a good job keeping them above standards supplying us with good PR coffee and the usual amenities. Breakfast: Served 6:30-9:30am weekdays, weekends 7:30-10:30am. Never thought there was a problem with the lines, we were usually there @ 8am and they moved very quickly. Good MTO omelettes. Lots of fruit and yogurt too!! Managers Cocktail reception: 5:30pm-7:30pm, the chardonnay was served chilled in glass and there was no problem getting 2 drinks each time. Again there was a line at times but I didn't think the wait was long, the bartenders were quick and efficient. Hotel Restaurant: Loved the shrimp and linquine! The restaurant supervisor arranged to have a cake for my daughters & husbands birthdays. It was a delicious chocolatecake topped with fresh strawberries. The hotel chef is a great singer btw, thanks again! Casino: We walked through lost 5 dollars in a 5 minutes and that is about all I can say. There seemed to be a lot of people playing the machines, its small but I think it was a good size for the hotel. Hotel Pool: Loved the waterfalls and the water temperature was perfect. Lots of chairs and towels so no problem no matter what time of day you use it. The beach pool bar wasn't always open but you can go inside if you want lunch or a drink. Beach: The walk to the beach is less than 10 minutes it was far shorter than I thought. I brought a small cooler from home and we would buy beer, sodas and water at the supermarket before you cross the street to the beach. Chair rentals are $4.00, it never semed busy the 2 days we spent there. The water was very warm and slight breeze, very pleasant and clean. Old San Juan: I had to mention this since this was best part of our trip, the day we spent visiting the Forts and walking around the streets. I thought it was a great tip catching the bus A5 one block from the hotel across from the supermarket, its usually 75cents but it was free. It was crowded and took over 1/2 hour to get to main terminal but a really fun experience. The locals obviously could tell we were tourists and offered their help and we really enjoyed talking to the them. My kids were able to talk to the locals far easier than I could but my high school Spanish did come in handy. Use the free open air trolleys once you exit the bus terminal to take you to the forts, it was very hot and bring water. Overall Embassy Suites is a business hotel but probably 25% of the guests were families vacationing. Its a nice choice for us since we don't need to be directly on the beach and did like the extras they provided. The hotel staff we found very friendly and always asked how our visit was,if there was anything they can do for us. We liked the convenience near the airport and never could hear the planes in the rooms. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Spotty service”
Reviews.Author: everfair
Reviews.Content: (Disclaimer: I previously wrote a pretty scathing review just after our honeymoon, but thought that wasnâ€™t fair as I was still in the heat of emotion, so I have let time mellow me outâ€¦) We booked this hotel for our honeymoon. My husband and I are not really the pampered sortâ€¦we usually are able to go along and have a great time, despite slightly negative reviews (i.e. budget hotels in Italy). However, possibly the negative reviews regarding this hotel should be heeded. Thinking that this is a Hilton-owned, we figured we couldnâ€™t be too bad off. We even booked our stay and the accompanying flight off of Hilton.comâ€™s vacation package leg. But once we got to the hotel, they seemed to have cancelled our reservation because they rudely told me that we were a â€œno-showâ€� (we had a late flight and it ended up being slightly delayed). First off, it showed that we already prepaid for our stay so it shouldnâ€™t have mattered when we showed up. Anyhow, we were dead tired and we just needed to crash first, so we needed the room. Since they had cancelled us before finally getting a manager to reinstate us, all they had available were smoking rooms. Fatigue set in and we couldnâ€™t argue, so we took it, but we told them that we needed to switch rooms after others checked out. They said it wasnâ€™t a problem, which they kept to their word, and later that afternoon before we left, we stopped by the front desk to change keys and they moved our luggage into the new room for us. When we came back, they left a fruit plate and a bottle of red wine along with a note apologizing for our inconvenience, which was nice. The lay out of the suite in general was nice, with a living area with a pull out sleeper couch, dining table, mini fridge and microwave, bar sink. The bedroom was a good size for walking around in without bumping into furniture. Bathrooms were standard. I liked the curved shower curtain rod that prevented the shower curtain from sticking to me as I showered. Amenities we used at the hotel: Breakfast: the signature Embassy Suites cooked to order breakfast was fantasticâ€¦omelets, pancakes, French toast. Most of the time though, there were so many people, so a few of the days we just opted to eat the items from the self-service bar (scrambled eggs, sausage, corned beef hash) and fruit (pineapple, melon, cantaloupe, bananas, apples). They also had sweet corn grits (wonderful) or oatmeal (not so great), as well as single serve yogurts. Outback Steakhouse: really goodâ€¦standard restaurant, but convenient when we had a long day and didnâ€™t want to go back out for dinner. The churrasco (skirt steak) was really good. Our server was fantastic as well. Managerâ€™s cocktail hour: one free alcoholic drink per person. The line was really long as well, but my husband pre-tipped the bartender and our drinks came out strong. Also had popcorn, chips, and other snack food. Parking: Self parking that was $12-14 Casino: although small, it provided us with a few late nightsâ€™ worth of entertainment. They have a few tables each of poker, blackjack, and roulette. They have penny, nickel, and quarter slots. My husband and I found a video slot machine that we enjoyed when we were in Vegas so we were excited about that. The servers brought alcohol around as long as you tip (make sure you tip each time a dollar or so or they seem to disappear). They also have soup and grilled ham and cheese sandwiches in the late evenings so be sure to ask for those (and tip!) Pool: we sat by the pool but never went in. We werenâ€™t impressed (probably because the beach is only a few blocks away!). Lots of kids and teenagers running around. They had a masseuse cabana available for massages poolside which Iâ€™m disappointed that I didnâ€™t get a chance to try. Casino bar: the afternoon that we hung out by the pool, we decided to order food, but were told we had to re-enter the hotel to order at the casino bar as take out to bring out. The woman who took our order at the bar was very rude, basically ignoring us when we first got there. She couldâ€™ve written down our order but instead, she forgot it and had to yell for us to repeat it once she got to the register. Then after waiting twenty minutes for two sandwiches, we found out she put the order in wrong. When she finally got our sandwiches, she placed it on the counter and didnâ€™t tell us that it was ours. Ugh. By the time we ate our sandwiches which were grilled, they were lukewarm. We were extremely disappointed. She really ruined our afternoon. We ended up calling the general manager (the number on the comment card in the room) and got through and voiced our disappointment. I didnâ€™t want to do it all trip, but I finally pulled the honeymoon card and told him that I had thought that after having my wedding at a fabulous Hilton and enjoying fantastic service, I should be able to expect having Hilton hospitality on my honeymoon as well. The general manager was very apologetic and stated to us that he will consider possibly retraining some of his staff. He asked if there was anything he could comp us on, but we told him that we just sincerely wanted to voice our opinion. (On the last night he sent us a bottle of champagne anyways, but said that it was a honeymoon gift.) Iâ€™d like to add though, that it the general manager did make us feel like he cared about how our stay was going, which meant a lot to us. So our general conclusion with this Embassy Suites? I suppose that for a couple nightsâ€™ stay (like a quick long weekend) it would be ok, but probably not for a special occasion. Now that we are recalling our memories, itâ€™s not as painful, but during what shouldâ€™ve been a great time, it was a bit of an inconvenience. Iâ€™d like to add that as a general comment with regard to San Juanâ€™s tourist areas, for some reason, the hospitality isnâ€™t really up to par with other destinations. (which disappointed my Puerto Rican husband immensely) Unfortunately, at a few of the places that we went to, we got treated worse than our neighborhood Applebeeâ€™s.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryannePa
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just returned and while we were disappointed in Puerto Rico overall due to safety concerns and unfriendly locals, Embassy Suites made our stay very pleasant and positive. We appreciated the great housekeeping and clean suite/hotel, the friendly and helpful employees, and the breakfast was excellent with so many choices, as well as the complimentary evening drinks. The kids even enjoyed that family time playing cards and snacking after a day of exploring the island or going to the beaches. The location is close to airport and local stores,but the walk to the beach is really 2 blocks. We felt it was a good value though and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for the Family”
Reviews.Author: lgg1102
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four-night stay at the Embassy Suites - San Juan. The good: friendly and helpful staff, free cook-to-order breakfast, a nightly manager's reception featuring free cocktails, nice pool area and a small but fun casino. Located within the hotel is the Outback Restaurant. If travelling with teen-agers, the Outback provided a good, familiar option for dining. The not-so-good: furniture in room was dated. Because I was travelling with my three teen-agers, we needed to use the sofa bed for sleeping. NOT GOOD. Very old and uncomfortable...for sitting and sleeping. The actual beds in the one-bedroom suite, were comfy. We did have one issue with an exposed wire in the bathroom due to a broken switch-plate. My son received a shock. I called guest services to ask for a replacement. I was told someone was on their way, but never came. I stopped asking. Other than that, it is a pleasant hotel. Location is OK. A short walk to the ocean (about two blocks) and to Isla Verde Ave.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: BAR2AG4
Reviews.Content: My 20 year old daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights and overall liked it very much. The hotel is very nice and the pool is awsome. Food in the hotel is pricey, and room service is way over priced. The breakfast buffet is good, but the lines can be long. The bar staff was nice and generous. The front desk staff were adequate, but not willing to go out of their way for much. The room was clean and had what we needed. The gift shop is super pricey and I would recommend the walgreens about a mile down Isla Verde Ave (to the left) for anything you may have forgotten ie: shampoo, sun block etc. There was no noise from the airport which is very close, and it was kind of cool seeing the planes flying so nearby. Isla Verde beach is a block and a half away, about a 5 minute walk. Wonderful, beautiful beach. So peaceful. Burgerking, Subway, Baskin Robbins are between the beach and the hotel if you are looking for cheaper food. Ponerosa is also right there. The Ouback in the hotel was nice, crowded but nice. The casino had very dated machines, but were fun none the less. We booked this reservation through Travelocity and got a lousy view of a parking deck as a result. When I asked about that at the front desk, they guy told me thats the best they had. Yeah. I bet if I had booked through the Hilton website, I could have at least seen the light of day through the window. We spent most of our time at the beach or the pool so I guess it didnt matter in the end. Overall, it was a great stay and I do recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Generally nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fool4jesus
Reviews.Content: The Good: the Embassy Suites Isla Verde is just like a thousand other Embassy Suites hotels. That is to say, with a nice center atrium, good breakfast, etc. It also has a small casino (if you're interested in that sort of thing, which I am not). The pool area is rather large, with a nice waterfall for the kids to play in. People complain about airplane noise because the hotel is right next to the airport, but honestly the only time I ever heard planes was sitting at the pool. Inside the hotel, you'd never know they were there. It is also an easy walk to the beach, where you can rent 2 chairs and an umbrella for $18. The attendants were reasonably courteous (it helps to speak Spanish though) and asked when we left if we were coming back. Another good feature about the location is that it is easily accessible to both Old San Juan and the eastern beach areas such as Fajardo. You must do the Fajardo bio bay tour - see my review of Laguna Grande - and it's about 1:15 drive. If you stayed in Old San Juan, it would be considerably longer, especially with traffic. The Carolina/Isla Verde area is nicely situated in the middle. One of the closest restaurants, which I cannot recommend highly enough, is the tiny Mi Casita that's right on the way to the beach. They have wonderful food, and excellent prices. It's very small but pleasant. The waiters speak English but with the busboys etc. it helps to be able to speak to them in Spanish. Order the mofongo: my wife had chicken and I had fried pork. The fried pork was rather dry, but between the sauce that comes with the mofongo and a good local Medalla beer, it is fine. The Metropol is another nearby restaurant with good local food, although we did not go there. The Bad: Not really bad, but the hotel does not really have much in the way of local feel. You could be at any other Embassy Suites hotel, and it would be just about the same. I think some of the smaller hotels in the area have much more of a Caribbean feel to them. We were only there for two days pre-cruise, but if you are there longer you may want more of a local experience at another hotel. Also, although the rooms were nice, for the high price I expected them to be a bit cleaner than they were. This seems to be an endemic problem with hotels in the area, however: and my guess is that the Embassy Suites is about as clean as you're going to get. My wife is a clean freak and she was happy with it. Bottom line, a nice hotel, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better.....”
Reviews.Author: julz1177
Reviews.Content: We went to Puerto Rico for a Family Vacation/Honeymoon. Let me start by saying the hotel was nice and the pool was huge. One morning the pool opened 4 hours late because they had to clean it. Once we got to get in lots of floating plants and sand on the steps I don't know what they cleaned. A couple days in to the stay there was a Prom. No big deal ....so I thought. Most proms the kids stay the night then go home....oh not here they stayed for 3 days and ran the hotel the entire time. They didn't care who else was there they did what they wanted and the hotel could care less. At one point they wouldn't even let us off the elevator. The staff was nice but useless. They let the kids bud in line during happy hour and breakfast.....and not just 1-2 people would try and cut in line 5-6 would come running up. We had to say no and stop them ourself even though the staff was standing right next to them. The stay would have been much better without all the teenagers. BTW, beware of the amount they hold on your cc'd when you check in. The held $1600.00 on our card for incidentals.....now come on!!! What the do they think 2 adults and 2 kids we're going to do for $1600.00!?!? We were on a budget and needed that money for other things.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan BOMBS!!”
Reviews.Author: Boston1969
Reviews.Content: I was worried when reading the reviews which is usually the case when I read reviews at Trip Advisory. People write to complain about this or that, because they were not happy. I just spent a week here with a group of friends, we had three rooms, and we all had a good time. The breakfast bar was fine, and the happy hour (find the cute bartender and ask for San Juan Bombs!). The casino was small, but the tables always had seats, with 5 dollar limits. Drink service was strange ask the pit boss for drink tickets, and you will have no problem. The room was fine, the bed was comfortable, the pool was nice (couple service problems during the stay but nothing to ruin the trip), the beach was close, and the staff was friendly. I would stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the first 3 days, the last 3 were a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: dtatravlin
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms as our daughter and her family were traveling with us on June 24th after our daughter's wedding. The first three days were great, not crowded, the staff is pleasant and we liked our location. On Thursday over 100 kids from Puerto Rico descinded on the hotel for the beginning of a three day stay to celebrate their "Senior Prom." The kids who were between 16-18 had the rule of the place. At the happy hour they would place one kid in line with a valid ID and then he would motion for 10 of his friends to join him when he got to the front. When other people objected, the poor girl who was at the line checking ID's tried to do something, but she seemed uncomfortable confronting the kids. They would press all the buttons in the elevator regardless of the floor and you then stopped on every floor. For two nights in a row, the room next to ours played loud music, partied and argued until past 4 am. We had young kids with us and didn't get much sleep. I called and went down to the front desk a couple of times, but not much changed. When I said something at checkout and the manager on duty said "these kids have been hard on us too." For the inconvience, they waived our parking fee. We love the Embassy Suites, and I'm sure this doesn't occur on a regular basis, but security didn't seem to do anything to address the problem, the manager seemed more concened about how this was affecting the staff rather than the guests and the last few days of our family vacation left us sleepless and with a bad impression. My advice for travelers going to Embassy Suites is to ask if they are having a prom. The manager did say that this was a tough group of kids and not like the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Purpose73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in San Juan for a week around Memorial Day. It was great! It was literally 4 minutes from the airport which made getting there and leaving very easy. There were 4 of us and the suite had more than enough room for 4 women and all of their things. The complimentary hot breakfast every morning was a great way to start the day and the manager's reception every evening was a great way to start the night. I highly recommend the "San Juan Bombs" from the singing bartender! Check in was fine after a bit of a wait and the room was clean. The only issue we had was getting enough towels - 4 women and 2 sets of towels is an issue and we had trouble getting the staff to understand that. The beach was a short walk from the hotel and along the way there is a little strip mall with almost everything you need. There's a grocery store, several restuarants - fast food and sit-down, and several other stores. The beach is gorgeous but make sure to rent a beach chair because as the day progresses there is more and more trash in the sand. The water is beautiful and the sunset was absolutely gorgeous. We took two excusions while we were there. I highly recommend the El Morro Fort tour. It's fun, historical and It's a great way to see Old San Juan as well. We also did the Bacardi "Factory" tour but that was pretty disappointing. Aside from the free drinks and cheaper prices in the gift shop, it's just a staged tour where you walk through a series of museum like rooms and listen to the narration of the tour guides. Security is off the hook to the point where you can't even walk from one area of the compound to another even though you can see where you are going. Instead you have to wait for the little train. Boo! I also HIGHLY recommend doing a tour of the El Yunque rainforest. It was absolutely gorgeous with lots of breathtaking views and worth the 30-45 minute ride each way. On one of the days we all decided to take the bus down to Old San Juan to walk around. For .75c you can't beat the price. Just ride the bus to the end of the line and you are there. It's a great way to see locals and the "real" San Juan. Overall I had a great time. It's beautiful there, the weather is beautiful and so are the people. I am planning to go back next year around Memorial weekend again and I will be staying at the Embassy Suites again. I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “everything ship shape”
Reviews.Author: AZJOHN1
Reviews.Content: After reading so many horror stories on other San Juan hotels, I booked the Embassy Suites for the first few nights with the plan to check out some other (cheaper, closer to town) places after I landed. This Embassy Suites is right near the airport. I did not hear airplane noise. Everything here worked perfectly and was clean and ready for me. The hotel is beautiful and well maintained. There was horrific noise in the 8-story atrium most nights, either from the local band at the bar or the large banquet parties booked every night. BUT...the living room of the suite acted as a buffer, and when I went into the bedroom with the door shut, I couldn't hear a thing. The internet access was free, but when I logged on the first time it said I would be charged $10 per day. (I was not charged, just confused.) This neighborhood is listed as Carolina, but the locals call it "Isla Verde" after the great beach that is 2 blocks away. There is a bus (A5) that runs all the way down the coast into Old San Juan for 75 cents, but the service is slow and erratic. It goes through 2 housing projects, which might scare some people, but I felt safe. If you are not going to take the bus, taxis are expensive. Most people say you should rent a car in San Juan, but the drivers don't follow right-of-way rules, and I'm glad I did not. Parking in all of San Juan and Isla Verde is a nightmare, and the valet at the hotel was $20. If you just want to relax and go to the beach/pool every day, this place would be great. The management pays attention to details here, so you can relax. It's far from cultural attractions and real local neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location. Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Teejohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon. The rooms are large, clean and perfect for relaxing. The cooked to order breakfast was always good and the free 2 hour happy hour was very nice as well. The hotel is clean and in a great location. Less then a 3 min walk to a perfect beach. The hotel pool is fantastic and the staff go out of their way to help you out. You are also close to Old town San Juan, about 10 min by taxi. Also close by there is a Ritz, El San Juan hotel and and intercontinental. All three are great if you want to get dressed up and go for a great meal, diner and dancing, all with great casinos. This hotel is great value for money. I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great San Juan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickyb07
Reviews.Content: Me and wife stayed here 5 days 4 nights June 5th - June 9th. The hotel is a short 2 block walk to the beach, and close to lots of restaraunts and nightlife. The free breakfast in the morning is great - the happy hr is ok (drinks are really weak - which is what what you would expect when it's free). Only other complaint I had was the casino, as other guest have said, it was small - and the beverage service was slow...but overall, this place is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites, Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: acequeen
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites is a very comfortable hotel. The breakfast is great in the morning. The staff was friendly. The hotel was beautiful and clean. The pool was freezing. It was hard to even put a toe in. This hotel is within walking distance to the beach, casinos, restaurants (coco bongo is cheap and good) and wal greens.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! For A Great Price! April10-14”
Reviews.Author: wnliz
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites in San Juan was by far the BEST decision we made on this trip. You get more then what you pay for, the price was great since it included a delicious Cook to order breakfast every morning & a Happy Hour everyday from 5:30-7:30 all you can drink plus free snacks. The bartenders were great! & Friendly. Those are just a few things that saved us a whole lot $$. The rooms were Spacious & clean! a nice wet bar, a separate living area and great staff! The pool was just beautiful! And relaxing. The casino was a bit small but comfortable and every night they raffle gifts & prizes. I won a $50 raffling prize! This hotel was only a block 1/2 from the beach and just steps away to all restaurants, Hotels & Night Life. The front desk was very helpful with directions etc. The gym room came in handy, and so did the laundry room. There was an Outback Steakhouse in the Hotel the food was great and the prices were reasonable. A small convenience store was great for snacks, cigarettes, & last minute things. The Lobby was just beautifully decorated with Palm trees and ponds, it was just so! Worth it.. We stayed for 4 days but wished we were there longer! Now where are you going to find a great deal like this??? At the Embassy Suites!! There was a small restaurant "Mi Casita" just in the plaza 1blk away with Great! Spanish food for a great price. Also there was an "Edith's Cafe" right across from the Hampton Inn Suites on Isla Verde Ave with Delicious food and reasonable prices. Lupis, was a nice place to hear music & have a couple drinks good food as well. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends & family!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the beach...”
Reviews.Author: jerseyboy99
Reviews.Content: We, 2 adults and 2 kids (ages 9 and 11) stayed here in April 07 for 4 nights compliments of HHonors points...yeah, I know, I'm a bit late with the review - sorry. Great location â€“ close to the airport, and about a block and a half from a very nice beach. We never heard the planes at night and slept wonderfully. However, the hotel is very close to the airport and you can easily see the planes land but the noise was pretty much drowned out by the outside noise from people and the waterfall at the pool. The rooms were of a typical Embassy Suites, more than accomodating for the 4 of us...clean and comfy. We all loved the huge breakfast every morning and the evening social hour. Since we were travelling with the kids, I really liked having an Outback as the onsite restaurant. The food was prepared just as in the States complete with steamed veggies â€“ something hard to find in the islands. Just a block and a half away is the main street with Burger King, Walgreens, and other fast food type restaurants. We also ate at the Mi Casitas restaurant and had a great meal. It is in walking distance, only two blocks. The area pool was great. The kids didn't mind and swam every day. It is a beautiful free form pool surrounded by palm trees. We took the bus to Old San Juan, which was really a good time. We toured the forts and walked around town. We also rented a car from across the street and drove to El Yunque which we all really liked. You can drive through most of it, however, there are also some pretty scenic hiking trails.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay.”
Reviews.Author: arant
Reviews.Content: Hotel overall is nice. The furnishings in the room need replaced. When you sat on the sofa you were practically sitting on the floor. The rooms were much smaller than other embassy suites I have stayed in. Pool area was very nice. Food was good. Bell staff was more helpful than anyone. Really the only problem I had was at the breakfast area when I was asking the girl where stuff was she was rude and walked off. Everyone else was nice,

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kj1130
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Puerto Rico and thought I would share our experience. If you are looking for a good value, the Embassy Suites is it. This hotel is moderately sized and moderately priced and was a great value. It is located near the airport which was convenient, there was a little noise from the airport but minimal. I had a hard time deciding on this hotel vs. others that were on the beach, I'm glad I picked the Embassy Suites. The beach is about two blocks away, the ES lets you use their towels. You can also rent chiars to lay on (about $4 bucks a piece) You are on the beach with local folks and those who paid to stay on the beach, so overall, for us, we felt we got the better deal. There was free breakfast every morning (omelets, pancakes, eggs, bacon, sausage, etc.) and the manager's reception for drinks every night from 5:30-7:30. You get about 3 drinks during that time and snacks if you so choose. I expected the manager's reception to be a mad house, but it was very organized. If you go, go after 6.
