Folks begin to line up at 5:30, if you wait a little while you will have lttle to no wait. Customer service was excellent. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Often times we were thanked for staying there. We ordered towels and they came within 10 minutes. Ten minutes later we received a call ensuring that we received the towels. It was great. We booked this hotel for $199 p/n. I'm glad that we did, by the time the additional fees are charged (it is cited on ES website) we paid $239 p/n. When researching hotels, I noticed that all of them charge these extra fees, so be sure to consider those additional fees when booking. I visited Old San Juan one day, it would have been $40 r/t in a cab, but instead I walked across the way to the Holiday Inn. They had a Dollar Rent A Car. Without taxes and insurance it was about $25 p/d, however I did have to pay for Parking in Old San Juan, so if you do rent a car, make it worth your time to have one. Overall Puerto Rico was great, it's well traveled in Isla Verde, but the city is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Best of a bad situation”
Reviews.Author: alexischristine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights under not the best circumstances. We had to leave our cruise ship before it sailed due to a personal emergency. However, we had a pleasant stay until we could get a flight home. The included breakfast and cocktail social included in the price of the room was a definite plus. The atrium surroundings were lovely. Our suite had a separate bedroom and living room with tv's in both. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows and linens. The rooms were very clean and included refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. An Outback Steakhouse was conveniently located in the atrium lobby which was open for dinner until late in the evening for late arrivals. The pool area was very nice and it was an easy two block walk to the beach. The hotel has its own small casino which was closed due to renovation while we were there. There is a business center in the lobby with computers available, free internet access and free printing. This hotel is very close to the airport, but we were not bothered by the sound of planes overhead. It would be a pleasant place to stay for a night before or after a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites = Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rawkneee
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the Embassy Suites, San Juan. We were there for 6 nights. The pool was great and Jacuzzi was great. The beach is a short walk away (2 blocks away) and it is beautiful. The complimentary breakfast was very good too. Made to order omelettes, sausage, bacon, potatoesâ€¦yummy! The Happy Hour every afternoon was great too! Free drinks (Wine, Beer, Mixed Drinks) every day for 2 hours. The location was good. Near freeways, beach, food (Mi Casita is down the street, great local food), airport, nightlife (Drums, El San Juan, The Waterclub, The Oyster bar, Lupis â€“ all within walking distance). I would highly recommend renting a car. We did and enjoyed exploring all of Puerto Rico. Charlies Car rental is walking distance from the hotel as well. Old San Juan is about a 15 minute drive from here, or a $19 taxi ride will also get you there. I heard you could also take the bus (known as the wah-wah to locals), but I imagine it would at least take you an hour to get there. Rooms were nice, clean, and roomy. We had a pool view and were able to see the pool and the planes landing at the airport next door. Room also had a fridge. Most of the people who stay there mid-week are business people, but on the weekends, you get a lot more tourist. Beware of the "resort fee". For six nights, we paid a little over $200 for the resort fee and parking, parking was $15 a day. We were aware of the fee from reading other reviews, so since it was expected, it was no big deal. Day trips we did on our stay with our car: El Yunque, La Culebra Island using the Fajardo Ferry, Old San Juan - El Morro, Luquillo Beach, City of Ponce, Bio-Bay in Fajardo.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: ccor22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites February 21st-February 25th 2008. Travelers consisted of three couples ranging from ages 28-38. I read many reviews as I do every time I travel, some good some not so good. I must say that we were pleasantly surprised. I realize that it may bother some people that it is so close to the airport, but it really did not affect us. We never lost any sleep over that or the music in the atrium. The 2 room suite was decent and very spacious. The buffet breakfast ( which is included) was also very good. We especially liked the fact that they make cooked to order eggs/omelettes. The 2 hour nightly manager's free happy hour was also a nice bonus considering the fact that you are staying at a hotel so they overprice the cocktails. It is a good idea to go to the supermarket and pick up your own beverages. You will save considerably. I am used to all-inclusive so it was tough for me to see that they were charging $5.00 for a beer. I am by no means cheap, just pratical. Also, I read reviews that stated the beach was about a ten minute walk??? The walk is about 5 minutes, possibly under. We went to the beach several times after laying by the pool which was extremely cold. The pool was our only disappointment. It was nice to look at and that's about it. I spent most of my time in the hot tub. There are many places to eat outside the hotel. If you like to walk you will find pleanty on the way. Fortunately, I traveled with people who know the island so we were able to hop in the car and go to different locations which is a huge plus. Also, the casino which is open until 4 A.M. is pretty small, but we did not have a problem with that. I believe we make our own vacations what they are ie. fun, romantic,quiet etc. It is a great hotel for the value. We would certainly stay there again in the future. As a matter of fact, we just booked a trip for April at another Embassy Suites in a different part of PR.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: papi1096
Reviews.Content: Our stay was ok. At check in the staff was not as friendly as we expected. The made to order breakfast was good and also included in price. Our room was clean although there was a great big stain in the carpet under the dinette table (looked like coffee) we found some Skiddles Candies stuck to one of the bed sheets. We complained and Our resort fee was waved. The pool area was noisy the hotel is a few yards away from one of the airport runways. Overall not a bad experience. Don't know about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Divehpu
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have written, this is a nice hotel near the airport. The pool is great for kids and the beach is a short walk from the hotel. The small casino was not crowded during the week and the breakfast buffet was above average. Like most Embassy Suites, the rooms were clean and the staff was attentive. Overall, a great place to stay for a day or two before leaving Puerto Rico. On a side note, I've read some reviews about the expensive taxis to Old San Juan and recommending renting a car. This is a fine idea if you are going to tour part of the island, but if you are planning on only going to Old San Juan you can take the bus for $0.75 each way. It takes 45 minutes, but it is a straight shot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Martysue
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a long weekend to Puerto Rico. We picked the Embassy Suites because of the short distance from the airport. The hotel was clean and neat and the extra room in the suite was great! The beach is a 2 minute walk from the hotel which we didn't mind at all. We stayed all day - the water was beautiful. The hotel is also walking distance from nice restaurants so we didn't feel like we needed a car during our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Handy, Clean and Nice Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: blondzai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally right beside the airport landing strip and beside the freeway, yet you can't hear these noises from your room. The casino is located in the atrium and the noise from the live music filtered up to the rooms, but the great thing about the Embassy Suites is that you can close the door to your separate bedroom and you can't hear a thing. I thought it was neat to sit at the very spacious and well conceived pool and literally watch the planes coming down. The pool's waterfall, for the most part filters out the plane noise. There were enough chaise lounges for everyone who came to the pool (and it was full) and you can get a massage and other spa services poolside. The food at the Outback located in the hotel was terrific and the service that we received from the Embassy staff was great, especially the day manager, Bo. Overall, great location with clean rooms, good service, good food , conveniently located by the airport and other good restaurants, blocks away from the beach and for sightseeing into Old San Juan. I understand the taxi fares from this area to be a little high to go to Old San Juan and would recommend renting a car for the $40 a day which would also allow you access to the Rain Forest and the Caves. Parking rates at the Embassy are $14 and $20 for self and valet parking, respectively.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty okay, but I wouldnt stay again !!!”
Reviews.Author: Prashanth C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, and it was good enough for a normal stay. If you wanna make it a romantic trip, you should avoid this place. It has the very minimum in terms of amenities. The good part is that the atrium area is great, they have happy hours in the evening and the staff is very helpful. The pool area is great. The casino is ok, and gets crowded at nights so you have to wait. There's an outback steakhouse downstairs, for good food. The major issue I had with this place is that it did not have beach access. It would have been great if that was there. All in all, its a good place for a business trip, or if you're going with friends. If its a honeymoon/romantic trip, there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites a good stay.”
Reviews.Author: GoHokies07
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with an 8 year old, a 10 year old and two 22 year olds so for us the choice of Embassy suites was due to that you could fit 6 people in a suite with two double beds and a pull out couch. Very pricey - paid 209 one night, 259 another night and 309 for the weekend night. Weird but long story. Even at the 200 + per night stay it was worth it to not have to pay for two seperate rooms and everyone ate breakfast free. The free cocktail 2 hours was also enjoyed by all, as they also had sodas, virgin drinks and popcorn for the kids. The kids loved the pool. It was an easy walk to the beach. Rooms were clean. Lobby was clean and well taken care of. Eating in San Juan with little ones is difficult if you are trying to get a bit of the local flavor. We are not fans of eating at fast food joints, there are PLENTY of these if that is your thing. We did find a good place that served local dishes withing walking distance. Mi Casita. The kids all found something they liked. Don't go to any restraunt in Puerto Rico hungry as the food takes a while and in the case of Mi Casita - take a sweater. Old San Juan is a short drive from the Embassy Suites but you can rent a car from car rentals near by or take a taxi. Expensive Vallet service, plus extra 14 dollars a day to park. We also went to El Yunque on our own instead of a tour. Very easy to do. Great snack bar in the main information area - kid friendly food. The hotel is VERY close to the airport. A 15 dollar taxi ride for 6 people and 8 pieces of luggage. The front desk was very helpful in getting toothbrushes ect to the room. Had our lost luggage waiting for us when we woke up in the morning. Very nice people. Pricey for us but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Embassy Suites, but with bad staff”
Reviews.Author: classA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise. Picked this hotel based on it's proximity to the airport (late arriving flight). We walked into the lobby at 10pm on a Friday night to be greeted by echoing, loud drums (I think it was supposed to be a band) from some kind of 'event' that had been going on. As we were checking in, I asked the non-interested clerk behind the desk how long the music would be going on, she shrugged and said 'they were almost done'...which translated to another few hours (i guess i should've asked for a clarification of "island time"). I explained that our luggage had been lost by American Airlines and they said we should inform the hotel so they would be on-hand to receive it, and instead of any sympathy or offer of toiletries, she again shrugged and said 'someone's always here'. We went to the bar in the lobby for a drink, and received the first one from a helpful waitress, but my husband had to go to the bar to get his second drink because the other waitress was too busy standing 2 feet from us talking to another person at the bar. I gave up on getting a second one after she walked by our table and ignored us and my empty glass the 3rd time (and I'm a VERY patient person). Casino was incredibly small and looked like part of it was under renovation. Suite and breakfast were usual for Embassy Suites...lots of room in the room and hit-or-miss food at the buffett (it was really busy and they had trouble replenishing the food to keep up). My husband bought toiletries in the hotel gift shop and was overcharged by $30 ($85 vs. $55 that it should have been), which he didn't realize until we were back home--seems the clerk there was operating on less sleep than we were. To be fair, the pool area looked nice and the bellstaff were very understanding and helpful. The other person behind the counter was very nice and promptly had toiletries sent to our room when I requested it. We are both easy going and very polite people and didn't expect 5-star treatment from this hotel, just common courtesy and respect (especially when paying hotel prices for drinks). We stayed at the Marriott Stellaris after the cruise and had a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Double Check the Fine Print”
Reviews.Author: Laurie2525
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before because it is very close to the San Juan airport and we were only going to be there for under 10 hours. I booked a Net Direct Rate through the hotel site because it had the lowest rate. The rate was $260.39 USD, plus $28.64 for 11% hotel tax. The total rate charged immediately was $289.03. We checked in late in the evening and the desk clerk said everything was paid in full, but wanted to run my credit card through in case we had any incidental charges for the restaurant, etc. I asked him if the room was paid for in advance and he said yes, I did not owe anything. We checked out at 6 AM to rush to the airport, and were presented with an additional fee of 9% of the total. Of course, we paid it, it was under $30, but I think they should mention it on their website. I would have booked the hotel through someone else to avoid the fee. We book all of our trips online and we have never had a prepaid hotel add charges at checkout. The location for the airport is great. The decor is modern. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom smelled musty. It is OK for an overnight stay, but I would not want to stay there for a vacation. The lobby is very loud and all of the rooms open to the lobby. The staff is pleasant. No frills. It is not really convenient to walk to any restaurants other than the ones in the lobby. I think the price was very high for a basic hotel. I also will not book directly through Embassy Suites site again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, nice pool, but nothing that stands out as great”
Reviews.Author: Lukafoo74
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Embassy Suites for five nights in early December. We chose the Embassy Suites based on a combination of Trip Advisor reviews, the price, the location and the pool and hot tub. Overall, I can't say that we were unhappy with our stay, but we probably would stay somewhere else if we visited Puerto Rico again. We booked through the Hilton website and were quoted $170 per night before taxes, fees, parking etc. After taxes, fees, parking we ended up paying about $220 per night. I knew about the additional expenses in advance, so I wasn't surprised, it just starts to add up. Overall, we found travel in Puerto Rico to fairly expensive vs. the value. Most of the hotels seem to charge extra for parking ($14 per day) and include a 10% per day service charge. The best features of the Embassy Suites are the pool, the breakfast buffet, the manager's reception, the in-room fridge and the free wireless internet. Most of the staff was helpful, and we didn't have any trouble with the maid service. The lobby and courtyard were pretty and overall the hotel seemed to be clean and well-maintained. Our room was a nice size and it was nice to have the two separate areas, but the location of our room wasn't the best. The pool is pretty large, although the water is a little chilly. The hot tub is nice for a hotel. Also, the pool and hot tub were not super crowded when we were there. While in Puerto Rico, we found that the minimum that we spent for a meal was $30, the average was about $50 to $60 and the high end was over $100. Drinks run from about $4 to $5 for a beer to $10 for mixed drinks. That said the breakfast buffet and manager's reception, although not the best, probably saved us some money. Things to be improved upon are the on-site dining options and I wasn't thrilled with the location. We did not try either restaurant on-site, one of which is an Outback Steakhouse, but I heard from others that the food and service were not good. We also didn't spend any time at the casino, but it looked kind of small. The location of the hotel is ok. It is near the airport and some other nicer hotels (El San Juan and the Intercontinental). There is a beach a few blocks away. Carolina/Isla Verde feels fairly suburban and it seemed like there were a lot of business travelers in our hotel. There is a strip that you can walk along that has a few restaurants and there is good access to the highway. Old San Juan is about a 15 minute drive from the hotel. We went to the San Juan Hotel and Casino on a Saturday night and had a lot of fun, there seemed to be a lot of local people there. During my initial search, I couldn't find a hotel in our price range (under $200) in Old San Juan that had the amenities that we were looking for (pool and hot tub). Plus, once we saw Old San Juan, it seems like it might have been pretty noisy to stay in a hotel there. Our other choice was the Marriott, which was slightly more expensive and in Ocean Park. The area around the Marriott was under construction, but the Marriott itself looked nice, is closer to Old San Juan and had some more upscale shopping. We probably would have had a different experience if we stayed in another area, next time if we return we would probably try the Marriott. Again, not a bad experience, just nothing that stands out as great. We also went inside the Holiday Inn, the Intercontinental, El San Juan and El Convento. All were nice, El San Juan seemed to be the most happening, but didnâ€™t seem as nice as the Intercontinental. El Convento was in a good location and really pretty. Background info on us, we are mid-thirties and take 2 to 3 trips per year. Last December we went to Cancun and the year before we went to Miami and Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Embassy Suites!!!”
Reviews.Author: 123sol
Reviews.Content: I loved the Embassy Suites, they give you two rooms, each room has a tv. The main room has plenty of space for your clothes, etc. two double beds, and the second room is like a sitting room, kitchenette, microwave, and the couch is a bed. The bathroom was expasious, and clean. LOVED IT!!! The breakfast is included, and it is expansive, from cereal, to cook to order. The two hour open bar, is great, they have great music, and excellent service. I am sold on Embassy Suites, their service was excellent, I got checked in early, and was not charged for a later check out. Very accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the surcharge!”
Reviews.Author: jomia
Reviews.Content: 2 December 2007 I spent three nights in this hotel in early November, 2007. I travel a great deal, several months a year. In my experience this hotel is marginally satisfactory but uninspiring. The room size is a bit cramped but adequate. The decor is rather tired and the furnishings eclectic. The personnel do their jobs - but they do not go much beyond that. The most annoying aspect of this hotel is the 9% surcharge that is imposed on your bill. You are not advised of this surcharge until you arrive at the hotel. When you sign in, you must also sign a statement accepting this charge. At best, the hotel can be accused of false advertising. At worst it is a form of extortion since your only alternative is to take your bags and look for another hotel. The hotel states that the surcharge is to cover local phone calls and web access. I do not use the phone since I have a cell. As for web access, at most hotels it is free or charged at a rate that is considerably less than the cost of the surcharge. (Incidentally, the connection speed is quite slow.) The hotel, although located near the airport, does not even provide shuttle service! Considering these factors and the relatively high room rates and remote location, you would do better looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: cla3boys
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending the Thanksgiving holiday week at the Embassy Suites. There were three adults and three children traveling in our party so we booked a two bedroom suite. Once we arrived, our check-in was very smooth. Everything was in order and ready without delay. Our rooms were actually a king suite with an adjoining room with two double beds. We had two bathrooms and three TV's! The rooms were very clean. The only reason I did not give the hotel five stars was that the rooms could use a new coat of paint. We loved the huge breakfast every morning. My teenager also loved the virgin pina coladas every night and we enjoyed the adult ones! The pool was great but the water was a little cool. The kids didn't mind and swam every day. It is a beautiful free form pool surrounded by palm trees. We never heard the planes at night and slept wonderfully. the beds were comfortable and many extra pillows were provided. We ate in the Outback twice and once at the bar. We played in the casino which is a bit on the small side but full of nickel slots. We also ate at the Mi Casitas restaurant and had a great meal. It is in walking distance, only two blocks. We walked to the beach which is also two blocks and had a lovely day on Thanksgiving. We thought this beach was better than the Carolina Park Beach. We drove to Old San Juan twice without any problems and drove to the rain forest. The staff at the Embassy was very helpful. The breakfast chef made pancakes for us even though they weren't serving them that day. The front desk clerk made us copies of various restaurant Thanksgiving Day menus in the area. Maintenance came up right away when we had a problem the first night and fixed it. Great hotel, Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and nice experience !”
Reviews.Author: miar70
Reviews.Content: You get a lot for your money with the included buffet breakfast and managers welcome drinks (2 hrs of free cocktails) every day. The pool is nice and quite large with on site hot tub open between 7am and 10pm. Their are many amenities here, such as a fitness centre, free wireless internet and a small laundry (small daily charge applied). This is a suites hotel, so there are 2 rooms to the suite and includes a fridge and microwave for storing and heating some basic food, great if you have kids ! Hotel is 2 blocks from the beach, on the Atlantic coast side of the island, which produced some fun waves to play in. Staff were professional and very friendly and eager to help. Also if you go, make sure you check out the Barcadi factory tour. It's free to go in and you get some free samples, but it costs you to get out there, but fun all the same !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Embassy experience”
Reviews.Author: kimbaetiquette
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of good reviews about the Embassy and decided to risk it after reading that construction was going on at the El San Juan. Room 416 which we were assigned was a very pleasant surprise. We did not expect a suite with two televisions. Everything was impeccable, the staff helpful and courteous. We checked in on Oct. 20 thru 23, and the details were those we expect from the high end hotels. A newspaper at the door on weekdays, shower heads with several options, the huge array of choices at complimentary breakfast. I had expected something akin to a Continental breakfast. I was blown away by the breakfast choices and small details like a cherry on the plate when the omlette was returned by the cook. The hotel is in an enclave so we walked out to the main street, Ave Isla Verde, and right across the street was the A5 bus to Old San Juan. We still patronized the casino at the El San Juan which is 5 mins away because it is bigger than the casino at the Embassy. My husband said it best, "on a scale of 1 to 5, I give them a 10."

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Steffie326
Reviews.Content: Hubby, myself and another couple stayed here from Oct 3 - Oct 8. The rooms were very nice - suites- with a separate living room area. Very confortable beds, roomy bathroom and accomodating service. The pool area was enjoyable, free internet access, nice bar / lounge area and the lobby was tropical with an open atrium & lots of foliage. Free full breakfast available, including ready to order omelettes / eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, bagels, toast, cereals, oatmeal / farina, coffee, juices, etc, etc. More than enough to start the day. Free evening reception which amounted to free drinks for guests from 5:30pm - 7pm. Two blocks walking distance from the beach and other restaurants & hotels. We enjoy walking and after a full dinner, welcomed the opportunity to stroll along Isla Verde Blvd to visit other hotels. We went to two local restaurants: Barrachina & Mi Casita. Both were within walking distance and very flavorful - check them out! Also, we asked them for a recommendation for a local bakery. They gave us directions to Espana Bakery on Calle Marginal Villamar. This bakery is awesome! Only 5 minute drive from the hotel and they had everything from pastries to sandwiches to quiches to hot meals and even liquor. Delicious! We went there the day we were leaving and picked up sandwiches to eat on the airplane. The other passengers were jealous! Down sides - they do not have an airport shuttle. The front desk said that they are not allowed to have it??? Small casino - okay for a novice, but not sure if real players would be satisfied. Daily parking fee for guests ($10 / day). You would think they wouldn't charge guests for parking. An added hotel fee of 9% (or something like that). They attribute this to providing free internet access, free local phone service and other services. Just be aware of this. Not sure if other hotels have started charging the same "fee", but the Embassy does. Regardless, we got a great package deal through Orbitz. Over all, service was great. We enjoyed it, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: reneet39
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from five days at the Embassy Suites. Service was great. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in a great location, not far from the strip if you are interested in having easy access to night life, as well as local resturants. It is cost effective to rent a car. It will pay for itself, by saving you from taxi trips which can cost up to $15.00/per person, as well as from tours which can cost $25.00/pp and up. The complimentary made to order breakfast was great as well as the manager's cocktail hour every evening. They made any drink you requested. Although there was a casino in the hotel, we did not hear the noise, which is great. The facilities were always clean, and staff was good. There is an outback in the restuarant for convenience. Try Mi Casita, Barrachina and Yuqi's. These are all great local restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: TenshaBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: My family and I were flying in late and needed a place with two sleeping rooms near the airport and you cant beat the price for that. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The room was clean. The pool was very pretty - they definitely had the tropical decor going on. I wouldnt chose this site for my vacation, but it was nice as a place to lay my head on my way to the west coast. There are free drinks during happy hour - but what a line - not worth it. We had a 4 year old in tow - and this was nice for him. there was even a kiddy pool. Nancy

Reviews.Title: “Had a great times at Embassy Suites in San Juan Puerto RIco”
Reviews.Author: mondains
Reviews.Content: Me, my girl friend, her sister and her friend ages 20-24 all stayed at the Embassy Suites in a room. The room was very very nice it had two sections one which had 2 full suized beds, tv and the other room had a table couce bed tv and wet bar. The room was very clean and alothough our view was the room it still did not matter as we were not there to look out our window. The only complaint is that the our toilt got clogged three times lol. The hotel was super clean and nice on the inside and was beautifully decorated with all types of vegitation. It had a nice pool area with water fall and a snack bar out there as well. Alothough this hotel is close to the air port and you can hear planes going by, it never bothered us its not that loud at all. The best thing i liked about this place is they have a Happy hour from 5-7pm everyday where all house wines, beers, and mixed drinks are free. I really liked this as we drank up from 5-7 and did not have to spend much on booze when we went out after wards. At some times there was along line, but we never waited more than 5-7 mins. And they let you get as many cups as you want so i usually got 3 at a time so i did not have to keep going back up there. This place is not located on the beach but again that was not a problem for us as it was a 5 min straight walk down the beach. The beach is really nice and we did not not see any sea weed. The water is a pretty blue color and feels really nice. There are many places to eat nearby the hotel within a 5 mins walk such as Subway, Toca Bell, Wendys, KFC, we did not see a mc donalds nearby though. While we were there we went to the Rain Forest which was really nice. We did not go on a group tour we rented a driver and told him to drop us off and then be waiting for us where we exited. We liked this a lot because we were told that the tour guides will rush you and not like you spend time in the water falls ect.. We got to take our time to look at what we wanted to and swim at all the spots during the path. It was really nice. I highly suggest the Rain Forest. We also did the BIO BAY Tour this was alright not the greatest we could see the things glowing but not that well as it was a full moon. If you do this Make sure u do it when there is little or no moon out otherwise it will not be that great. We also took the city bus off Isle Verde Ave for $1 to old san juan to see the two castles and explore around. This was really nice. You can walk inside almost every room of the castles and look at everything this is a must do, if you ask me. Overall we really liked this hotel and its location to everything, o and i almost forgot the hotel is near tons and tons of night clubs and bars within walking distance. so if you like to go to clubs like we did this is the spot to stay. tons of clubs on ise verde ave. There is also a huge super market about 2 blocks from the hotel that sells everything its kinda like a Kmart. They have beer liquor food ect..

Reviews.Title: “"Disappointed"”
Reviews.Author: isageegee
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful....I really enjoyed all their efforts..... The suite was not as clean as I expected it......it looked cleaned but it had a funny odor, I should have told the staff and I know they would have given us a different suite. I believe the ventilation system in the room needed attention. I have stayed at this hotel so often, I feel as if I am at home, but this time I noticed some subtle changes, such as the complimentary cocktail hour lacked the drinks that were once provided,,,,such as Pina Colada or Margarita as offered in the past.....so if you don't drink beer or wine, one must go to the bar and "buy" your own drinks. I was hit with an onerous and totally unexpected " EXIT" tax, which was substantial and sprung on me, without warning on leaving. I had no choice in the matter and felt I was being shook down by the hotel, and I felt I had already paid the appropriate taxes when presented with the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: AgentCayey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites from June 30-July 2, 2007. This hotel is located right at the entrance of Luis Munoz Marin International Airport. Accomodations are the best that this hotel has to offer. I am a travel agent and always conduct a site inspection while staying at hotels. This is what I found: Rooms are great. They are suites and they have the bedroom plus the living room (also converted to a bedroom). Pool is great and towel service is excellent. Pool is open until 10:00 PM. If you are in a business travel this is a great place to stay. However, food service is provided basically by Outback Steakhouse which is really good. They also offer for guest, two ours of open bars, in which you can find beers like budlight, budweiser, and Medalla and a lot of drinks. There is free soda, popcorn and snacks also available. The great beach of Isla Verde is 10 minutes walking. I will stay here again. It is a great place for a great price. J . Martinez

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGatorFans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after a recent cruise. As others have said, it can be tricky to find if you're driving yourself, but once you get your bearings, it's not so bad. We arrived hours before check-in, and although we couldn't get into our room, the hotel stored our baggage so we could go exploring. Once we got into our room, we weren't disappointed... It was a 2-room suite with more than enough room for us and our 6 year old daughter (who was thrilled to have her own room and tv). The room was very clean and looked pretty new. The bed had a fitted sheet on it, which I always like to see in hotels (hate how the flat ones can come off during the night). Our room overlooked the pool (and the highway, which is RIGHT next to the pool), but while I worried about noise from planes or traffic, there was NONE! The same can't be said about noise from INSIDE the hotel. Our first night there (a Sunday), there was a singer and music in the lobby that we heard plain as day in our room. The good thing was, it was over by about 9:30, and after that, all was quiet. The breakfast in the morning offered tons of choices, from omelettes to pancakes to cereal. Something for everyone. Our first morning there was very rainy, and that may have led to the REALLY long breakfast lines. It literally took us 25 minutes to get our food. Yikes! The second morning, though, there was practically no line. Go figure... It would be nice to have the breakfast open later than just 9:30. Seems kind of early for a hotel that has a lot of tourists as guests. Our only real problem with the hotel was that our room was never made up on our full day there. We'd left the hotel at around 9:30 and got back at 3. The room hadn't been touched. Went to the pool for another 2 hours; still nothing. We got a a call at around 5:30 asking if we'd like for them to make up the room for us. At that point, we figured why bother, and just asked for new towels. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel. The pool was very nice, and the staff we ran into were very pleasant. It's walking distance to the beach, is clean and bright, and a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Just Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbudz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little taste of paradise. I actually preferred it over the beach. My friend and I spent most of the time eating and drinking alongside the pool. Don't get me wrong--we swam as well. The lagoon is a spacious pool of 5 ft. that sits right beneath the sun and palm trees. At times, it may be frequented by a bunch of kids, as the hotel seems to attract families. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. We had a leak in the sink and maintenance came right up to fix it. We didn't have to wait. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the bed...the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel!! I didn't want to leave the bed! The continental breakfast offers pancakes, french toast, omlettes, fruit and all types of sides. The hotel is one block away from the main strip where American fast food restaurants, Walgreens, 7-11, night clubs and other hotels are. Just a few steps further and you're right on the beach! Expedia doesn't mention the hotel service charge, so don't be surprised when you check-in and sign off on 10% extra daily. Will definiately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheeseshoney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from June 28-July 5th and I plan on going back! I stayed here with 20 family members and we loved it. Having stayed at the El San Juan down the street which is an upscale hotel, I liked this hotel much better, especially traveling with children. The suites were very spacious and very clean. We had a view of the pool which was great and although planes are landing all day long, you cannot hear the planes from your room. The breakfast every morning was a great money saver as well as the managers reception every evening with top notch liquor. Great food and great drinks.....can't beat it!! We ate at Mi Casita which I've eaten at before, the first night the food was WONDERFUL, it was true island food, but our second visit was not as good, there must have been different cooks. Also be ready for slow service at the resaurants and also read your bill before tipping as most restaurants charge 15% gratuity no matter how small the party. We also ate at Levi's at the end of the strip which had good service and food was okay. If your in the mood for fast puerto rican food at a good price, try the Pollo Tropical, also down at the end of the strip. One thing visitors to the Embassy Suites should watch out for is their final bill. The hotel charges you for a 9% hotel fee which includes local calls. Having family in Puerto Rico I did make some calls and also called down to the desk before calling to confirm they were free because of the 9%, I was still billed for each call 1.25 plus tax. So make sure to check your bill, the front desk took it off, but make sure to check and not be overcharged. There were also about 2 proms while we were there,but did not bother us at all, we were on the 4th floor and our room was over the prom area...but again no problems. The beach is 2 blocks down about 5-10 minute walk and Isla Verde Beach is beautiful. I have traveled to Loquillo Beach before but this year Isla Verde Beach was perfect. Overall this hotel was a perfect stay and I definitely plan on visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Happy Hour”
Reviews.Author: HotwaterFrog
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on reviews previously posted here. I LOVED the hotel. It is close to a very nice beach. There are many places to eat out. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. The breakfast buffet was fantastic and I loved the special Pina Coladas at the nightly happy hour. I requested and got a room on the upper floor and I asked for one in the wings and it was nice and quiet even when the lobby was very loud at night, Thanks prior reviewers for suggesting this it was very helpful. The only complaint that I had was regarding the in house restaurant, OutBack Steakhouse. It had incredibly poor service. Very slow and the food did not come out as requested. My suggestion, stay at the hotel but skip the outback. There are plenty of other places to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff and Dirty Dishes Await You!!”
Reviews.Author: booksntravel63
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Embassy Suites in early May 2007 for one night - thank God it was only one night. The thing that I find ridiculous about the rate is they quote you one price but you will end up paying quite a bit more after they tack on all the various taxes and fees (Puerto Rico LOVES fees, fees for EVERYTHING!!!) even the valet parking added taxes and "fees" to their $16.00 per night (ended up costing $23.00 without a tip) The bellhop sat there looking bored while we struggled with our bags, never offering to help two ladies upon check in. We just blew it off and went to our room. The room itself was fine, okay but we were tucked away at the very back of a wing away from any sort of view that would have made the stay a little nicer. We ordered room service (again, fees fees fees + a delivery charge) and the tray was still sitting outside our room the next day when we checked out. There were room service trays outside many of the doors throughout the hotel during our stay that never moved. It was gross really. Now for the best part, the CASINO staff is really rude, be prepared. We went in to the casino to waste some time and money after a great dinner at Ruth Chris Steak House (recommended highly) and we spent about $300 on slots in the course of several hours before we were offered a drink. I had asked 5 different waitress/wait staff people where I could BUY a drink and they each told me it was someone else's responsibility. So after 2 hours we finally got our drinks and proceeded to gamble. It was my 19 year old daughter's first opportunity to gamble (gambling/drinking age in Puerto Rico is 18) so she was excited and I wanted to take a photo of her pulling the slots...mind you, I had NO idea photography was not allowed in the Casino, there were NO signs anywhere stating this and since I don't normally hang out in casinos, I did not know this was typical for casinos. Well, I took out my pocket camera and started to take a photo of my daughter. A staff member (janitor) came up and smiled at us and said in extremely broken english (I could not begin to understand what he said at all) what I *thought* was "oh this is a good place for a picture, isn't it?" and I smiled and said "yes it is" he then started waving his hands around and SCREAMED inches from my face still unintelligible but enough for me to understand this time what he was trying to get across...."NO PICTURE, UNDERSTAND!!!!" I was stunned and embarrassed. There was NO need to scream at me, I did not understand what he had said originally and since he was smiling when he said it, how was I to know that he was indicating I was doing something wrong. I hate being made to feel stupid, especially by the casino janitor in broken english. This obviously ruined our night. We went to the Hotel Manager and were told there was nothing he could do about it since it happened in the Casino. We went to see the Casino Manager and were told to wait for him, that he was busy. We waited (ignored) for over 40 minutes before we decided to just forget it. I can't believe we were treated so badly and paid all that money to Embassy Suites to get that sort of treatment. Just be aware if you go here, you are going to spend a bundle and may get treated like a chump!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Girl's Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: tpfeeney
Reviews.Content: Myself and three girlfriends stayed at the Embassy Suites - San Juan May 3rd through May 7th. Visiting Puerto Rico was a first for all of us, so that is why we chose to vacation in PR. And we all agree it was a great choice. The Embassy Suites worked out perfect for us. We booked 2 suites, so each of us had our own bed and only had to share a bathroom with one other person instead of 3 other people. Well worth the extra money spent. The separate living room area worked out perfect for getting ready for dinner and relaxing. The bedroom was very spacious and comfortable. The complimentary breakfasts were fine. Some food items better than others, but you can't really complain when you don't have to leave the hotel and it is included with your room. The nightly manager's cocktail party was definitely worth visiting each night. They gave you 2 drinks each time you went up and the lines moved pretty quickly. The bartenders were friendly and gave heavy pours! Always a huge plus! One thing we did learn is when ordering a hamburger from the Atrium Restaurant, make sure you order it well not medium well because ours was still raw. The pool area was great. While we were there hardly anyone used the pool, so you always had your choice of spots to lay in the sun by the pool. Although we never actually saw the pool bar open, which would have been a nice to have been able to order a cool beverage by the pool, but we survived without them. The beach is a quick 5 minute walk from the hotel. And the majority of the restaurants and bars are very close as well. We walked at night to and from the hotel and never felt unsafe in the area. (I don't condone walking around at night, because crime still does happen, but we never felt nervous.) Some of the best bars we visited were the lounges and nightclub at the El San Juan Hotel. Very fun and lively. Definitely check this place out and dress accordingly. Pretty upscale but beautiful, especially the bordello salon. Club Liquid at the Beach & Water Club Hotel was a nice place as well. It is on the rooftop. Very pretty skyline and beach view. We visited Old San Juan which was incredibly beautiful. We went one afternoon there. We all wish would have been able to spend more time exploring this area. The restaurants and bars looked like a lot of fun. I definitely come back to the Puerto Rico and the Embassy Suites. Wonderful vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “loved the embassy nick staten island”
Reviews.Author: suntannednick
Reviews.Content: loved the embasyy nick staten island my wife and i stayed ath the embassy after our cruise may 5th-may 7th the hotel is great. the staff is very accomodatng the grounds are beautiful. it is only 2 short blocks to the beach. they have a wonderful free breakfast every morning. at night from 5.30-7.30 pm a managers cocktail party in the lobby. we really enjoyed our stay and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Could be improved”
Reviews.Author: megsies24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and the rooms are very clean. It is in a great location and easy to walk to the beach and restaurants. The breakfast leaves some to be desired and ends far too early for people who are on vacation. The staff members are friendly once you can get their attention. They definitely could be more attentive. My largest gripe is that they charge a 9% fee upon check-out for internet usage and pool toys! Their website mentions this fee but since I booked directly through the hotel I assumed that it was included in my bill. I have never heard of a hotel charging such a high fee after the fact. I am just upset that they did not mention this when I called and they are so sneaky about adding it at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent and...”
Reviews.Author: CRDUSA
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. We had a very nice room which overlooked the pool. However, I think this will probably be our last stay at this property and in San Juan in general. Hotel: The breakfast, which was so fabulous last year, has taken a step back. They used to make omelettes in omelette pans and they were great. Now, they make them on the grill, using cylinders to keep them round. Well, I ordered two, and each time the outside of the omelette came out overcooked and the inside was raw. Additionally, it was amazing how many times the cooks made mistakes as to who had ordered which omelette. It was like they had never worked at this job before. Also, the lines were very long each and every morning. The cocktail reception in the evening, always a nice plus, has also taken a step back. No longer will they make blender drinks, as in the past. Additionally, like the breakfast, the lines are very long. The pool is very nice. However, the surface outside the pool is inexplicably slippery and dangerous. I mean, who would construct a pool like that? Time and time again, I saw people, especially little children, fall. Some toddlers even fell back, banging their heads. If you have little children, you must stay on top of them and insure they don't run (very difficult to do with kids). I'd be willing to bet, sadly, that this pool has seen its share of serious accidents. Also, there is no lifeguard, which is a shame. The location of the hotel is not great, but we knew that going in. It is about a ten minute walk to the beach (straight ahead). On the way to the beach is "mall" on Avenue Isle Verde. Just be careful, when walking with small children, of the metal spikes that line the sidewalk and the entrance to the parking lot to the mall (another construction decision that I fail to understand). Staff: This is the most perplexing part of this hotel and of Puerto Rican people in general. I don't know if it's an aloofness, language miscommunication, or intelligence issue. But, the service was not very attentive, and mistakes and misinformation permeated our stay. Examples: Me: "Do you have to pay for children on the bus?" Front Desk: "I don't know, I don't have any children;" and Me: "What have you heard about the Asian restaurant next door in the Holiday Inn?" Front Desk: "I have never eaten there;" and Me: "What time does the pool bar close (question asked at 3:40 pm)?" Pool Bar Bartender taking my order: "3 pm;" and Me: "How long does it take to get to the Condado using the bus (a 3 mile trip)?" Bellhop: "Over one hour." Me: "But, it's such a short trip." Bellhop: "The bus makes lots of stops." There are many more examples. A waitress in the Outback Steakhouse (inside the hotel) was rude and incompetent. She brought the wrong order, took 20 minutes to bring our dessert, and made us wait another 20 minutes to get the check. All of this without an apology. Also, the service at the fast food restaurants in the mall is not only very slow (1/2 hour just to get some chicken at Church's), but also inept. The orders there and everywhere were wrong every time. The casino staff was also not very pleasant and unprofessional. A blackjack dealer misdealt a hand and the Pit Boss just got rid of the cards instead of making things right. No "sorry" or even an acknowledgment that the players were wronged. Same situation at El San Juan Hotel. The blackjack table decides to change the minimum from $10 to $25. So what do they do? Grandfather the players already gambling? Of course not. Just kick everyone off of the table! Be aware, that even though English may be an official language of the territory, and many service people allegedly "speak and understand English," Spanish is what's spoken in Puerto Rico. Learn some Spanish before you go. Misc. Notes: There is an excellent supermarket called Pueblo, just a short walk from the hotel. When leaving the hotel, make a sharp right and walk along the highway exit and then make a left at the corner. Pueblo is great for stocking your fridge with drinks, lunch foods, and snacks. Why pay the high prices of the hotel? Get a small, soft cooler and you will be able to keep your drinks cold while at the pool or beach. The Asian restaurant next door at the Holiday Inn is excellent. It's a bit pricey, but the food is great and the service, unlike everywhere else, was outstanding. Also, Metropol, for authentic Puerto Rican and Cuban food, is nice. It has a kid's menu, is reasonable, and you eat among locals, which is great. While nothing fancy, it is worth a visit. Make a right on Avenue Isle Verde and walk down about 1/2 mile, just past the cock fighting arena. Conclusion: As I stated earlier, this may be our last trip to San Juan. It is an easy flight and inexpensive, which makes it attractive. But, we were in search for beauty. I've been told that Puerto Rico has some beautiful beaches. Well, those beaches do not exist in San Juan. The beach on the Condado is not nice. Isle Verde Beach, which many guidebooks say is beautiful, is not that at all. Isle Verde beach has lots of pollution in its sands. When we were there, there was an influx of seaweed. While I'm sure the seaweed isn't always present, the debris from the sand doesn't go away. The beach is mediocre because of the debris. I'm hoping that in other parts of Puerto Rico, Rincon for example, the beaches are as they are pictured and described in the guidebooks. That is why, if I come back to Puerto Rico, while I may fly into San Juan, I'm renting a car and searching for some real beauty, because the beauty is not in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Chicagojill
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls' trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed for 5 nights at the Embassy Suites, as many other hotels are in renovation. With four women, it was a wise choice! The hotel is centrally located for the beach and activities of Isla Verde. Parking costs $10 a day, which is economical for the area. Cabs are also readily available for all of the sites. We were checked in early, despite arriving over an hour before official check-in time, to a good sized room. The room was very clean and serviced well each day, including special requests. We did find one roach during the stay. The front desk staff and bar staff were very friendly. The hotel has a great pool, which has music on the weekends. Unfortunately, the cocktail and food service at the pool is a bit irregular and ends at 3pm, which is disappointing. The free happy hour, standard with Embassy Suites, was quite a draw, and we had to wait in a long line for drinks. Thankfully, they were more than accomdating for two drinks when we reached the front of the line! ;-) The free breakfast is too early for vacation travelers, but we did manage to hit it one day and were very satisfied. For a smaller group, I may stay somewhere else, but with a large group, I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caymanfvr
Reviews.Content: Convinietly located near the airport and in a nice area. Lots of restaurants close by. It is about 5 minute walk from the beach too. The staff were all courtious and helpful. Room was very clean although it needed a fresh coat of paint. The breakfast buffet was excellent and convinient. We enjoyed having Outback restaurant in the lobby too! The pool area was nice with waterfalls etc. There was a gym and the hotel also had a coin laundry facility... very nice for people staying there longet than a few days... We would definitely stay there again- a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Embassy Suites and Staff”
Reviews.Author: iloveny5680
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Embassy Suites. Although our first night there they were overbooked, they paid for us to stay at the Courtyard Marriot up the road. They provided us with a huge room with a balcony on the beach. The next day we arrived back at the Embassy Suites. They were so kind to us. They upgraded our room for free. They brought a fruit basket, free drink tickets, and gambling vouchers. The staff was wonderful and so are the amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Great for short family stay”
Reviews.Author: FancyDay
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 2 nights after spending 6 days on Culebra Island, PR. After enjoying the spartan accommodations there, our 2 bedroom/2bath suite (plus living room) at the Embassy Suites seemed luxurious. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bath products were higher quality than you find at most chain hotels. All the staff were genuinely accommodating. The free breakfast, although not spectacular, offered lots of choices and quantity. Skip the complimentary "happy hour" -- the appetizers were popcorn and snack mix. The pool is great for kids. The beach is an easy five minute walk. Even though the airport is just minutes away, the noise isn't offensive outside -- and inside I never heard a thing. I can't imagine staying here unless you are with children or at a business function (even though there's a casino). And I wouldn't choose it for a Puerto Rico "destination" hotel. But its a great stopover for a few days on your way in or out of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: binkiy
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here; stayed next door at the Holiday Inn; but we walked over the Embassy to visit the casino and the Outback steakhouse. This hotel was very nice from what we experienced. The lobby is a lush garden and very inviting. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: outlaw06
Reviews.Content: we were at the embassy suites in isla verde from march 8-11. The hotel its self was decent.. .nothing spectacular, but no problems. We paid 359 per night... for a suite which housed 5 people easily. There were two full sized beds in the bedroom and one pullout sofa in the living roon. The breakfast buffet is a must with eggs, bacon, sausage, and all the fixins. there is even an omlette bar where you pick your own ingredients. The hotel is very close to the airport, but i didn't here one plane go by, even though i can see the planes from my room window. The cost for taxi from the airport to the hotel should be 12 bucks... unless you have 4+ people. the cost to cab it to old san juan was 20 one way. The hotel pool was good... but there was no beach that it leads onto. The hotel is about 1.5 blocks from the beach..... so no direct access from the hotel. The hotel did have a casino which i didn't use much so i can't comment on it... but drinks are free if you play at the tables for some length of time. There was an outback steakhouse in the hotel which was good to see after a very disapointing outing at a local restaurant where i tried th Mofongo.... which believe me sounds a lot better than it is. One thing that i recommend everyone to do before they leave is goto the rainforest and stop by the Bio Bay in Frajoda(sp). We went there on a boat with 16 in the group. When we first got there it wasn't much of a site.. until you get into the water....I'm not much of a swimmer, but i put on a life vest and ventured into the darkness ... the further away from the boat i got.. the more intense the glo was...it was one of the most AMAZING things that i have ever seen. Make sure you go there late at night... We didn't actually jump into the lake until about 11:00 pm. But it is a must for anyone coming to PR. They have other bio bay's around PR, but the one in Frajoda was the closest... and we were able to go there right after the rainforest. The water was said to have 4x the salt concentration as the ocean, so not much was living in the lake besides the glo organisms. A plus for you ladies... and men also is that your skin will be baby soft after you wash off the salt remains. by the way .. the photos above are pretty good representations of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Rewarding experience”
Reviews.Author: Decorte
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in early March 2007. This hotel delivers on what it advertises. Friendly check-in; attractive lobby area, very nice suites, outstanding service, a very generous breakfast and happy hour, a fine pool and spa, and a fun casino. Five minute ride from the airport, two blocks from the beaches. Plenty of restaurants in the area. Easy car rental nearby and convenient to the major highways. The Internet access was nice, too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: wookjenk
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Close to the beach, good breakfast, happy hour etc. Stay here, you'll enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: peamomma
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at this hotel. We were wary, since it wasn't a beachfront hotel, and we have had bad experiences with Puerto Rico hotels before (El Conquistador, in particular). We were thoroughly delighted with the hotel, the staff, the amenities, etc. The staff went out of their way to make sure that our stay was pleasant. The hotel is a typical Embassy Suites, with a 2 room suite setup (living area and bedroom). The free buffet breakfast was substantial (hot and cold foods), free happy hour each night (a variety of wine, beer, liquor), free wireless internet throughout the hotel areas (including pool), free business services (fax, internet, etc). They even have a kiosk in the lobby to print out your boarding passes. The hotel is an easy 5 minute walk to the beach. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Staff”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJohn
Reviews.Content: The staff really needs to be reconsidered. While I was staying at the Embassy Suites, I had all sort of trouble and they either kept me ignored or came up with a temporary solution until I left. That is not the way to treat a guest.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Embassy Suites San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MikeyNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites from February 12, 2007 to February 16, 2007. We chose the Embassy Suites based on reviews on Trip Advisor. Thank you! Before we finished stepping into our room on our day of arrival, the telephone was ringing to make sure our room was satisfactory and to again welcome us to Puerto Rico and to the hotel. The staff could not do enough for you, every one of the staff made you feel welcomed. The room was cleam, the bed so very comfortable. The hotel is a short taxi ride to Old San Juan and many attractions, and 2 blocks from the beach and a few minutes to the airport. You may choose to stay at a more fancier hotel, but you will not get better service or treated better. We were working on our return plans before we landed back at home.

Reviews.Title: “ghost?”
Reviews.Author: agentcooper11
Reviews.Content: great hotel loved the location inbetween the airport and the cruise port.the room was really clean and the coffee maker,but room 332 is kinda spooked

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect from a 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: keirao
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites Hotel is an average hotel, with some nice features for the $$. I usually like to stay at more upscale resorts, but this was a last minute trip booked with friends. Pros: -This hotel is literally 5 minutes from the airport so the cab fare is about 12 dollars -Breakfast is inlcuded and they have fruit, omlettes, cereal, french toast, eggs, etc. It is also served until 10am, which is nice. -Drinks at the pool are cheap -Free cocktails from 5:30-7:30 -Very close to El San Juan Hotel Cons: -Casino is TINY -Noise from the airport is slightly annoying while at the pool -Maid service was erratic (one day they didn't come until 6pm) and we sent them away because we all needed to shower and get ready for dinner. -Bathrooms were definitely in need of an upgrade (lots of chipped tile/grout) Overall this is a perfect place if you want an inexpenseive hotel with some free drinks. I would not stay here again unless I was on a budget. There's much more going on at the El San Juan Hotel and it's much nicer. We did overpay for this hotel since we went over MLK weekend, but it served it's purpose. Pool area was nice, drinks were great, and people were warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkAndrea
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend at this hotel and were very impressed. In fact, we booked it because of other positive reviews we found on TripAdvisor! The staff here were very accomodating and friendly. I requested a room above the 4th floor facing the pool and they switched us right away. The hotel is a short walk to the beach and although Isla Verde doesn't have too many attractions, we found this to be a good base. Everything was clean and the breakfast buffet had a good selection. The only thing I wasn't impressed with in this area of San Juan was the high price of taxis. This obviously had nothing to do with the hotel; but I was surprised that a 5 minute drive from the airport cost us $10. A short drive to Old San Juan (about 8-10 minutes away) was $20. We tried to negotiate but were told by the hotel reception that different cabs charge different rates and that's just the way it is. Other than that, though, we had a fabulous stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfying”
Reviews.Author: fdwt994
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights prior to our cruise (1/10-1/13/07.) We were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious, the pool was very large and beautifully landscaped, there was a hot tub and also a kiddie pool. The free breakfast was good and plentiful, and the nightly Manager's cocktail party was a bonus (and no, they don't skimp on the alcohol and you can order a couple drinks at a time.) We appreciated having the Outback steakhouse on site, and evening entertainment wasn't loud enough to be heard in the bedrooms but you could hear it a little in the front t.v. room of your suite. There are plenty of places to eat and shop nearby such as Pizza Hut, Mi Casita, Burger King, Ponderosa, Walgreens and Pueblo grocery store. We were able to catch a city bus two blocks away that took us all the way to Old San Juan for $1.50 each way. The bus was clean and modern with A/C. There was also free internet access, but it was pretty slow. This brings me to probably my only complaint: there is an additional resort fee added to all bookings this year for "high speed internet, pool toys"...etc. There were no pool toys and as I mentioned the internet connection was very slow. While I don't need these things, I think I shouldn't have to pay for them if they don't even exist. Nonetheless, this place is still a very good value and much nicer than a typical, boring, cookie-cutter type hotel. We would stay here again if we visit San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from a week stay.”
Reviews.Author: Nikkirmo
Reviews.Content: Well my husband and I just got back from Puerto Rico and we stayed an entire week at the Embassy Suites. I've read other reviews before I left and they are fairly accuriate. It is very close to the airport and while at the pool you do occasionall hear them; however I never heard them in my room. ( We were in room 736). We did hear music in the outer-room in the evenings, but back in the bedroom we didn't hear it. We had a view of the ocean ( as much as you can from that hotel in between buildings). We didn't go to the beach near by until the last evening. We walked there, it is a block away and you do have to cross a busy street, but it wasn't bad. It was nice to have the breakfast at the hotel, you didn't have to drive around and worry about that part of our trip. We did go to the happy hour a few times and that was very enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel and if we ever return to Puerto Rico I'd be happy staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy suites offers good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: traveler69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December '06 for a one night pre-cruise visit. We booked online well in advance and got an excellent rate of $150.00 a night. The room was spacious and clean, the front desk personnel were friendly and accomodating, and the free extras result in a superlative value in this relatively expensive neighborhood. You can take the money you save and make a donation in the on-site casino. There is a manager's reception/ happy hour offering free drinks and snacks for 1 1/2 hours each evening and a free breakfast is also offered each day. The breakfast is served buffet-style with eggs made to order, bacon and sausage, an assortment of pastries, hot and cold cereals, bagels, muffins, breads, fruit, juices, coffee and tea. If two people had to pay for the extras independently they would surely cost as much or more than the entire cost of the room. The beach is a few short blocks away. There is a wondeful outdoor pool that was never crowded. There is also an Outback Steakhouse in the hotel and the prices are very reasonable. The Ritz-Carlton, which is just a few blocks away, offers a Friday night seafood buffet that can't be beat. It's a bit pricey but well worth the expenditure. Another excellent restaurant in the neighborhood is the Metropol; also just a few blocks away. They serve Cuban, Caribbean and Puerto Rican cuisine in a family-friendly atmosphere at reasonable prices. Taxis are readily available and when we were ready to head to the cruise pier, there were several van-size taxis waiting there which were able to accomodate our entire party and all our luggage. We will definitely stay here again as the cost is low and the value is high. Discerning travelers will appreciate the friendly service and overall value offered by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: discerningtexans
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful even letting us check in before check-in time. We couldn't get our boarding passes to print and the on-duty manager took time from his duties to print it for us. The hot morning breakfasts were filling and delicious and the evening cocktails were plentiful and above average. The hotel is beautiful and the pool area is outstanding. We had a bathroom leak and the repairman was there practically before we got off the phone with the manager. However there was a strong sewer smell in the bathroom which never went away. Sound carries in this hotel. Doors would shut with a bang. Loud music blared most of the night which made sleeping difficult. The manager explained that it was because it was the holiday season but that didn't make our lack of sleep any easier to take. Still it is possible that the music was a holiday thing so willing to give them the benefit of the doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain esp for Families; Consistent Quality; One caution”
Reviews.Author: msm
Reviews.Content: We've chosen this property for 3 visits in the last five years for all the things you expect from an Embassy Suites--the two-room suite, the substantial breakfast buffet and the consistent quality. While this isn't the top luxury resort of the area (for that, try the nearby Wyndham), the hotel is clean, efficiently-run, well maintained and in a great (but not beachfront) location. The free-form pool with waterfall is attractive, spotless and seldom crowded. There's a separate kiddie pool and hot tub. For the same price as most of the hotels in this area, you get the extra space and the breakfast. If location is the key, you have it here. The hotel is minutes away from the airport (taxi fee of $10) and a 2 short block walk to one of San Juan's nicest beaches--Isla Verde. For dining, an Outback in the hotel lobby offers reasonably priced meals while the neighborhood includes numerous fast food restaurants (McDonalds, Wendys, Burger King, Pizza Hut, Ponderosa, etc). The other hotels in walking distance provide other fine dining options, including a Palm Steakhouse and a Ruth Chris. The adjacent Holiday Inn offers an expensive but creative Italian restaurant. There are some neighborhood bars as well. You will also find a major grocery store around the east side and a Walgreens on the west. A Dollar car rental is located on the same street. We appreciate having the two rooms for the flexibility that gives us with family members who like different sleeping times or different movies etc. As with all ES locations, the room includes two TVs, phones, a microwave and refrigerator. We always choose a 2-bed room but that means two double beds, not two queens, which can be cramped for some couples. The rooms with 2-beds are a bit larger in floor space. For the largest rooms, ask for the -11 number or the -17, as in 617 or 611. The bathroom is a reasonable size. Each suite has a small closet but not much drawer space. The casino and nightly entertainment can be loud (the hotel has an open atrium design) if you go to sleep before midnight, especially if someone sleeps in the living room. Request a room on an upper floor away from the front entrance (again the -11 room is a good choice). The grounds are minimal, really just the pool area. But it's always been enough for us. We usually spend part of the day at the pool and the other walking the beach. You can take a taxi to Old San Juan for $16 or a public bus for about $1 each way. My only negative is a problem I had with my "loyalty" points (Hilton Honors). Because I booked the this reservations at Cheaptickets rather than Hilton.com, I was not awarded any points for this stay. The price wasn't any less so I really lost out. I was disappointed that neither Cheaptickets or Hilton tell you that you only get the points if you book on the Hilton site. Overall, this is great mid-range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Met and exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! Very clean with an excellent staff. Didn't hear any airport noise. Didn't hear anyone on the first floor. Location is good if you need to go to the drug store and pick up some last minute items. Only about 3 block away. Loved the Happy Hour. Loved having an Outback in the hotel. We used for a pre-cruise. If we ever go back to San Juan, we will definitely use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but EXTREMELY loud weddings, parties all night”
Reviews.Author: denmosh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful expect that they have weddings, parties,etc. on the 1st floor and the music was extremely loud. My mom and I stayed here before a cruise and had a really tough time sleeping. The music blasts through the hotel until at least 3 - 4am. We also had a problem checking in. We had requested 2 beds and when we checked in around 6pm they were sold out so we were forced to share a bed. Not a huge deal for us but I could see it being a pain for familes that weren't planning on all cramming into the same bed. The breakfast was wonderful, the service was great, the pool was amazing but becuase of the loud muisc throughout the night I wouldn't stay here again. If you plan to party all night this would be the place to be. Or, if the hotel could stop the music at an earlier hour I would be willing to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fabulous Service, They know Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: KarRac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before a cruise and made a reservation for another hotel for our post cruise because Embassy did not have availability. Well when we checked into the "other" hotel to simply relax and enjoy our last days of vacation, we were checked into dirty rooms, yes more than one and not just dirty, beds made but the sheets had not been changed from the previous guest we were moved to another room and found the same problem. We called Embassy to check if there were available rooms and thank the good lord above they had a room for us. We checked out of the dirty run down hotel and happily waited for a clean room at the Embassy Suites. We had dinner and had the pleasure of being served by the loviest woman that had such gracious and hospitible skills and made us feel welcomed. Later in our room a knock at the door, room service delivering a beautiful plate of sliced fruit with a large bow and an apology for the inconvenience that we had experienced....At Another Hotel!....This was perfect and such a classy touch on what already measured up to be one great hotel. The front desk staff was top notch and I look forward to our next trip to Puerto Rico and another stay at the Embassy Suites Hotel. Thank you for everything...See you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILndGirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, the staff was great. The bar was closed my first day out at the pool but once it was open that kicked up the trip a noch. The hotel is close to the airport and local bus to old san juan. I had a great time, I would recommend and will be returning soon. TT New Hampshire

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flypinay19
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect!! It was beautiful, very clean, very classy! The 2 hour 5 pm - 7 pm Manager's Happy Hour w/ FREE ALL YOU DRINK was EXCELLENT!!! There is an Outback Steakhouse on the first floor of the hotel!!! There is a 2 block walk to a very nice beach is around PLENTY of fast food and tourist shopping places.. Well worth the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy at in 10”
Reviews.Author: maddog59
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 5 night stay at the Embassy suites, stayed on the 3rd flr facing the pool, nice and quiet at night. Things could not have been better. Great cooked to order breakfast everyday and the 2hr managers cocktail hour was super. Drinks a plenty...We wondered across the street to the Holiday Inn to eat in J.H.Yee's Asian Bistro. This was the BEST asian food we have ever eaten. We have eaten in New York's and San Francisco's chinatowns this was better. Service was great and the waiter staff very attentive. It was so good we went back again before leaving for home. I highly recommend the peking duck, it was a 10 plus. Ask for Zayvette....Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Our PR Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: amazingrace214
Reviews.Content: I've been reading reviews at least 3-4 times a week since I booked this hotel in April 2006! We stayed here from Oct. 6-8. I am extremely satisfied with my stay here and paying attention to the reviews was well worth it. It is a 3-4 min ride from the Airport. Lobby is beautiful with a rainforest atmosphere. The atrium style setting of trees and small waterfalls is very relaxing. Pool in the back is nice with a jacuzzi and kids pool. And although the highway is behind the pool, it didn't bother us at all. Its kind of hidden by all of the trees. Also, we only heard like 2 airplanes our whole stay-but after living in New York, who cares! Breakfast is just as other reviews said; satisfying with all breads, juices, tea, coffee, cereals, fruits, and regular fare, as well as made to order omelets, waffles and pancakes. Yes, definitly get there between 7:30-8:30 because after that it does get crowded-towards the end, you may not even be able to find a seat, and there are plenty of seats! We ate enough every day last until dinner. Internet is $9.95 per day, so if you need to use it, make sure you understand it will be charged to your room or credit card. Live music nightly and just a walk to a local Ponderosa, Mi Casita & the other resort/hotels on the strip, plus a grocery store. We stocked up on water and fruits. Having the fridge and microwave is a big plus. For your El Yunque tour, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Rafael from PR 4 LESS. Ask Bo, or the other managers/staff to hook you up with him.
