He really enjoys taking people through the island, and if you're hungry after, he'll take you to a real authentic PR roadside stand/restaurant to eat. That was one of the greatest parts of our trip. I will definitly return to Embassy Suites. Not only are the rooms/accomodations great for the price, but it felt like coming home every night. We moved over to the Ritz Carlton after our 2 nights here and although the Ritz is beautiful, probably best for honeymoon/anniversary vacations, the atmosphere is kind of stuffy with a lot of business people. Embassy has a very relaxed feel. There are a lot of families that stay here, and it is also a spot for locals on the weekends. The staff is not afraid to talk to you, and smile at you, and for that we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “It had everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: LiamsMommy
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everybody who took the time to review this place. I read all of your reviews and took a lot of the advice I found here. My husband and our 3 year old son stayed at this property from October 6th - October 11th and we had a great time. We arrived way before check-in time and she said she had some rooms available but I told her that I wanted the quietest room available so my son could sleep. We were given room 722 which was in a corner overlooking the pool and the expressway. Some of the negatives that were mentioned in previous reviews are true. Yes - The hotel is located next to the airport but we didn't hear the planes too much when we were in our room. You can hear the planes land from the pool area but it didn't bother us too much. Yes - The pool area is right next to an off-ramp of a highway but it's camoflauged by palm trees. We live in a city so we are used to the sounds of cars going by. Yes - The hotel has a salsa singer every night from 6:00pm on and the atrium amplifies the noise. We could hear her singing on the 7th floor in our sitting area but when we went into the bedroom and closed the door we couldn't hear it anymore. For the price and everything you get we were really happy with the hot and cold selections at breakfast and we LOVED the happy hour. I'm guessing that during the busy season the lines could get REALLY long but it wasn't that way for us. On two nights we got Outback Steakhouse takeout and had dinner in the bar area while enjoying the happy hour. We are not really beach people but we walked to it twice. I would say that it's a three block walk and you do have to cross one busy street but that cars will stop. The Pueblo supermarket was a five minute walk and was just like the markets at home but even nicer. As there's a mini-fridge and microwave in the room you can really stock up. A lot of reviews mentioned Mi Casita restaurant my husband liked it but I liked the Metropol restaurant more. (I think my husband liked that Mi Casita was less expensive) The pool area itself was nicely landscaped and laid out but it could have been cleaner. My son is an early riser so often we'd be down at the pool at 7:00am and there would still be debris from the previous evening still outside. That's my one gripe about the property. One day we had to wait an hour for fresh pool towels. Our family had a wonderful time and agreed that a 5 or 6 day stay was a perfect amount of time as the hotel is on the smallish side. Hope this helps! Enjoy your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: RONNIENJ4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 9 days the last week of August 2006. We really enjoyed everything about this Hotel and the staff well very accomodating. The complimentary breakfast was great and the Happy Hour every evening was very enjoyable. We only had the chance to use the pool once as we drove around the island to enjoy some great beaches. The pool was beautiful. I also liked that we were able to take towels from the pool area to use for the day when we went out for the day. Can't wait to come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a group!”
Reviews.Author: brooklynlady
Reviews.Content: The stay at Embassy was perfect for us! We were 12 people and needed a nice location and nice price. The hotel is walking distance to the beach, $20 to Old San Juan and has a beautiful pool. The breakfast is included-but is not that great....there's also a happy hour which makes for a fun activitiy after being in the sun all day. Definitely check out old San Juan. The water club Wet Bar is fun for dancing and drinks since it is on the rooftop of the Water Club hote. Also, check out Baru for an AMAZING meal...Parrot Club and Dragonfly are pretty good too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jerseyguy713
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Embassy Suites at both legs of a cruise. We were greeted by a very friendly staff that quickly had our bags in our room. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Cabs are waiting outside so there was no waiting for when we decided to go into Old San Juan for brunch. (One of the staff reccomended the Parrot Club and the food and service was great.) The pool area is pretty big and clean. We had dinner at the Outback which is located on the property. If we have the chance to return to Puerto Rico again, we will deffinitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Suites”
Reviews.Author: Yvey
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families. Large, clean suites. This hotel was recently remodeled and it shows. Amazing free breakfast buffet (but crowded). The breakfast staff were extemely accomdating with special meal requests. The best free buffet (expect ihop food, not continental breakfast). Wonderful grounds, good location. Try Mi Casita restaurant (3 blocks from hotel) for good PR food. This hotel is definitely for families, expect lots of children everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: eltey718
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and enjoyed every minute. The breakfast is delicious and the complimentary drinks in the evening were great. The rooms were comfortable and the staff was very attentive and helpful. I am more of a resort on the beach person, but the walk from the hotel to the beach was not bad at all. It is located right next to the highway and the airport is very close, but you will not even notice. The pool area is gorgeous and the casino is small but it serves it purpose. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmmm...Free Breakfast! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Embassy Suites from June 26th-30th. It was great! Upon our arrival the bellmen were great and greeted us as soon as our taxi pulled up to the door. Since we were unable to check in until 4pm, we asked the bellmen where to eat and they recommended a great restaurant in walking distance called Mi Casita. Great food but long wait during lunch rush. We then walked to the beach which is only 2 blocks away and not a bad walk at all since in Puerto Rico they stop for you when you go to cross the street. The Beach was clean and gorgeous. On Isla Verde Av. you can find some bars and meet up with the local people or hop on the bus to get a cheap tour of town. Also if you want you can take the bus right into Old San Juan for just .75 versus $19.50 one way per person taxi drive. Check in was fast and easy. Rooms were cleaned very efficently and had a fridge, microwave, sink for cleaning (aka kitchenette). Great room with King size bed and sofa bed. Hotel provided a great breakfast in the morning that was so filling it kept us full well into mid-day. The Pool was great well maintained and staffed. There is also a massage table at the pool and the prices are rather cheap. This was a great hotel and believe me I've stayed in my share of crap traps. Definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice but has issues”
Reviews.Author: davdell0812
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Sat night last June. It is about 1/2 mile and 10 minute taxi ride from the San Juan airport. First off I will mention that the hotel is nice and very clean. It has an attractive lobby and pool (you are near the airport but the noise of landing jets really isn't an issue). However this hotel is not without problems. The hotel does offer free internet access (as mentioned on their website) and there are three free interent kiosks near the check in desk. However, at least one of them was always out of order and the other two were constantly being used. My biggest complaint with the hotel is their handling of crowds. As mentioned we stayed there on a Saturday evening and the hotel was extremely crowded. The receptionist informed us that Saturdays are always busy because the "pre-cruise" crowd. (Apparently, a good number of customers stay in this hotel one night prior to their sailing date.) While the managers reception and cooked to order breakfast have always been some of the best things about the Embassy Suites we've stayed at - these are poorly handled at this one. First off the manager's reception. This hotel has a rule that there is a 2 drink maximum per bar visit. This is a problem if you have small children and your spouse has to stay with them while you wait in line for the drinks. The bar tender told me that I could come back for additional drinks, but the line was long and the wait was about 20 minutes. Also, the drinks are served in small palstic cups which don't tend to last very long. I think that, with additional bar tenders and a little more efficiency (larger cups??) the wait time could be drastically reduced. The same thing happened at breakfast. Very long lines (especailly if you wanted cooked to order foods). The wait was again about 20 minutes and finding a place to eat was a challenge. Finally, we asked for late check out on Sunday morning. Being an Hilton Honors member I've never been denied this request. However, this time I was. After having to prod for a reason why this request wasn't honored, the management finally told me that they had another large group checking in and needed to get all of the rooms ready. They did offer to store my luggage but we needed to do laundry so that wasn't much help. We tend to stay at Embassy Suites when we travel. While I might go back to this one, it was the most disappointing of all of the Embassy Suites properties that we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Juan by Far!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelB30
Reviews.Content: Originally had planned to spend the week at the Hilton, however after 4 days of putting up with rude service and a room with no view, next to a construction site (building started at 4:30 am each day â€“ Mon-Sat), we checked out and went to the Embassy Suites. What a difference. We were paying $295 for a Villa at the Hilton, plus they force you to pay a 10% â€œresort feeâ€� and a 9% tax. The resort fee is for maid service, bellboy service and pool upkeep. Never heard of a hotel charging for these items. Embassy was only $175 per night and a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in PR”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at the Embassy Suites from May 6th to the 8th, 2006. I have stayed at the Embassy several times on my way to St. Lucia, or before sailing on a cruise, the staff are friendly and accomodating. Outback Steakhouse ( which is located in the hotel) has great food and service , walked a short distance to the Intercontinental Hotel and had dinner at Ruth Chris Steak House, Shopping at Plaza Las Americas was great and just a short taxi ride from the Embassy. Would definetly stay here again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back Again!! Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night, 8 day stay at the suites. From 4/21 to 4/28. Service was great after 1 initial problem of the room location, the staff is very helpful and accomodating, especially the head housekeeping staff, Bellhops and Liz at the front desk . The rooms are clean and well kept. The hotel staff is very helpful with any needs you have, even in making suggestions on what to do or where to go. The Embassy Grill located in the lobby of the hotel has excellent food and pricing was not bad either. Coming from NY I thought the meals was reasonably priced. Even room service was excellent. Many consider the rooms pricing, but with the inclusion of an amazing breakfast each morning and nightly managers reception including free drinks, it is well worth it. The lobby is beautiful with trees, greenery, water, the feeling of being outdoors. The pool area is clean and well maintained, pool towels available and even food service. Only complaint was the Outback restaruant located in the hotel a bit pricey for food that was nothing to rave about, especially when you ask for well done steak and it is totally pick, and then you are further insulted when someone comes out from the kitchen and tells you that is the color it is suppose to look, it really is cooked. You would think they would offer you at least a soda on the house. Service there was also very poor. Too many difference people servicing on table. Also long wait to get in and no reservations taken. Beach 1 1/2 blocks away, very clean, quite and beautiful. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: stangluva
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for about 6 days including the Easter weekend. They hotel is definitely a treat to the eyes. My kids were mesmorized by the Atrium. It's like a small rainforest with bridges and creeks, shrubbery and trees. I even think there was a coqui hiding in there somewhere, although that could have been a hidden speaker putting out coqui sounds. I like the fact that they had a small kiosk area adjacent to the main entrance where they had a few stations for internet access - 3 around a small tower, 2 at desks. The only problem was that at times 3 of the stations had technical problems so I ended up waiting a few times to get online - not a big deal. Our party had a 2 bedroom suite and another 1 bedroom suite and the hotel was happy to put us in adjacent suites. Although we had requested non-smoking, I think we got smoking suites because both had ashtrays and the 1 bedroom had a strong smoke/cleaner product smell when we checked in. Either we got used to it or the cleaner worked because we didn't notice it after the 1st day. The suites were very nice and clean, and the mattresses looked new and were very comfortable. Our suites were thoroughly cleaned promptly in the AM every day - enough so that I felt compelled to leave a tip for the attendants - which I rarely do. Other than the cable cutting out a few times, we had no issues during our stay. The free cook-to-order daily breakfast was really good. Just be sure not to get down there too close to the ending time, otherwise the line can be really long, but you will get served. Also, although the cooks were good, just check your order as they had a tendency to get the orders mixed up. They had no issue correcting it for us quickly though. The nightly manager's reception (free drinks) was fantastic. Yes, the drinks were a little watered-down, but it was top shelf and you could get 2 at a time and go back as much as you wanted. Also, if you just ask nicely, the bartender will make your drink stronger. The Embassy restaurant food was OK and decently priced. The onsite OutBack was nice, but they messed up our orders (does nobody know what well-done means?!?!) They did however, reduce our bill and give us some free deserts to make up for it. The pool was fantastic and huge - yes, the airport and highway is right behind the back wall, but it was in no way a nuisance unless you are anal about such things. I noticed a few planes landing, but the only time I was bothered was the 1 time a plane took off from that closest runway. Also, there was no device to turn on the bubbles in the jacuzzi. You can also order food and drinks from the pool area. The beach is 2 long blocks (maybe 1/10 th mile) away and you have to cross 1 busy street. I am from NY so crossing busy streets is no big deal for me, but just be careful and you'll be fine - not that big a deal. The staff was really friendly and helpful and gave us tips on nightlife and sight-seeing. We ended up using the Avis hotline to rent a minivan - Charlie's and other local rental places were all out of minivans. NOTE: be very wary of using directions from the hotel front desk to get around. They were very lacking and half-done and we got repeatedly lost trying to find our way to Old San Juan and a little lost getting to El Yunque rainforest (great idea and you don't have to walk the trails if you don't want to). The good thing about staying at this hotel is that if you get lost, just follow any sign that says "aeropuerto" and you'll find your way back. I really wished I had brought my portable GPS with me. All in all, this hotel is definitely worth using again if I go back to PR. It was a little pricey, but depending on your party size, you save a good $50-$75 a day with the free breakfast and drinks. The 1 complaint I have is that you have to pay for parking even if you are a guest ($10 per day), which annoyed me being that the rooms weren't cheap. It's close enough to everything, the service was good, the place is really nice. Can't go wrong with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Just back-Definitely planning to return”
Reviews.Author: sheila5199
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay and already planning to return. The hotel's common areas-the lobby, pool etc. are lovely and well appointed. The rooms, while nothing spectacular to look at, are spacious, clean and comfortable. As other reviews stated the breakfast and daily manager's reception were abundant. The staff was curteous and friendly. They responded to requests for things like a glass of ice and bandaids very propmtly. We had absolutely no problems with unpleasant smells or excessive noise. There was also a small casino that had a nightly bingo game with a $100 prize as well the usual table games and slots. Although the hotel has both a restaurant and an Outback on premises there are many places to eat in the immediate vacinity. There is a very wide range of restaurants from fast food to American casual dining chains, to more expensive restaurants as well as local cuisine (try both the Metropol and Mi Casita for native fare). The hotel is a short walk from the beach and the neighborhood seemed both safe and busy. One day we took the local bus to Old San Juan and another day we rented a car for a trip to the rainforrest and Bacarardi Distillery. Speaking of car rentals-we bypassed the national chains and rented from a cheaper local place called Charlie's in walking distance of the hotel Worked out great-picked the car up on our last day and dropped it off that night. They took us to the airport in a van. Overall-great time-can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “noise from lobby”
Reviews.Author: SUPERMOMBX
Reviews.Content: we stayed pre cruise valentines day. they had a party in the atrium and it kept us up all night, plus the noise from the nearby airport. on the positive, the breakfast was good, and the pool was fine

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family returned from our stay in Puerto Rico last week. We would highly recommend this particular hotel. The staff was friendly and very accommodating to all our needs. The rooms were spotless with extremely comfortable beds,pillows and linens. The bathrooms have large, plush towels. You don't have to fight with the shower fixtures to get more than a trickle of hot water...the shower is like being at home. The atrium is lovely...a very tropical feel. We were there with a lot of family members and there was plenty of open areas to get together and meet comfortably. The pool area was beautiful and refreshing with lots of new lounge chairs and tables. There was always enough chairs for our group (and we had a lot of people in our group)...you never had to try and find available lounges. Breakfast was terrific...always hot and fresh and delicious. The manager's reception was always fun. They have a nice selection of mixed tropical drinks and decent snacks. Music is playing most of the time and it gives the feeling of being in a very happy and fun place. If there was one drawback, I would have to say it was the proximity of the airport to the hotel while you are sitting by the pool. That's the only time we noticed the planes and you will definitely notice the planes. Other than that, this hotel is the best and we would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Eden1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde in early February. Since we were traveling with our 2 young kids we loved having the extra room - the kids liked sleeping on the sofa bed. The hotel is a couple short blocks from the beach - a 5 minute walk. We considered the Intercontential hotel, but having a suite was more important than being beachfront. We loved the pool, complimentary breakfast & managers reception nightly. We were on hte 7th floor & could barely hear the live entertainment on the weekend. Go to Pueblo grocery around the corner if you need things. Also, don't miss Mi Casita restaurant. We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel had very nice,big, clean suites. it has its own kitchen and its own room and family room (with a pullout bed). It was very nice and the beach was beautiful too. There are plenty of fish to see (big ones and small ones). The beach is very long and its just beautiful. Its a great get away!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews, I hesitated making my reservation. However, a friend of mine told me that he & his wife had stayed there, and enjoyed it very much. I went ahead and made my reservations for 8 days. I have to say that we were very pleased. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was always clean and comfortable. The breakfast and manager's reception were excellent. The hotel is located in a good area with plenty of places to eat. My favorite place was "Mi Casita", with reasonable prices and excellent food (one block from the hotel). We travel to Ponce, El Yunque, Old San Juan and the Arecibo area by rental car (CharlieCars.com which is a block and a half from the hotel is very reasonable). All of these places were easy to get to from the hotel, since the entrance to to freeway is next to the parking ramp. Isle Verde is beautiful, a great place to enjoy the beach. Safety is not an issue near the hotel or at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - here are some tips for your stay”
Reviews.Author: smartypants01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites San Juan on Jan 12 to Jan 16th. Overall we really enjoyed our stay, and felt we got more than our money's worth. Here are some of the tips I have for anyone considering a stay here: Location in regards to the beach: The location is the tradeoff for the lower price you pay. It is two block to the beach. This is not bad, even for our family traveling with two younger children. We got quite good at packing our bags full so that we didn't forget anything and have to trek back to the hotel. They do rent lounge chairs and umbrellas at the Isla Verde/Carolina beach - $4 for chairs and $11 for umbrellas if I recall correctly. Just make sure to bring towels down to the beach with you (we snagged towels from the pool area and then returned them at the end of the day) The pool: We never heard any traffic from the road that ran behind the pool. We also sat out at the pool each night with our drinks and the traffic was never loud, nor did we have any trouble with the airport noise. Only negative was that the hot tub was broken while we were there. It was hot but no bubbles. Rooms: The key here is to know that some of the rooms are renovated and some are not. Obviously the renovated rooms are better. While we were there the hotel had finished the 7th and 8th floors and were working on the 6th. My suggestion is to ask for the highest floor possible. Also, we never had any problem with airplane noise in our room, nor with the music from the lobby. Again, location may be the key. We were on the 8th floor facing downtown/Old San Juan (overlooking the parking ramp). Breakfast and Manager's Reception: To us, these were the two best reasons to stay at this hotel. The breafast is excellent. They had make to order eggs (fried, omelets, etc), sausage, bacon, fruit, cereal, juice - you name it - and it is free. However, the best deal is the Manager's Reception each evening. From 5:30 to 7:30 they offer free drinks and snacks. You can get two drinks per person at a time, and you can return as many times as you want. The snacks were tortilla chips and salsa, pretzels, and popcorn. I especially enjoyed the strawberry daiquiris! Restaurants: We tried the Outback Steakhouse in the hotel and it was as good as any Outback we've ever eaten at. Yes, the line can be long but if you tell the hostess you are staying at the hotel they usually seat you immediately. We ate there on both a Thursay and a Saturday night and did not wait either night to be seated. Make sure to bring in one of your free drink from the Managers Reception (they always let us do this) and save the money on drinks. The location of the hotel is great as far as local restaurants go. There is just about every fast food chain within two blocks (KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell, Wendys) We also tried Metropol and had the best dinner of our stay, and it only average $15 per person without drinks. There is also a large Peublo grocery store one block away that has all the necessities. Take advantage and stock the room fridge with soda and water - prices at the grocery store seemed to be about the same as mainland groceries. Taxis: We did not rent a car and instead took taxis everywhere. It was about $12 each way for 4 of us to get to and from the airport. It was about $22 each way to get to get to Old San Juan. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again. We felt that for the price it was an excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: FairlawnTravelMom
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here on Jan 25, 2005. It's funny reading the previous reviews because we had a very different impression of the hotel. I found it to be clean, comfortable and quiet. Yes, there is maintenance being done, but the workers are very careful and warn you if you are approaching a freshly painted area. The beds are fine, the sofa bed is a bit uncomfortable and for one night was acceptable. The breakfasts were fine. Great coffee. The nightly manager party was fun with fruity drinks, and standard junk food of chips, pretzels, party mix and popcorn. The pool was lovely, I can't figure out what people were complaining about. I didn't see any missing tiles and I made a point of searching it out. One traveler said the pool area looked like a hurricane hit it. I can't figure that out either it was simply beautiful. Yes, you can hear the planes either taking off or landing depending on the direction of the wind. After awhile you get use to the sound and you don't notice the aircraft noise. The sounds of the kids screaming and yelling drown the noise out. I don't mind the sound of the kids, I simply put on my headphones and listen to music. It's not as bad as previous reviews write and I consider myself very sensitive to unnecessary noise. The beach is exactly 3 blocks away. One long block and two short. If you have very young kids, this might pose a logistical problem because you need to carry your towels/junk and hold onto kids. I have kids 14, 12,9, so it was no problem. Yes,one of the streets is a highly trafficed street and there is no traffic light. But if you enter the crosswalk the cars did stop for us. No, I wouldn't let the kids do this by themselves. I just don't trust them or the drivers. We walked to the beach and went banana boating which can be found in front of the ESJ hotel. At the same time other kids are on the beach and my kids made instant friends. This worked out well for us. The beach is public and you can rent the chairs for $3-$4 per chair depending where you stop. In front of the ESJ hotel the chairs are $3. This place is good for a short stay and the hotel is designed for business travelers. As we saw mostly flight attendants and business people. If you like the hustle and bustle of San Juan this a decent place. If you are looking for a peaceful surrounding and limited night life you should stay a resort such as the Hyatt in Dorado. The hotel staff is very accomodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service, bad location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited San Juan from july 23 through july 30. We had a wonderful time there! The pool was smaller than I had expected, and in the morning it gets a bit crowded. But nonetheless, it was still nice. The manager's reception was decent (they should have varied the snacks a bit) and the continental breakfast was also nice (they should have varied that one too.) The bar downstairs is on the small side, but we never had any trouble ordering drinks. The bartenders were so friendly and very genrous with their alcohol. I always managed to get a buzz on after a drink or two. =) But there are other bars and hotels nearby, so you can frequent those hotel bars too. The service was also excellent. Front desk, gift shop, room service, everyone. We especially liked the doorman who always entertained us while we were waiting for our cab. What I also thought was sweet was how he always remembered us and asked us how we enjoyed the trip or restaurant he recommended for us. Downside of the hotel was its location. The highway is a bit too close by the pool and traffic from the highway is loud when you're in the pool. But you can always visit the pools of other hotels and enjoy a day of tanning there. The beach is also pretty nearby, altho the walk to the beach might be somewhat of a pain It's only about 3~4 blocks but there's a busy street to cross before you get to the beach. Another thing some people might find inconvenient is the small casino. But if you're not in it for the gambling, that shouldnt be a problem. Dont forget to ask for the free grilled turkey and cheese sandwich at the casino! Whenever my boyfriend and I got hungry around 3 or 4 am, we'd walk over to the casino and ask for the free sandwiches. =) You should also go to some nearby restaurants. The raw oyster bar has a 2/1 special on drinks and shrimps and oysters on certain nights, so dont forget to visit there. There's also a mall that's about a 10 minute cab ride from the hotel. If you feel like being more cultural, take the bus into old san juan and look at the beautiful buildings and shop the little shops. There's always some sort of live music concert going on. And if you can, DO visit the El Yunque rainforest. My boyfriend and I climbed all the way to the top which took us about 4 hours to complete. (great exercise) But go early cause it gets dark. (My boyfriend and I almost got lost while on our way down.) Overall, my experience with Embassy Suites was fabulous! Go with a happy,relaxed mind and dont let the little things get to you (traffic by pool, small bar, small casino.) Just enjoy yourselves and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: laislapr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night last Jan 3rd. The service was great, staff was friendly and very helpful. Food at the Grill restaurant was very good. There is an Outback restaurant on site,and also a casino. The room was clean and comfortable, though the carpet had few stains. Not at the beach, but not far either, like a 15 minutes walk. We could stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: klomb4
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay at this hotel since I travel to San Juan for business and I have enjoyed all of my visits. The staff is very courteous, clean rooms, great drinks, decent food, live entertainment (which is really great), close to the beach (about 2 1/2 blocks), and close to many restaurants. It's family friendly also. I am very picky about where I stay and for me to keep coming back it has be pretty good. They also have a business center (2 pcs, 2 printers, and a copy machine) that is for guest use and it is free. Wireless internet access is available for a charge of 9.95 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my honeymoon at the Embassy Suites San Juan Hotel. I loved it! The two room suite was beautiful, the free breakfast buffet was great, the free happy hour was excellent! The staff was friendly and always cleaning. It was in a great location, just a block from the beach and busline. They could book tours for you. I didn't want to leave!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, But Not Near The Beach”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Embassy Suites in mid December. We arrived very early in the morning and our room was waiting for us which we were thankful for since we had a long flight. The Embassy Suites is a great hotel for families, since they offer a free buffet breakfast. The rooms are nice and large, and our room was clean. TV worked ....all was ok The hotel does have a small casino for those who like to gamble. There is also a happy hour, and a nice resturant on site..Outback Steak House??I think??. There are two computers for e-mail or internet service. At this hotel, I think the only draw back for me is that the hotel is a little to far from the ocean. You have to walk several blocks to get to the main street which is Isa Verde. I think parking at the hotel is $16.00 per day. When we were there, we had to walk over to the InterContinental Hotel which is a beautiful hotel on the beach to pick up a tour. By the way there is a nice Holiday Inn in this same area.

Reviews.Title: “chill out you're on vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the suite online right before a major snowstorm hit . short ride from the air port.pool was very nice even though its by a highway it was fine.breakfast was good. evening mgrs reception they were very accomodating. room was fine. staff was very helpful. 2 blocks to beach and small shopping ctr to get some refreshments etc. we were there with 3 kids it was really a positive experience. beat the 12" of snow in ny that wkend before we boarded for a cruise(what a move that was)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, conveniant location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a small casino with live music on the weekends. They have free daily breakfast and cocktail hour which includes chip and salsa. The hotel is 2 blocks from the A5 public bus stop which will take you to old san jaun for 75 cents. It is also 2 blocks away from Pueblo's grocery store, the beach and fast-food chains. The room at the hotel provide refrig and microwave, and the bathroom was definately designed for a woman. The service was okay- some really friendly, some not so much. The excersise room was in decent and well maintained (and free). Over-all I was pretty happy with the hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: pointpetre
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here October 27 to 29. It is an excellent hotel. The atrium is very impressive. The elevator design is geometric/industrial rather than opulent, but they are good elevators with glass wall views as one ascends to the rooms. The suites had aging, slightly dowdy furnishings, but the rooms were quite comfortable and spacious. The shower-tub could use a clothesline, but that is a minor quibble. The happy hour is a pleasant plus with very good drinks. The breakfast is also very good. My friend, Dick, enjoyed the casino and found the rules for blackjack highly favorable in part because of the ability to surrender. He was up $100+ after two nights. The wonderful pool is by a freeway, but it is largely screened by dense palms and the waterfall provides white noise to hush the traffic. The staff bends over backward to provide top-notch service. The fitness center is small, but adequate and a nice retreat. It is a straight two block walk to the magnificent Isla Verde beach. It is a one block walk to reasonable shops and a variety of restaurants. The Carolina/Isla Verde area is a very nice area. We rented a car at the adjacent Holiday Inn (Less than $38 total plus $14.75 for gas). I found the other drivers to be laid back and cortez/simpatico. We drove all over the city and old San Juan. Dick could not walk much. We drove to El Yunque and as far up as we could go by car and thoroughly enjoyed the trip. It is a very short taxi ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, ok”
Reviews.Author: Oscaroni
Reviews.Content: We were three couples who were only staying 1 night in San Juan as we flew to St. Lucia the next day. I had reserved a 2 bedroom suite for our purposes and had expected 1 whole suite. Instead we had two adjacent rooms with 3 beds. Upon arrival to our rooms, one of the two had not been cleaned and the shower curtain was sitting out on the bed. The beds were extremely uncomfortable we thought. The casino was very small and did not have many dealers so it was hard to get on a table even though there weren't even many people there. The free breakfast in the morning was good. We did enjoy it quite a bit. They were in the process of remodeling (painting I think) so the hotel did look a little old and rundown but will improve I suspect. In my opinion, it wasn't worth the near $400 we paid for the room(s). I thought it would be nicer than this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: lienchi
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed at Embassy hotel San Juan from July 25th till Aug 4th of this year and we liked it very much. My teeneage daughter could chat with her friends everyday and my 4 year old could play games at the computer and walk around safely. We enjoyed the pool and the 2 hour free drinks every day. From the location we could go everywhere. The rooms are good,but perhaps with a little change it can be better. My husband liked the bar and the music very much The breakfast was very good and very convenient because you can take everything you want to your room. What we liked very much was the employees at the frontdesk. They did everything we asked them and they made calls for us, very nice. Next time we visit Puerto Rico we want to tay at Embassy again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast & Manager's Reception!”
Reviews.Author: CALosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Embassy on August 25-27 before we left on our cruise. There were positives and negatives. I'll start with the positives: FREE DRINKS! Need I say more? The Manager's Evening Reception is held every night in the main lobby. Each guest is entitled to free drinks and snacks (nachos and popcorn). Also, breakfast is complimentary and we were able to bring it up to our room. All you can eat & drink! The location of the hotel is very close to the airport. We paid $16.00 for a taxi to take all five of us to the hotel. The beach is about two blocks away and there are many restaurants nearby. You can find both American and traditional Puerto Rican food within walking distance. Isla Verde is known as a tourist spot and there are many hotels very close by. (I would recommend the Wyndam. Very nice and classy.) The Embassy has a lively atmostphere and has a salsa band that plays into the late evening. The casino is much smaller than I anticipated though. There is an Outback Steakhouse located inside the lobby area. We noticed many many locals dining there. The pool area is excellent and relaxing. There were, however, a couple of negatives about the Embassy. The hotel has an open atrium where the rooms are located on the sides. Because of the lay out, you could hear the band playing all night long. Also, the rooms had a "musty" smell to them. Other than that, the value was worth the price. If you want to stay in Old San Juan (about 20 minutes away) definitely stay at El Convento. La Fortaleza is within walking distance. Definitely visit El Yunke, but be prepared to walk and get some exercise. Go to Vieques or Culebra if you have the opportunity. I loved Puerto Rico & Reggaeton!

Reviews.Title: “Overall satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy suites with my family. I was overall satisfied with our stay there. The staff was very helpful and the room was kept clean. Initially I was put off by the fact that our room had lots of ANTS. The staff was quick to move us to a different suite when we complained about the infestation. So I wasn't a happy camper when we first arrived. I also couldn't believe that a suite which would sleep 4 of us only had 4 drawers and a tiny closet. The drawers were small. But you know what? by the evening of our first day there we forgot all about that other stuff and enjoyed the managers reception-which is free drinks and snacks. The hotel is also conveniently located off the main road which has many souvenir shops,restaurants and a small supermarket. The best place to get puerto rican food inexpensively is La Casita which is in the shopping center near the hotel. I've also stayed at the Intercontinental hotel in the past. These two hotels are 2 that I would recomment. The advantage the Intercontinental Hotel has is that it is right on the beach. The beach is about 2 blocks from the Embassy Suites and easily accessible off the main road . Again overall I was a satisfied guest.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to PR for the first time this summer and the Embassy Suites was a great selection. I traveled with seven other females and we all loved the hotel. The staff was great, the free breakfast (made to order) was a great addition to the manager's reception (free drinks) every evening from 5-7pm. The hotel is located very close (1 to 2 blocks) to all hotels/ clubs, and the beach is about 2 blocks away. Embassy suites also has a beautiful pool and jacuzzi area, not to mention some handsome pool men:) I plan to return next year with my girls again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: POLITA
Reviews.Content: Embassy suites was a good election. Very clean. Lovely pool and very near a nice beach. I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “great get away”
Reviews.Author: happydays
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel to stay, very clean rooms large enough for family of 4. We enjoyed the managers reception and breakfast. Pool was relaxing. staff was friendly if ever in San Juan we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a trip!!”
Reviews.Author: deefree
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites in San Juan is amazing. My boyfriend and I are already planning are trip next year, but next time it will be for 10 days, not seven!!! I emailed the manager ahead of time, and he was very accommodating on sending me information about the area and things to do. He also upgraded my room to ocean view at no additional charge!! We arrived on June 26th pretty late at 10:45pm. The hotel lobby was immaculate, and the hotel clerks were very friendly. The hotel suite is great; it really makes you feel at home having two rooms. As soon as we arrived, we immediately changed to go get something to eat. My boyfriend and I were insistent on trying Puerto Rican foods and not have any fast food. One thing I'd like to worn everyone about is that gratuity is included on most checks. We didn't realize this till around the third day and had already spent around $100 extra than we should have. That Sunday night we arrived we went to the Oyster Bar around 11:30pm. It is around 1 Â½ blocks from the hotel. The place was packed and they serve food to the wee hours of the night. We shared an order of beef empanadas which were $6.95 and quite filling between both of us. The salsa music that night was slamming and we saw a wide range of people, but mostly locals on that night. On Monday morning we hit the free breakfast buffet. Monday - Friday the buffet is from 6:30am - 9:30am, sat - Sun 7:30am - 10:30am. Weekends the buffet line is packed. They have cooked to order eggs, omelets, pancakes, french toast, bacon, sausage, grits, fresh fruit, cereal, bagels, croissants and toast. They also have an assortment of juices, milk and Puerto Rican coffee which is great. There was only day which I would complain, when the cook got my order wrong and had ham in my omelet. Other than that, breakfast everyday was great. If for some reason you over sleep and miss breakfast, check out Mi Casita near the beach around 1 1/2 blocks away from the hotel. Two of us with a big breakfast and waiter service came to $10.00. After breakfast we usually headed to the pool or ocean. The pool was immaculate and they provide beach towels for you. The beach is just a short walk away, and pretty clean. Everyone there was very friendly and we went for a lot of nice walks on the beach. The management reception from 5:30pm - 7:30pm was great! You can get two drinks at a time so you don't have to stand in the long line over and over. My suggestion is to ask for the drinks in plastic cups and sit by the pool. It is a lot less crowded there, plenty of seating, beautiful view, and music. They have nachos with salsa and cheese sauce, and hot popcorn for snacking with your drinks. There were many children there, so feel free to bring your kids for non-alcoholic drinks. Just be sure to tip around $1 or $2 for every round of drinks, and the bartenders will hook you up. We went to several places for dinner, but the place I would recommend the most is called Soleil Beach Club in Pinones. There phone number is 787-253-1033. Pinones is a small restaurant/ beach /bike trail area around a 5 minute drive from the hotel. Although it is not too far, you defiently need a ride there. If you call the restaurant, they will pick you up at no charge and take you back to the hotel. The food there was amazing!! We had lobster tail and shrimp with garlic sauce the first night. We also had an appetizeter of tostones with crab. It was great, and the service and view was amazing. I am including a pic of the lobster and shrimp from our first night. Try sitting on the upper floor where the view is even prettier. We ate there twice during our stay, and the other two dinners were also in Pinones were the view can not be beat. All three restaurants that we went to in Pinones had excellent food and service. When we were at Soliel a second time we met a nice couple on the ride there from Philly and hung out with them for a few days. We also met a famous salsa singer named India at Soliel; unfortunately we were out of film that day. We went on a few tours of Puerto Rico which I would highly recommend. We went on the Bacardi tour which was a lot of fun. You receive drink tickets for two free drinks per person, but the bartender said we could have more if we wanted. The tour is free, and the only thing we paid for was the taxi. We could have taken a publico for .25 cents, but didn't feel like being on a bus for that long. Our driver waited for us while we were on the tour, and then took us to Old San Juan. There we saw El Morro, viewed a museum on San Juan, checked out all the pretty buildings, and had lunch from a street vendor. El Morro was amazing, and if youâ€™re into history you will really enjoy this. We did this activity on a cloudy day so it wasn't too hot, because you will be walking alot. The next day we did a snorkeling trip from EastWind Cats. See the concierge in the hotel for a list of these snorkeling trips. They are very accommodating. If the concierge is not there, they have a nice touch screen computer to find restaurants and tours. All of the snorkeling trips were around the same price and included lunch, snorkeling and unlimited rum punch and pina coladas. They also served snacks and the service was great. We also went on a horseback riding trip at the foot hills of the rainforest. It was very beautiful, but very hot. You have to wear pants because you are horseback riding and it feels even hotter. To save money, we really only drank in the hotel at the manager's reception. We went to the local supermarket called Puebloâ€™s and purchased alcohol to make our drinks in the room. We put them in plastic cups so that we could drink by the pool. We won 120.00 one night in the casino, but lost it the next day, so I guess we evened out. Late at night if you have the munchies and you are gambling you can get free grilled sandwiches in the casino, just ask. They are actually pretty good. My one and only complaint is that it is hard to get free drinks when your gambling, you have to hunt the servers down, and then you have to go through all this red tape which I didn't quite understand. If you ever get hungry late at night, there is a pizza restaurant called Pizza City near the Oyster Bar which serves alcohol and pizza 24 hours a day. Ask for the pizza with Chorizo. . . it is one of the best slices I ever had!! All and all, the hotel was great, lobby and pool beautiful, it was very clean and the service was great. We are already planning our next trip and plan to stay at the same place. We didn't get to see Bio-bay, Vieques, and a lot of other places which we wanted to see. If you have questions, please email me and I will be sure to answer at deefree2@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Loved Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Puerto Rico. We stayed at this hotel and we were really impressed with everything from the service to the cleanliness. The morning breakfast was good and the evening manager's reception was just as good. We ate at their restaurant and the food was really, really good. Playing at the casino was fun. The lounge was always lively. The beach is really close by. Overall our stay was a really, really pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites in San Juan is the greatest!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for two nights and our time there was too, too short! We would have stayed a week, but our schedule did not permit it. We loved the suite on the second floor which was so comfortable and clean. The room was immaculate and everything about the Embassy was to our satisfaction. The pool area was so clean and of course, the managers reception each evening was really nice. The breakfast was the highlight of the day everything you can imagine was cooked to perfection. The chef on duty and workers were so pleasant and helpful. We would definitely stay there again. Our first night, we went to dinner to the "Mi Casita" restaurant which is one block away and afterwards we walked to the Isla Verde beach nearby. The puerto rican food was cooked to perfection and the beach was just gorgeous. the next night it rained so we stayed in and dined at the Outback Steakhouse which was right inside the Embassy Suites. That was wonderful too! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Juan!

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites San Juan Hotel & Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 8000 Tartak St., Isla Verde 00979, Puerto Rico
